body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear that you and your child have been frustrated by the SmartScore, and I appreciate that you've reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

I'd like to share some information and suggestions that may help alleviate some of the frustration you and your child are experiencing.
  • 80 is a great place to start: When your child first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge your child to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit.
  • Set goals: Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you’ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL’s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.

I hope you and your child find some of these suggestions helpful. You can also visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions. I'm always happy to help!
name: SmartScore (Parents)

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

While your children will be able to practice 10 questions in each subject for free each day without a membership, there are several key features that are only available to IXL subscribers. With an IXL membership, your children will have unlimited access to content from all grade levels, and they can practice as much as they'd like each day. They will also earn virtual prizes and printable certificates as they continue practicing and mastering skills.

As a member you can also take advantage of our features such as:
  • IXL Continuous Diagnostic: The IXL Diagnostic is our newest math feature, and provides complete and up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's math level. It will assess what your child already knows and provide recommendations on what to do next and how to improve.

  • IXL Recommendations: When your child is practicing math or language arts, we provide personalized recommendations that will target trouble spots, encourage your child to challenge themselves, and explore new topics.

  • IXL Analytics: IXL Analytics allows you to easily monitor your child's progress and access detailed reports that will provide valuable insight regarding your child's trouble spots and current performance.

  • IXL SmartScore: The IXL SmartScore provides a real-time reflection of your child's fluency with each skill. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept.
For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.
closing: Let me know if you have any additional questions about IXL memberships and I will be happy to help.
name: Free vs. Membership (US/CA)

body:
We do not provide introductory lessons, as IXL is designed as a tool that children can use to practice and develop fluency in topics that they’re learning at school or at home. Although we do not offer tutorials, we do offer detailed explanations after incorrect answers. Our explanations include a step-by-step breakdown of how to answer the question, as well as descriptions of any formulas or concepts related to the question. Additionally, each explanation is specific to the actual question received.

On IXL, the focus is on active learning: students learn by jumping right into solving problems, and as they practice, IXL moves them through a progressive set of questions that adapt to their abilities. This challenges and engages students, while building their confidence and developing their curiosity.

As your children practice on IXL, you'll be able to track their progress to help you decide what skills to work on next. Just click on the Analytics tab at the top of the page and you'll be able to see a thorough analysis of your child's recent practice.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy help.

You will have the option to select the number of children and the subjects you wish to have on your membership, and you can also choose between monthly and yearly plans. You will still have unlimited access through the IXL app, as well as on any other device with an Internet connection (desktop, laptop, tablet, etc.).

body:
If you're not sure where to begin with your child, we recommend starting their practice at their current grade level and then moving to higher or lower grades as appropriate. IXL allows students to access activities from any grade level at any time. While some families search for specific topics or address specific skills, others follow the skills in the order listed.

To find your child's grade level in math, your child can take our IXL Continuous Diagnostic. While your child answers questions within the Diagnostic arena, it will assess what your child already knows and will show their level within the different math and language arts topics. Then, they can use Recommendations to access a list of skills to practice, curated just for them.

Our IXL Recommendations feature suggests math and language arts skills for students to learn in order to target their trouble spots, challenge themselves, explore new topics, and more.

Once your child has started practicing, you'll be able to review their progress with IXL Analytics, our comprehensive reporting tool.
greeting: Thank you for joining IXL! One of the benefits of IXL is that is designed to adapt to a learning plan that will best fit your child.

body:
IXL is a popular tool with homeschooling families who use IXL to help reinforce the concepts that parents introduce in their lessons.

While we do not offer introductory lessons, there are detailed explanations after incorrect answers. As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increases the level of difficulty as they improve, and provides instant feedback whenever they answer questions incorrectly.

The IXL Continuous Diagnostic will provide up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's math and language arts levels. After just a few questions you will start to see your child's level and receive recommendations. We recommend that students to answer about 60 questions for the most accurate results.

Your children will have unlimited access to IXL content from all grades, giving them the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill. You'll be able to stay up-to-date with their progress using IXL Analytics, our extensive reporting and tracking suite. With customizable settings and easy-to-understand visualizations, there is no simpler way to monitor individual student performance, improvement, and trouble spots.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.

body:
The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is our newest feature, providing complete and up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's math and language arts level. It will show what your child already knows and offers personalized recommendations on what to do next and how to improve.

To get started, click the Diagnostic tab. After just a few questions you will start to see your child's level and receive recommendations. While the IXL Continuous Diagnostic doesn’t have a designated stopping point, we recommend that students initially aim to diagnose until they reveal complete diagnostic data—for most students, this will be 100-120 questions and will include questions from both math and language arts. Your child can stop and return at any time.

body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL!

IXL is a self-paced practice environment designed to fit the needs and learning styles of students at all levels. Our flexible, web-based curriculum allows every child to have a customized experience, building their fluency and mastery in math, language arts, science, social studies, and Spanish.

IXL gives you access to all grade levels, so your child will have the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to new skills at any time.

As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations whenever they answer questions incorrectly. Your child will be able to view customized skill recommendations based on their math and language arts practice with IXL Recommendations

If you're not sure where to start in math or language arts, the IXL Continuous Diagnostic will assess what your child already knows and provide direction about what to work on next.

We also offer 10 questions for free in each subject per day so you can see if IXL is a good fit for your family. Once you have created a membership, your child will have unlimited access to practice and you will have access to IXL Analytics, which allows you to monitor how much time your child spends on IXL, the questions they answered, and the skills that have been the most challenging for them.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership Page.
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help!
name: What is IXL? (US)

Thank you for reaching out!

IXL is not set up to be shared between different families. Instead, we recommend that families purchase their own membership for the best possible experience on IXL. This gives each family greater control over their account as well as helps to ensure the security of their billing information and the confidentiality of their children's practice.

Each family membership is registered to a single e-mail address and includes one Parent profile only which allows the parent to make changes to the account. This profile will also receive all of the email reports and updates on the account, allowing you to receive direct feedback each week on your child's progress. The parent profile also stores all of the billing information, settings, and detailed Analytics for each child on the membership.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.

body:
While we don’t have a one-time placement test, IXL continually adapts to your child's needs. You can easily monitor progress and choose appropriate skills with our IXL features.

These features include:

  • IXL Continuous Diagnostic: The IXL Diagnostic, our newest feature for math and language arts, provides complete and up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's level. It will assess what your child already knows and provide recommendations on what to do next and how to improve.

  • IXL Recommendations: When your child is practicing math or language arts, we provide personalized recommendations that will target trouble spots, encourage your child to challenge themselves, and explore new topics.

  • IXL Analytics: IXL Analytics allows you to easily monitor your child's progress and access detailed reports that will provide valuable insight regarding your child's trouble spots and current performance.

  • IXL SmartScore: The IXL SmartScore provides a real-time reflection of your child's fluency with each skill. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept.

To get started, we recommend that your child begins practicing in their grade level or on a topic that they are currently learning at home or at school. You also have access to skills from all grade levels, giving you the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill.
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions, I'm always happy to help!
name: Placement Test - US

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

While we don’t have a one-time placement test, IXL continually adapts to your child's needs. You can easily monitor progress and choose appropriate skills with our IXL features.

These features include:

  • IXL Analytics: IXL Analytics allows you to easily monitor your child's progress and access detailed reports that will provide valuable insight regarding your child's trouble spots and current performance.
  • IXL SmartScore: The IXL SmartScore provides a real-time reflection of your child's fluency with each skill. After answering some questions, the SmartScore will give you an idea of your child's skill level. Earning a SmartScore of 80 indicates proficiency and a SmartScore of 100 indicates mastery.

To get started, we recommend that your child begins practicing in their grade level or on a topic that they are currently learning at home or at school. You also have access to skills from all grade levels, giving you the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill.

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

IXL is a self-paced program designed to meet the needs of a variety of learning styles. Many families that have children with special learning requirements use IXL because it is flexible and allows students to access all grade levels while practicing at their own pace. Your child will have the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to try new skills at any time.

Additionally, IXL provides the option to hide both the grade level and timer if your child is sensitive to these components. You can use the Topics menu as a guide to finding skills to practice rather than searching only by grade level.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.
closing: I am happy to discuss how IXL can best fit your child’s needs. You may call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET.

body:
IXL is a popular tool with homeschooling families who use IXL to help reinforce the concepts that parents introduce in their lessons. As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increases the level of difficulty as they improve, and provides instant feedback whenever they answer questions incorrectly.

Your children will have unlimited access to IXL content from all grades, giving them the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill. You'll be able to stay up-to-date with their progress using IXL Analytics, our extensive reporting and tracking suite. With customizable settings and easy-to-understand visualizations, there is no simpler way to monitor individual student performance, improvement, and trouble spots.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.

body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm happy to tell you more about IXL Spanish! IXL Spanish prepares learners for authentic, meaningful conversations with native speakers.

IXL Spanish includes:

  • Level 1 Spanish (beginner) practice geared toward high school and middle school students. Learners of all ages can also benefit!
  • Grammar, vocabulary, reading, and listening skills with colorful illustrations and photos that bring the language and its speakers to life.
  • Professionally recorded audio highlights with 15 different Spanish accents that expose students to the diversity of the language and prepare them for interactions with native speakers.

IXL Spanish can be added to a current membership or purchased as a stand alone product. Adding Spanish to your membership is just $5 per month or $40 per year. If you would like to purchase Spanish only, it is $9.95 per month or $79 per year.

To add Spanish to your current membership, log into your Parent profile and visit your Membership Details page.

To purchase a membership for Spanish content only, visit our Membership page.

body:
This e-mail contains details for administering the 2018 National German Exam for Levels 2, 3, and 4. For security purposes, you are receiving 2 separate emails containing the following information:

1. USERNAMES and PASSWORDS
2. SECRET WORDS

Please note that the contents of the e-mails is confidential. No student should be given access to these documents.

If you did not receive both of these emails, first check the SPAM (JUNK) folder for your email. If the missing e-mail is not there, please contact National German Exam support at help@quia.com or (877) 282-4400, press #5.

The SECRET WORDS listed below are required to access the National German Exam. Please PRINT OUT this e-mail prior to exam administration.

2018 Level 2 Listening and Viewing: essen2
2018 Level 2 Reading: trinken2

2018 Level 3 Listening and Viewing: lernen3
2018 Level 3 Reading: schreiben3

2018 Level 4 Listening and Viewing: fahren4
2018 Level 4 Reading: fliegen4

See the National German Exam ADMINISTRATION MANUAL (www.aatg.org/resource/resmgr/nge/NGEAdministrationManual_2018.pdf) for details on how to

•Log into your National German Exam Quia account
•Add students to your roster
•Change a student's exam level
•Make arrangements for students needing special accommodations
•Provide students with additional attempts
closing: Thank you for participating in the 2018 National German Exam.
name: Secret Words

body:
Technical Requirements - NGE

Thank you for contacting Quia support. At least two weeks before administering the exam on test day, we strongly recommend reviewing Quia's technical requirements at http://www.quia.com/help/tech/system-requirements.html

Please give these requirements to your school's technology department to ensure that your computers are set up correctly for the exam.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. When you log into your Quia account, the students you registered for the exam appear on the roster corresponding to the level for which they are registered.

You can update the names on the roster by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Correct the student's name
5. Click "Save changes"

The name will be updated. However, the username will not be updated. This is alright, the username is only used to log into the account and it is not displayed anywhere in the NGE results.
closing: If you have any questions, please let us know.
name: Editing Student Names - NGE

Thank you for contacting Quia. The NPE exam window opened March 1, 2018 and closes on March 31, 2018.

If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. After your students take the exam, you will be able to view their exam results.

To view exam results, follow these steps:

1. Log into your instructor Quia acount.
2. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
3. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
4. Click the reports icon next to the exam for which you would like to view results.
5. Select your report settings.
6. Click "View" to view a report of your students' results.

If you have any questions, please let me know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: View Results

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. If you need to change the level for which one of your students is registered, simply add him or her to the roster for the new exam level and ignore the entry for the original exam level. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam, so that he/she can access the correct exam.

To move students to a different level, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left.
2. Type the students' first and last names into the blank rows of the roster.
If you run out of space, click "Add more rows..." to add additional rows at the bottom.
3. When you have added all the students, click "Save changes".

A username and password will be generated for each new student and may be viewed by clicking on the "lock icon" to the right of the student's name.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: NLVE Change Student Level

body:
When you log into your Quia account, the students you registered for the exam appear on your class roster.

If you would like to register additional students to take the exam, please follow these steps:

1. Log in to http://www.quia.com/web using your NSE username and password.
2. Use the "Class" menu to go to the roster for the appropriate level exam.
3. Type the students' first and last names into the blank rows of the roster. (If you run out of space, click "Add more rows..." to add additional rows at the bottom.)
4. When you have added all the students, click "Save changes".

A username and password will be generated for each new student and can be found by clicking on the "Lock icon" next to the students name on the right after you have added and saved the student.

Please note that adding new students requires that you also pay the late fee per new student registered. An invoice will be sent to you by the NSE after the exam window closes.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nse@quia.com
name: Adding a student

body:
Thank you for contacting the National Spanish Exam. If your student’s exam was halted while attempting to listen to the audio portion, you can add an additional attempt for the student and he/she can start the exam again.

This issue occurs when students are using unsupported Safari browser versions. The technical requirements for the National Spanish Exam and list of supported browsers may be found here:

https://www.quia.com/help/tech/system-requirements.html

After adding the attempt for the student, please have the student log into the exam using one of our supported browsers.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or performance).
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know and we will be very happy to assist you.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nse@quia.com
name: SafariBrowser

body:
If Quia is performing slowly on the computers at your school, your school's network security settings may need to be adjusted. Security used to protect your school's network may be mistakenly blocking or altering data coming to and from Quia.

Please have your school's IT professional add quia.com to the list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses. Traffic from Quia should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. In addition, no content from Quia should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school. Quia should then return to its usual high performance.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. If it's more convenient, give me a call at (877)282-4400x5.  Feel free to ask for me by name.  I want to make sure you get the most out of Quia.
name: School Network Trouble

I'm happy to help you activate your group subscription!

To activate your subscription, you will need to create an account or log in to your trial account and enter your activation key. If you are part of a group subscription, you will need to contact your school's Quia coordinator to obtain the activation key.

To activate your subscription, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web.

2. Log in to your trial account or click the "Create a new account" link to create an account.

3. Once you have logged in, enter your activation key in the "Activation key" field at the top of the page and click "Go".

Your account is now activated and you should be able to create activities, pages, quizzes, and more!

body:
As long as they are required to log in to take your quiz, students can use their own Quia accounts to view the results of all their quiz attempts. To view their quiz results your students can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2) If you see a link with the name of your class, click on it. (If you don't see that link, skip this step.)
3) Look for the name of your quiz.
4) Click the black and white icon to the left of your quiz name.

A pop-up window will appear containing a summary of that student's submission for that quiz.

The amount of feedback students receive in that summary depends on the settings selected for the quiz, ranging from "Score only" to "Score, summary, and answers." The level of feedback will need to be set to at least "Score and summary" if you would like students to see the feedback and comments you've left them.
closing: If you would like more information on how to change the feedback for your quiz, or if you have any questions at all, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.
name: How do students view quiz results?

body:
I'm happy to help with your question about subscripts and superscripts.

You can use HTML to add subscripts and superscripts to Quia activities. To create superscripts, use the "sup" tag.

For example, if you want to enter 4 raised to the power of 2 you type the following:

42
OR
4<sup>2</sup>

To create subscripts, use the "sub" tag.

For example, if you want to enter the chemical formula for water type the following:

H2O
OR
H<sub>2</sub>O

Quia allows HTML in any activity field that is marked with a blue plus sign. When you use HTML, you must remember to select the "Activate HTML" check box option in the settings step of the activity editor.

For more information on what you can do with HTML tags, you can go to http://www.quia.com/help/activities/HTMLformat.html or view our tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/activity_fancy
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Subscripts/Superscripts

I am happy to help with your question about clearing time spent. Please follow these steps to clear the "Time spent" for an activity:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Activities" in the left menu.
3. Click on the "Stats" link for the activity you want to clear.
4. Select the checkbox for each student for whom you want to clear the time spent practicing.
**Select the checkbox for the class to select all the students in that class at once or select the topmost checkbox to select ALL the students who have taken the activity.
5. Click the "Actions..." menu and select "Delete". Confirm your action when prompted.

This will clear the times spent on the activity and allow students to begin accumulating new practice data.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.

I am happy to help with your question about adding questions to your quiz. To insert specific questions from your Question Bank into your quiz, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Quizzes" in the left menu.
3. Click the "Advanced" link near the top of the page to switch to the Advanced Quiz Editor.
4. Click "Create a new quiz", or click the "Edit" link for a quiz you want to modify.
5. In "Section 2: Questions" choose "One or more specific questions (from the Question Bank)" from the "Insert" list.
6. In the window that opens, search for the questions you want to add (if the window does not open, you may have a "pop-up blocker" turned on).
7. Select the check boxes for the questions you want to insert into your quiz and click "Add selected questions to quiz" at the bottom of the page.

Quia returns you to your quiz, where you will see that the questions have been added.

For more information on Quia's Advanced quizzes and adding questions from the question bank, we have a tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_advanced you might be interested in.

body:
To clear your gradebook and begin the new school year, let your old class expire and create a brand new class. You can copy over the class page, assignments, etc., to this new class to save yourself some time. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2) Click "Classes" in the left menu.
3) Click the "Create a new class" button.
4) Fill out the form (make sure to enter an end date) and click "Submit".
5) Click "Classes" in the left menu.
6) Locate your old class and click the "Edit" link.
7) Enter this class' actual end date.
8) Scroll to the bottom of the page and check the box next to the name of the new class that you created in step 4.
9) Click "Save changes".

Your old class will expire, but all of its assignments and customizations will be copied over to your newly created class.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Creating new class from old class

body:
To add events to your calendar in Quia, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Calendar" in left menu.
3. In the new window that opens, click the "Add Event" link located near the top-right corner.
4. Enter all the event details, including the date, time, and which classes it should apply to, then click "Done".
5. Repeat steps 3-4 until you've added all events to your calendar, then close the calendar window.

To make your calendar accessible to your students from their class Web page, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
3. Locate the class that you want to give access to your calendar and click its "Edit" link.
4. In the "Additional options" section, select the check box for the option that allows you to include a calendar for the class.
5. Click "Save changes".
6. Repeat steps 3-5 for any other classes on whose pages you'd like to include a calendar link.

To learn more about creating classes and linking your calendar to class Web pages, you can view our tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_edit
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.

Thank you for contacting Quia. You can substitute a student, and as long as the number of students that take the exam is the same as the number you registered for, you will not be charged an additional fee.

If you need to substitute a student, simply add him or her to the roster for the appropriate level and ignore the entry for the original student. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam. As long as the original student does not take the exam, you will not be charged an additional fee.

To substitute a student, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Type the student's first and last names into a blank row of the roster
5. When you have added the student, click "Save changes"

A username and password will be generated for the new student. Click the lock icon next to the username to view the password.

Simply ignore the entry for the original student.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Substitute a student - NGE

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National German Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt.
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.
closing: If you have any questions, please let us know.
name: Adding additional attempts - NGE

body:
I see you currently have a mobile subscription through iTunes, but the membership option you are interested in is only available directly through our website, IXL.com.

IXL.com offers the most customizable and cost-effective memberships. You will have the option to select the number of children and the subjects you wish to have on your membership, and you can also choose between monthly and yearly plans. You will still have unlimited access through the IXL app, as well as on any other device with an Internet connection (desktop, laptop, tablet, etc.).

Before creating your new membership, first cancel the IXL membership you have through iTunes. To cancel, please follow Apple's cancellation instructions.

After you have canceled through iTunes, you can create the customized membership on our website's Membership page. We can also transfer your children's practice data, awards, and personalized recommendations to the new membership, so they can resume practicing where they left off. Let me know the username of the new membership and I’ll complete the data transfer.

If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you. You may also call us at (855) 255-8800, Monday through Friday, from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Eastern Time, and please feel free to ask for me by name.
name: Leaving mobile for web explanation
versions:
Thank you for speaking with me today. I’m happy to help transition your family to customizable membership through IXL.com.

Before creating your new membership, first cancel the IXL subscription you have through iTunes. To cancel, please follow Apple's cancellation instructions.

After you have canceled through iTunes, you can create the customized membership on our website's Membership page.

We can also transfer your children's practice data, awards, and personalized recommendations to the new membership, so they can resume practicing where they left off. Let me know the username of the new membership and I’ll complete the data transfer.

Let me know if I can help any further.

While mobile subscriptions through iTunes only allow two children, you can have additional children on memberships purchased directly through ﻿IXL.com.

IXL.com offers the most customizable and cost-effective memberships. You will have the option to select the number of children and the subjects you wish to have on your membership, and you can also choose between monthly and yearly plans. You will still have unlimited access through the IXL app, as well as on any other device with an Internet connection (desktop, laptop, tablet, etc.).

Before creating your new membership, first cancel the IXL membership you have through iTunes. To cancel, please follow Apple's cancellation instructions.

After you have canceled through iTunes, you can create the customized membership on our website's Membership page. We can also transfer your children's practice data, awards, and personalized recommendations to the new membership, so they can resume practicing where they left off. Let me know the username of the new membership and I’ll complete the data transfer.

If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you. You may also call us at (855) 255-8800, Monday through Friday, from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Eastern Time, and please feel free to ask for me by name.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. If you need to change the level for which one of your students is registered, simply add him or her to the roster for the new exam level and ignore the entry for the original exam level. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam, so that he/she can access the correct exam.

To move students to a different level, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left.
2. Type the students' first and last names into the blank rows of the roster. If you run out of space, click "Add more rows..." to add additional rows at the bottom.
3. When you have added all the students, click "Save changes".

A username and password will be generated for each new student and you will see them by clicking on the "lock icon" on the right in the Roster area.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Student in the wrong level - NGE

body:
I'm contacting you because it looks like you have not yet cancelled the IXL subscription you purchased through iTunes. Now that you have a new account through the IXL website, it's important to cancel your mobile subscription so that you aren't double-charged.

To cancel your mobile subscription, please follow these Cancellation instructions from Apple.

Any refund requests for mobile subscriptions must be submitted directly to iTunes. To contact Apple support regarding a refund for your subscription, you can use their Report a Problem form.

For further assistance with your mobile subscription, you can contact Apple Support at (800) APL-CARE (800-275-2273).
closing: Let me know if I can help any further.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. You can substitute a student, and as long as the number of students that take the exam is the same as the number you registered for, you will not be charged an additional fee.

If you need to substitute a student, simply add him or her to the roster for the appropriate level and ignore the entry for the original student. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam. As long as the original student does not take the exam, you will not be charged an additional fee.

To substitute a student, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Type the student's first and last names into a blank row of the roster
5. When you have added the student, click "Save changes"
A username and password will be generated for the new student. Click the lock icon next to the username to view the password.
Simply ignore the entry for the original student.

If you have any questions, please let me know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: Substitute a student

Thank you for contacting Quia. It sounds like your lab may not have enough bandwidth for all of your students to take the exam at the same time. We recommend that for each student that is taking the test, your connection has 80kbps of bandwidth. If you have 25 students, you would want to have 2mbps of bandwidth. Keep in mind that if there are multiple classes at your school taking it at the same time, the amount of bandwidth that your school will grow proportionately. You can go to www.speakeasy.net/speedtest to test your download bandwidth. Choose "San Francisco, CA" as the location you want to test your speed for to get an accurate idea of your speeds.

You may also contact us via phone at 877-282-4400, x5 for technical support.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Italian Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or proficiency).
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: Adding an additional attempt

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help!
body:
To export quiz results from your Quia Web account, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Quizzes" in the left menu.
3. Locate the appropriate quiz and click the upward-pointing arrow icon for it.
4. Select the appropriate options and click "Export".

Quia will prompt you to save a copy of students' quiz results to your computer. The file will be in .CSV (comma-separated value) format. This format can be imported into Microsoft Excel and into most learning management systems or gradebook programs.

I also want to let you know that Quia provides detailed reports with intuitive graphical representations of your students' quiz results. You can print these reports in addition to exporting the raw data.

For more information on the types of reports Quia offers, you can find a tutorial here:

http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_reports helpful
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Exporting Quiz Results

body: Posting materials on Quia is just like posting them to any other website.  It is considered acceptable to link to others' copyrighted materials, but not to make a copy of them and post them to your own site outside of Quia.  Likewise, you should assume whatever materials of your own you post online can be viewed and "borrowed" by anyone in the world (unless it's part of a Quia quiz to which you have restricted access).

We've recently released Spanish Level 1, beginner Spanish, which includes:

  • Practice geared toward high school and middle school students. Learners of all ages can also benefit!
  • Grammar, vocabulary, reading, and listening skills with colorful illustrations and photos that bring the language and its speakers to life.
  • Professionally recorded audio highlights with 15 different Spanish accents that expose students to the diversity of the language and prepare them for interactions with native speakers.

We do not have any current plans to extend our coverage to other levels.

body:
I understand you have a question about adding line breaks.

When you enter advanced HTML tags on Quia or create a Text/HTML field in a quiz, any hard returns (pressing your "Enter" key) or other white space (tabbing or using the spacebar) is ignored, since it may interfere with your formatting.

To include the line breaks in your text, you can enter a br tag (which can be typed as:
or <br>) where you want the line break to appear. Using more than one in a row will insert extra spaces between lines.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Adding Linebreak in HTML

To archive your quiz results and reset the hit counter, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.

3. Check the boxes to the right of each quiz you want to archive.

To view these results later, scroll past the list of quizzes and view the archived results in the "Archived Quiz Results" folder. Click the folder to open it and then click the "View" link to view the archived results.

body:
I am happy to help with your question about rewards.

There are a few different types of rewards that can be earned on IXL. Medals and certificates are awarded periodically as children practice. Awards, though, are acquired after specific challenges are met. These challenges vary, with some requiring children to master a certain number of skills in a category, or to practice a certain number of questions. Completing a challenge will allow children to reveal that prize on the awards board.

To see which challenges are available to earn a math award, go to Learning in your account and click Awards. Select Math awards beneath the tabs, and hover your cursor over any of the squares marked with a question mark. You will then see the challenge required to unlock that prize. Some challenges are not available to be unlocked until an earlier challenge has been completed. For example, "Complete 200 questions" is not available until after the award for "Complete 100 questions" has been earned.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Why didn't I win an award? (Math)

IXL is a fully web-based program, and as a result, we don't provide any worksheets, or downloadable or printable material. This also includes our app, which requires an internet connection to access.

Instead of requiring you to grade and manage worksheets, IXL tracks every child’s practice so that you can freely monitor their progress with our comprehensive reports. In addition, as children practice, IXL adapts questions to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations when children answer questions incorrectly.

body:
If you log in to your account and click "Quizzes" from the left-side menu, you can assign quizzes and set distribution options by clicking the "Assign" link for the appropriate quiz.

From here you will be able to define and set the following parameters for your quiz:

Classes - You can make your quiz available to anyone or limit it to certain classes by selecting the check boxes for the appropriate class(es). To limit it to one or more classes, you'll first need to set up class rosters if you haven't done this already.

Presentation style - Choose to show questions all at once or one at a time.

Anonymity - Require student names to access the quiz, make names optional, or do not ask for names.

Feedback - Choose how much feedback students see when they submit their responses, including whether or not they see the answers.

Attempts permitted - You can set a limit on the number of times a student can take the quiz, and which score to include in the gradebook.

Time limit - Limit the amount of time students have to complete the quiz. Students will see a countdown timer while they are taking the quiz.

Allow access - Set a date and time range that your quiz will be available to students.

Secret word - Set a secret word or password that students must enter in order to take your quiz.

Security - Enable settings that prevent students from copying questions or answers to other accounts or into other applications.

Below the Global settings section, you can set distribution options per class or even for particular students, as needed. When you are finished setting distribution options, click "Done" at the bottom of the page.

We have an excellent tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_options that explains quiz distribution settings and the control they offer in greater detail.
closing: If you have any questions about the distribution options available for Quia quizzes or anything else in Quia, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Quiz Assigning Options

Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Spanish Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or performance).
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nse@quia.com
name: Adding an additional attempt

I understand you have a question about using Quia with your LMS.

While there is not a way to directly integrate Quia with other LMS programs, Quia does provide tools to export materials that can then be easily uploaded to other programs. For example, quizzes, quiz results, class grades, etc. can all be exported as CSV spreadsheets which are easily edited and imported into many other programs. In addition, Quia provides an import tool that allows members to upload pre-formatted quiz questions to their account all at once. This makes it possible to upload questions into Quia and to share quizzes with other colleagues that use Quia as well, and we have a lot of reports that you can use as tracking tools.

I'm happy to help you hide grade levels in IXL to meet the needs of your students. To hide grade levels, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Setting section and select the Hide grade levels check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.

5) Direct your students to sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin. Otherwise, they will see the actual grade levels on the IXL home page.

Once your students sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin, the grade levels will be hidden. When the grade levels are hidden pre-K becomes "Level A", kindergarten becomes "Level B", etc.

body:
In place of traditional assessment and placement tests, we have developed a unique IXL Diagnostic. The IXL Diagnostic is designed to give you a snapshot of each of your students’ working grade levels. It also groups students working at similar levels and can show the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups, allowing you to plan for small-group instruction. It tells you exactly what students know and what to do next to to help them improve.

In order to get started with the IXL Diagnostic, students can begin by signing in to their accounts and clicking Diagnostic at the top of the page. We recommend that students initially aim to diagnose until they reveal complete Diagnostic data. For most students this will be about 60-90 questions, which don’t have to be done in one sitting. The amount of questions needed to diagnose will also vary based on each student’s performance and existing practice results, as previous student practice will be taken into account. Once the student has finished the Diagnostic, we recommend students answer about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep the Diagnostic up to date.

The Diagnostic level indicates a student’s working grade level. For example, a level of 500 indicates readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills. All student levels start as a range while the Diagnostic continues to narrow down that data as the student diagnoses. When the Diagnostic has enough information to pinpoint the student's level, it will appear as a single number.

body:
I understand you have a question about ads appearing when practicing on IXL. IXL does not include any banners or advertisements at all. Any ads you see are caused by adware, a form of software that can infect your computer. When these types of programs infect your computer, they will display banners and advertisements on any website at any time, including IXL. You can avoid ads by signing in to your account on any uninfected computer, but I strongly recommend that you download an adware removal program so that you can eliminate this software from your system.

There are many varieties of adware removal software available online. While we do not officially recommend any, some of our members have had success with LavaSoft Ad-Aware. Ad-Aware is an adware and malware removal program that can be downloaded to your computer for free here:

www.LavaSoft.com

Once you download the program and run it on your computer, you should not see any more ads or banners while practicing on IXL.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Remove adware

body:
If your students' quizzes are appearing as "In Progress" then that means that they did not submit or save their work. When they do submit their work, they will always see a confirmation page that states "Thank you. Your quiz has been submitted". If they save their work to complete later instead, they must make sure to click “Done” immediately after clicking "Save for later", or else their attempt will not be saved. If students did not submit their work or save it to complete later, there is no way to recover it.

However, if your quiz's presentation style was set to display "one question at a time", students would have been required to submit each answer before proceeding to the next question. This would save each question they answered to our servers. In this case you will be able to recover their answers to the questions they did submit.

To check if your students' work was partially submitted to Quia and grade their quizzes, you must first wait until their grades are no longer shown as "In progress" and instead have switched to "Abandoned", which takes approximately 6 hours. After the quizzes appear as "Abandoned" in your grading workbench, you can follow these steps to manually grade your students' attempts:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3. Click "Grade" next to your quiz.
4. Scroll down to the "Student Summary" section.
5. Locate one of your student's abandoned quiz attempts.
6. Click the pencil icon to the left of their name.
7. Confirm that you would like to submit your student’s incomplete quiz attempt.
8. Click "Submit" at the bottom of the page.

Your student's incomplete quiz attempt can now be graded and submitted as if the student had submitted his or her work normally.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Japanese Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Log into your instructor Quia account.
2. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
3. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or proficiency).
4. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
5. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nje@quia.com
name: Adding an additional attempt

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. It sounds like your lab may not have enough bandwidth for all of your students to take the exam at the same time. We recommend that for each student that is taking the test, your connection has 80kbps of bandwidth. If you have 25 students, you would want to have 2mbps of bandwidth. Keep in mind that if there are multiple classes at your school taking it at the same time, the amount of bandwidth that your school will grow proportionately. You can go to www.speakeasy.net/speedtest to test your download bandwidth. Choose "San Francisco, CA" as the location you want to test your speed for to get an accurate idea of your speeds.

You may also contact us via phone at 877-282-4400, x5 for technical support.

Let us know if you have any questions and we will be happy to assist you.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nse@quia.com
name: Bandwidth

To start the new school year you can clear your old roster and add your new students. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.
3) Scroll to the bottom of your roster and click the Clear roster link.
4) Confirm your choice and your students will be removed.

Once your roster has been cleared, you will see an empty row where you can add a new student. If you already have students on your roster you may need to click Add students at the bottom right corner of your roster to make the empty row appear. As you save each new student to your roster, that student's account will be created and a username and password will be displayed.

To make things easier for you next year, you can set your school year start date so that a "Clear roster" banner will appear when your next school year begins. To set the start date, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the Profile and settings window that opens.
4) Enter the correct First day of school in the space provided.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

As the First day of school date approaches, you will see a Clear roster button appear at the top of the page whenever you visit your roster. Clicking on this button will remove all of your students from your roster at once and will allow you to start adding students for your new school year.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

I understand you would like to add a corporate banner to your account.

With your Quia account, you can determine how you want the banner at the top of your activities, quizzes, and surveys to appear. You can use the Quia banner, your own HTML banner, or no banner at all.

Your banner must be in the format of an HTML file. If you have an image you want to use as your banner, use the sample below as a guide. When you create your version, substitute "username" with your actual username and "yourlogo.gif" with your own image file. Use a text editor, such as Notepad, to create the file and save it with an extension of ".html". We recommend that the width of your banner be 760 pixels.





Once you have created the file containing your version of the sample text above, you can apply your banner to your Quia page. To apply the banner, you must first upload the HTML banner file, along with its linked image file, to your account using the File manager. You can access your File manager by clicking "Files" in the left menu.

Once you have uploaded your file, you can select it as your banner. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Log in and go to the Corporate settings section:

If you are part of a group corporate subscription and have a link called "Admin Tools" in the left menu, click on that link and then scroll to the "Corporate Settings" section.

If you are not part of a group subscription, you can click the "Account" link at the top of your page and scroll until you see the "Corporate Settings" section.

2. Select the blank field and click "Browse".

3. Select the file, then click "Save changes".

Quia will now display your banner above all activities, quizzes, and surveys you create.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Corporate Banner

body:
I’m sorry to hear that you and your child have been frustrated by the scoring, and I appreciate that you’ve reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

I’d like to share some information and suggestions that may help alleviate some of the frustration you and your child are experiencing.

For you:
  • What is a SmartScore? The SmartScore is an up-to-the-minute measure of a student’s progress toward mastery, so you can think of 0-70 as practicing or learning a skill, 71-90 as refining a skill with questions of mid- and high-level rigor, and 91-100 as working through difficult questions to cement mastery. As a result, the SmartScore will go up and down at different rates as your child progresses through a skill.
  • 80 is a great place to start: When your child first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge your child to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit.
  • Set goals: Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
For your child:
  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you’ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL’s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.
I hope you and your child find some of these suggestions helpful. You can visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore explained (parent)

I understand you have a question about importing material from other sources into Quia quizzes.

To import questions into your Question Bank, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Go to the "Question Bank" page by clicking the link in the left menu.
3. Click "Import questions".
4. Click "Browse" to select a file of questions to import. Be sure that you use the correct file format. Information about the correct file format can be found here:

http://www.quia.com/help/activities/manager/importtextfile.html

5. Once you have selected the desired file, click "Import".

Quia will add the questions to your Question Bank and you will then be able to insert them into quizzes.

From this page, you can also import questions from Quia activities you have created. This option is displayed below the "Import Questions from a Text File" section.

You can also import word lists you can use to create Matching, Word Search, Flashcards, and Concentration activities. To import a word list to create these activities, please follow these steps:

1. Click "Activities" in the left menu.
2. Click the "Import a word list" link.
3. Click "Browse" to select a file of words to import. Be sure that you use the correct file format. Information about the correct file format can be found here:

http://www.quia.com/help/activities/import.html

4. Once you have selected the desired file, enter an activity title and click "Import".

Quia will add the word list to the activity template and create a set of activities.

To track the time your students spend practicing your activities, you must first assign the activities you want to track to a class. To do this, click "Activities" in the left menu, then click the "Assign" link for each activity you want to assign. When prompted, select the check boxes for the appropriate classes and click "Done."

Now, when students log in to their accounts and practice these activities, Quia will record their practice time in their specific class gradebook. Use this data to review which activities your students love, who is spending a lot of time practicing, and the impact of your activities on student performance. Note that it may take several minutes for activity statistics to display on this page after a student plays the activity.

body:
I am happy to help with images.

To optimize the appearance of your images in Quia, we recommend the following image sizes (in pixels) for each type of activity. Quia will crop an image if it is larger than the recommended size.

Matching With text: 110 x 55
Without text: 110 x 75
Concentration With text: 110 x 35
Without text: 110 x 55
Flashcards Large: 245 x 150
Small: 120 x 75

To check or modify the size of an image on a Windows PC, follow these steps:

1. Open the image using MS Paint (In Windows, click Start->Accessories->Paint).
2. Hit Ctrl and E on your keyboard which shows you the height and width.
3. If necessary, you can change the size to meet the above-mentioned guidelines and click "OK".

On a Mac, you can re-size your images by using iPhoto and following these
steps:

1. Open the image using iPhoto on your Mac.
2. Click the "File" menu and select "Export..."
3. Change the width and height values to a smaller size. 110 X 93 should
work well and you can always adjust this later if necessary.
4. Click the "Export" button.

Macintosh computers running version OS X 10.10 or 10.11, will want to use the link below to resize an image using Preview.

https://support.apple.com/kb/PH5936?locale=en_US
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.

Thank you for contacting Quia Web Support. You may configure your quiz "Assign" options for a specific "Class" and/or "Student." From "Quizzes," click on "Assign" for the quiz you want to edit. From here, scroll down past the "Global Settings" to "Class level settings."

At "Class level settings" you may change the configuration for the quiz assigned to one class and not affect other classes the same quiz is assigned. You can change the "Secret word," number of attempts, date available, etc., by finding the specific class and making the change/s. When finished click "Done" to save.

You may also make specific changes to the quiz for an individual student/s. This is typically used for a student who has missed a quiz, needs another attempt or is an IEP student. Here are the steps to configure the quiz for specific student/s.

1. Once logged into your account, click on Quizzes.
2. Find the quiz and click on "Assign."
3. Scroll down to "Class level settings."
4. Find the specific class and click on "[click to change]" where you see "Student-level settings: None [click to change]."
5. Please do not uncheck the boxes next to students' names. Leave the boxes checked next to each student's name or else you will disable the quiz for each student whose name you uncheck.
6. Find the specific student/s and make the necessary change. ( ie.: For "timed quizzes" you can add more time for a student/s, or add another attempt, etc.)
7. Click "Done" to save.

Changes made in the "Class Level Settings" will override the settings above in the "Global Settings" area.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.
name: Class/Student Level Settings

body:
Based on your description of the issue, it sounds like security used to protect your school’s network may be mistakenly blocking or altering data coming to and from IXL. Please have your school’s IT professional add this list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses:

www.ixl.com
api.ixl.com
ixl.com
cloudflare.com
cloudflaressl.com
optimizely.com

Traffic from IXL should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. If needed, we have a list of common firewalls and the steps for adding trusted sites to them here.

In addition, no content from IXL should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school.

Once your school's network settings have been updated, clear the browser's cache on all of the affected browsers so that students are able to see the problems on IXL again. If students are using Chromebooks, please have students restore their browser settings in Chrome while signed in to their Google accounts instead. Here's a link I found that might be useful that shows how to reset the settings on your student's Chromebooks:

https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/3296214
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If you prefer, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. I am happy to help.
name: Network difficulties

body:
There are two enrollment types for your Quia classes--"Instructor enroll" and "Student self-enroll."

With "Instructor enroll," you add each student to your class roster. Upon saving your roster, Quia automatically generates a username and password for each student. You will be able to see your students' passwords with the click of a button. Students will not need to enter a class code with the "Instructor enroll" option. We recommend this enrollment type for younger groups of students.

With the "Student self-enroll" option, Quia will provide you with a class code for students to enter when enrolling. This enrollment process may be more useful if you have older students who can create their own accounts and remember their own usernames and passwords.

You can find even more information about the differences between the two enrollment options at http://www.quia.com/tutorclass.html

To create a class in Quia, log in at http://www.quia.com/web and follow these steps:

1. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
2. Click "Create a New Class".
3. Enter a name for your class and an end date, then choose what type of enrollment it will use.
4. Click "Submit".

You will now see the Class Editor, where you can enter messages for your class, assign quizzes and activities, and much more!

Although all the tutorials in our Tutorial Center are useful (and can be reached by clicking "Tutorial Center" in the left menu when you are logged in), the tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_intro will help introduce you to how powerful a tool classes can really be.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Class Enrollment Types/Creating Classes

While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the older school account will now be transferred to the newer account. To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the new account, I will first need the following:

1) E-mail permission from your child’s older school along with the older username originally provided by that school.
2) E-mail permission from your child’s new school with the new username your child will be using.

While permission cannot come from your child’s former and new teachers, they will be able to request this transfer from the principal or other designated staff member on your behalf. Please ask each school to include the case number CASENUMBER in their e-mails. Once I have received an e-mail from both schools at help@ixl.com giving me permission to move the information over to the school account, I will be able to transfer the data.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia Web Support. I will be happy to assist you.

If your students were logged into your quiz and their computers froze, or, they lost connection to the internet, the Quia Web program will go out and attempt to recover the student's submission and/or what the student entered before the incident. However, this can take up to 8 hours to accomplish. I suggest you log back into your account in 8 hours and you should be able to click on "Grade" and on the "pencil icon" next to the student's name to force a submission and see where the student left off before losing connection to the network.

However, if you do not see any submissions or "Abandoned," this means nothing was saved and/or recovered.
closing: Please let me know if you have further questions or need any assistance.
name: Student In-Quiz Lost Connection

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help!
body:
The feedback that your students receive on their quiz results can be changed at any time and ranges from showing "No feedback" to showing "Score, summary, and answers". To change the feedback that your students receive on a quiz, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2) Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3) Click "Assign" for the quiz you are interested in.
4) Scroll down to "Global settings".
5) On the line titled "Feedback", select the option you prefer from the drop-down menu.
6) Scroll to the bottom of the page and click "Done".

You can change the level of feedback your students see at any time. For instance, when your students first take your quiz you can set the feedback to "Score only". When your students log in to their accounts to view the results of their quiz attempts, they will only be able to view their scores.

Then when students have all completed the quiz and you would like them to receive additional feedback, you can follow these steps again and select, for example, "Score, summary, and answers". If your students return to view their quiz results again, they will be able to see a summary of the questions they answered and the answers you’ve provided for each question in addition to the scores they’ve earned.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Change Feedback

body:
I am happy to help with your questions regarding creating classes on your roster. You can separate the students on your roster into classes. This will help you manage your classes separately when viewing reports.

To create classes and assign students to those classes, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.
3) Click Start using classes on the right side of the page, just above your roster. If this link is unavailable, it has already been clicked and you can skip to step 6.
4) Type in a name for each class you would like to create.
5) Click Submit.

Your classes have now been created.

6) Click on the blank space in a student's Class column to choose a class in which to place that student.
7) Click Save after you have selected the class.
8) To create a new class, click on the blank space in a student's Class column and click Add a class.

You can repeat steps 6 and 7 to place any number of students from your roster in each class.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist!
name: Create classes/add students

body:
It sounds like you are using the Safari browser to access IXL from your iPad.

The IXL iPad app, available for free in the App Store, is the best way to practice on the iPad. The Safari browser on the iPad is not supported by IXL and our app is designed for a much more mobile-friendly format. If you use the app instead of our full site on the Safari browser, it will resolve this issue and provide a much smoother experience while practicing with your tablet!

You can download our app for free by searching the App Store for "IXL practice" or by visiting our home page on your iPad and tapping on the link at the top of the page for the app.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Safari on iPad (use APP!)

body:
While Quia hosts Navy BMR quizzes, you can contact Navy BMR directly to ask about and obtain your student account username and password.

If you have questions associated with the website http://navybmr.com/ or NAVIT, you can contact Navy BMR technical support at navybmrtechsupport@gmail.com and inquire about how you can access the quizzes to which you have purchased access.

You may also contact Navy BMR on their Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/NavyBMR/
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions and I will be happy to assist you in any way that I can.
