body:
The quizzes on Quia are completely supported on mobile devices. Some activities, however, utilize Adobe Flash and may not be supported on certain products, such as the Apple iPhone and iPad.

For some of the Quia activities that utilize Flash (Challenge Board, Hangman, and Rags to Riches), you can hide the Flash version of the activity and display the HTML version instead. This will allow you to play these activities on any mobile device, including Apple products! To change one of these activities from the Flash to HTML version, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Activities" in your left menu.
3. Click the "Edit" link for a Flash-based activity.
4. Scroll down to the "Advanced (optional section)" and type "HF" in one of the blank fields provided.
5. Click the "Done" button.

Your students will now be able to practice this activity using the HTML version on their phone or tablet.

Battleship activities require Flash, and are the only content on Quia that cannot be used on mobile devices that don’t support Flash.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist!
name: Mobile compatibility

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.  I am happy to help!
body:
You can access your archived quiz results at any time by following these steps:

1. Log in to your account at http://www.quia.com/web.
2. Click on "Quizzes" from the left menu.
3. Scroll down past your quiz titles and click on the "Archived Quiz Results" folder.

From here, you can click on the "View" link next to a specific quiz title to view your archived results.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Looking Up Archived Quiz Results

body:
Thank you for sending me your school's IP addresses. We have temporarily whitelisted your school so that you will stop seeing the captcha messages.

In three weeks we will remove your school's IP addresses from our whitelist. In the vast majority of cases, this should not cause any interruptions in your students' and teachers' access to IXL. It usually takes about two weeks for an IP address' status to be cleared and stop showing the captcha messages.

In order to make sure that you don't experience any interruption in your service, I will be happy to perform some tests with you before we remove your IP address from our whitelists. If you have some time from Monday to Friday between 8am and 5pm Pacific Time, please let me know when you would like to set up an appointment to test your access to IXL. We can temporarily remove your IP addresses from our whitelists and test access to IXL to ensure there will be no difficulties in the future.

Thank you for working with us as we continue our ongoing effort to maintain the security and reliability of our website.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you soon.
name: IP whitelisted

body:
While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the school account will be transferred to your family account. However, this will mean that progress in the school account will be cleared, so we do need permission from the school to make this transfer.

To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the family account, I will first need e-mail permission from your child’s school along with the username of the account provided by that school. Please ask PRIMARYCONTACTNAME to e-mail help@ixl.com and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} in their e-mail.

Once we have permission from PRIMARYCONTACTNAME, the next step is for you to purchase a new IXL family membership and create a new username and password. After you provide me with this information, I will be happy to transfer the practice data for you.

For pricing information and to purchase a family membership, please click here:

https://www.ixl.com/membership/family/subscribe
closing: If you have any questions in the meantime, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
name: Data swap: Parent - Bulk to Family

body: If you would like, you can use HTML tags to format text in text fields where Quia recognizes HTML.  These fields are marked with a blue plus sign.  You can find information about basic HTML tags, such as bolding or underlining text at http://www.quia.com/help/activities/HTMLformat.html or you can view our tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/activity_fancy
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: HTML to underline/bold/italicize

body:
I understand you have a question about adding an audio file.

This problem appears to come up whenever using the "Insert" menu to add audio to quizzes. However, you should be able to work around this by using the "Get audio" button in your questions, instead. To use this feature to add audio, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2) Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3) Click the "Edit" link for the appropriate quiz.
4) Click "Other options" at the bottom of the question that uses audio.
5) Click "Get audio" and follow the prompts to add audio to the question.

By adding audio to the question instead of adding it separately using the "Insert" menu, you will be able to work around the security that has been blocking your attempts to add audio to your quiz. We are working now to find a way to fix using the "Insert" menu, as well.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!
name: Add Audio file to Quia Questions

body:
While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the family account will be transferred to the school account. This will mean that progress in the family account will be cleared and moved to the school account, so we do need permission from the school to make this transfer.

To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the new account, I will first need e-mail permission from your child’s school along with the new username your child will be using.

While permission cannot come from your child’s teachers, they will be able to request this transfer from the principal or other designated staff member on your behalf. Please ask the school to include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} in their e-mails. Once I have received an e-mail from the school at help@ixl.com giving me permission to move the information over to the school account, I will be able to transfer the data.
closing: If you have any questions in the meantime, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
name: Data swap: Parent - Family to Site

body:
The captcha messages you are seeing are being displayed because our server security is misinterpreting traffic from your school as malicious. We can temporarily allow your school's traffic through our security, although we will need to work with your network administrator to find a permanent fix.

Please have your network administrator write to help@ixl.com to provide me with the public-facing IP addresses used by the computers at your school.

Once I hear from your network administrator, I can help ensure that you do not see any further captcha messages. Then we will work with your admin to make sure they don't come back.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. Feel free to ask for me by name. I am happy to help.
name: Cloudflare captcha bypass

body:
I'm happy to assist with your question about how to assign skills.You can assign skills to your students by highlighting them from our practice pages. Skills can be assigned to all of your classes and students by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Learning at the top of the page, then choose a subject (e.g. Math or Science).
3) Click to select an appropriate grade from the tabs on the left. This opens the list of all skills available in that grade.
4) Move your mouse to the left of the graph icon () of a skill you wish to assign. An outline of a star () will become visible.
5) Click the star to color it gold and highlight that skill for students to practice.

When your students sign in to IXL.com and view their skills, they will see stars next to the skills you have selected. Also, if they practice from their iPad apps, they will see these skills highlighted.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

If you would like to practice questions for any subject on IXL as a guest, you can visit IXL.com and practice up to 10 questions per day. If you would like to have unlimited access to our other subjects, however, please ask your teacher to see if they plan to add more subjects in the future.

body:
I'm happy to help with your question about the app not loading properly. You should be able to fix the problem by reinstalling the latest version of the app. To do so, please uninstall the app, restart your device, and reinstall the app onto your tablet.

You can find steps to uninstall the app on an Android tablet here. If you're using a Kindle, please follow the steps here to uninstall your app.

In addition, I strongly recommend that you upgrade to the latest version of Android OS to make sure that IXL performs at its best. You can find steps to update your Android OS here.

If you reinstall the app and still cannot answer questions, please provide me with your tablet's name, product number and current Android operating system. This information will help me investigate further.
closing: Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.
name: Android app crashing (update)

body:
I am happy to help you share quizzes.

Your quizzes can each be copied to a colleague's account one at a time, exported as a collection of questions from your Question Bank, or, if you would like everything copied, I can copy all of your Quia content (quizzes, activities, files, etc.) to your colleague's account at once.

Any quiz can be copied one at a time by logging in to your account at http://www.quia.com/web and clicking the link for the quiz you'd like to copy. Once you've clicked the quiz link, a "Tools" box will appear on the right-hand side. You can click the “Copy this to my account” link and a duplicate of the quiz will appear in your account. This link will always be visible as long as the “My Tools” box has not been disabled in the quiz assignment options. If the box is not appearing, let me know and I can provide steps to enable it.

Another method of sharing quiz questions is to export them. Once you export them, you can share the file with your colleague who can then import the file to his or her Quia account. Exporting quiz questions allows them to keep any labels you have applied to them. To export questions, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Question Bank" in your left menu.
3. Click the name of your quiz in the list of quizzes that appears near the bottom of your page.
4. Check the box next to the questions that you would like to export. If you would like to export the entire quiz, check the box at the top of the list of questions to select them all at once.
5. Select "Export selected questions" from the "Actions..." menu at the top of the list.

Your questions will now be exported as a text file. You can now share this file with your colleague or e-mail it. Once your colleague has the file, it can be imported into another Quia account by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Question Bank" in your left menu.
3. Click the "Import questions" button near the top of the page.
4. Click the "Choose file" button.
5. Select the text file with the quiz questions.
6. Click "Open".

Your quiz questions will now be added to your colleague's Question Bank. If your colleague would like assistance creating quizzes with questions found in the Question Bank, let me know and I'll be happy to provide instructions.

If you’d like me to copy your entire account instead (including activities, quizzes, surveys, and files), let me know and I will gladly provide additional information.
closing: Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to assist.
name: Share Quizzes with other teachers

You can edit your class information, post a message for your class, assign or remove Quia quizzes or activities from the class Web page, update any useful links, and edit any class page settings.

To learn more about editing classes and class Web pages, see our online tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_edit

2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that appears.

All students on your roster will now see the audio button for pre-K to fifth grade Diagnostic questions.

I understand you have a question about viewing your students' usernames and passwords. When you created your class roster, Quia automatically generated accounts with usernames and passwords for your students. To view their account information, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
3. Click the "Roster" link for the class you want to view.

Quia displays each student's username to the right of their name. You can click the padlock icon to view or change an individual password.

If you want to receive a full list of all usernames and passwords in a class, scroll to the bottom of the page and click the appropriate "Send" button to e-mail the list to yourself. The other "Send" button e-mails each student his or her own username and password.

We have some excellent tutorials with more useful information about creating classes, using rosters, and much more, which you can view by logging in to your account and clicking "Tutorial Center" in the left menu.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.

body:
While it’s possible to reset an individual skill, you have a couple of options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! Our skills are designed to naturally adjust to students' current levels of understanding even if they’ve practiced before. If they mastered a skill previously, the SmartScore will reset to 0 automatically when they begin practicing again.

To allow students to demonstrate their understanding in previously practiced skills, we recommend having them practice 20 questions or until they reach mastery, whichever comes first. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options at the top of your reports to monitor their current progress.

2) Reset the skill. If you’d like to reset an individual skill, please let me know the following:
  • Students’ usernames
  • Grade level of the skill
  • Skill code and full name of the skill you’d like reset (e.g., A.1 Learn to count - up to 3)
closing: Please let me know which option you would prefer, or if you have any questions about how to use Analytics to track your students’ progress. I will be happy to help!
name: Reset a skill

body:
At this time, we do not provide tutorials on IXL, as it is designed as a tool that children can use to practice and develop fluency in topics that they’re learning at school or at home.

Although IXL does not currently offer any introductory lessons, we do provide detailed explanations after any question is answered incorrectly. These explanations illustrate general concepts, provide useful reminders, and include step-by-step solutions to any question a child misses on IXL. With these explanations, children are given immediate feedback so that they can learn new material while practicing!

body:
I’m sorry to hear that you have been frustrated by the scoring, and I appreciate that you’ve reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team. I’d like to share some information and suggestions that may help make practicing less frustrating.
  • Don’t rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and you need to get several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you’ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL’s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.
I hope you find some of these suggestions helpful. You can visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore explained (child)

body:
The username you are entering is correct, and you may be able to sign in if you enter your username and password at your school's custom sign-in page:

http://www.ixl.com/signin/SCHOOL

If you still have trouble signing in, you can contact your teacher to obtain your username and password. To protect the privacy of our students, only teachers can provide students with their usernames and passwords. Teachers can view students' usernames and passwords from their class rosters.

If you add your own e-mail address to your account, you will be able to retrieve your username and password in the future, if necessary. Once you are provided with your username and password, you can follow these steps to add your e-mail address to your account:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Enter your e-mail address in the space provided.
4) Click Submit to save your changes.

You will now be able to retrieve the username and password on your account at any time.

body:
While the data in your child's account can be cleared by the school, our site is designed so that your child never has to start over. The SmartScore for each skill will automatically adapt as your child practices, adjusting the difficulty of the questions and accurately reporting your child's proficiency in that skill.

Even if your child has a low score, the SmartScore will automatically adjust when he/she begins practicing again. When the SmartScore for a skill reaches 100 that skill is considered mastered, but your child can practice the skill over again and the SmartScore will reset to 0. Skills can be mastered over and over, ensuring that any students who use IXL will get all of the practice and reinforcement they need.
closing: If you still wish to have your child's data cleared, please have an administrator at the school write to us at help@ixl.com.  Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!
name: Parent clear data (site or bulk)

body:
With an individual subscription to Quia, there is not a way for students to use the same usernames and passwords for multiple Instructor Enroll classes. If there are other teachers at your school who use Quia, you may want to consider purchasing a group subscription that will allow all of you to have a Master Student List. The usernames and passwords created on this Master Student List can then be used in any Instructor Enroll classes on the subscription.

Alternatively, you can create new Student Self-Enroll classes and have your students enroll themselves into multiple classes using the same username and password. With this method, your students will be the only ones to have access to their usernames and passwords.

To learn more about the differences between Instructor Enroll and Student Self-Enroll classes, you can click on the following link:

http://www.quia.com/tutorclass.html

body:
I understand you have a question about adding files to your class page. You can follow these steps to upload files to share with your class:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Files" in the left menu.
3. Click "Upload".
4. Click "Browse" to locate the file you want to upload from your computer. (Once you locate the file, select the file and click "Open".)
6. Click "OK".

Your file will now be added to your Quia Files, and will be listed on this page.

To add this new file to your class page, follow these steps:

1. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
2. Click the "Edit" link for the appropriate class.
3. In the "Message to class" field, place your cursor where you want to insert your file.
4. Go to the "Insert" list, located below the "Message to class" field, select the type of file you want to add, and click "Browse".
5. Select the button for the file you want to insert.
6. Click "OK". (You may be prompted to enter a "text anchor", which is just the words you want your students to be able to click to access the file.)

Quia automatically adds the HTML for the file link. When you save and view your page, you will be able to see the image or the link.

To learn more about adding files to your class Web page and editing your class Web page, you can watch our tutorial at:
http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_edit
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Upload/Add Files to Class Page

body:
While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the family account will be transferred to the school account. This will mean that progress in the family account will be cleared and moved to the school account, so we do need permission from the school to make this transfer.

To get started transferring your child’s practice over to the new school account, I will first need e-mail permission from your child’s school along with the new username your child will be using.

Please ask PRIMARYCONTACTNAME to e-mail help@ixl.com and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} in their e-mail.

Once I have received an e-mail from PRIMARYCONTACTNAME at help@ixl.com giving me permission to move the information over to the school account, I will be able to transfer the data.
closing: If you have any questions in the meantime, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
name: Data swap: Parent - Family to Bulk

body:
Thank you for contacting us about clearing your students' accounts. I understand that you want students to work on skills they’ve practiced before and that it can be confusing for students if they see scores from their prior work.

Your school’s IXL administrator would need to make this request, however, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent you from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”
closing: I would be happy to provide some suggestions that may help you when students are revisiting IXL skills. Please let me know if you or your school’s IXL administrator would like to speak by phone.
name: Teacher clearing student data (site)

body:
I'm happy to help with your question about rewards.

There are a few different types of rewards that can be earned on IXL. Medals and certificates are awarded periodically as children practice. Awards, though, are acquired after specific challenges are met. These challenges vary, with some requiring children to master a certain number of skills in a category, or to practice a certain number of questions. Completing a challenge will allow children to reveal that prize on the awards board.

To see how close you are to earning an award for ELA, go to Learning in your account and click Awards. Select Language arts awards beneath the tabs, if necessary. You will see all the different types of challenges available for your grade. Click on any challenge to see your progress toward that award.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Why didn't I win an award? (ELA)

body:
The "Connection error" message indicates that traffic between the iPad app and our servers is being interrupted. To fix this, please try adding IXL as a trusted site on your iPad by following these steps:

1) On the Home screen of your iPad, tap the Settings icon.
2) In the list of settings in the left menu, tap General.
3) In the right menu, scroll down and tap Restrictions.
4) Enter your iPad passcode when prompted to access your list of website restrictions.
5) Tap Websites in the Allowed content section.
6) Tap Add a website... under the Always allow heading at the bottom of the list of allowed websites.
7) Enter "IXL" as the title and "ixl.com" as the URL.
8) Tap Done on your keypad.

Then please try loading the app and practicing again.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, feel free to contact us at (855)255-6676x3. I will be happy to help you get IXL running properly on your iPad.
name: iPad app connection error (family)

body:
If exercises are not being displayed on our website, your browser may not be loading all of the files necessary to show those exercises.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here.

If you prefer, you can switch to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the problems on IXL again.

Google Chrome is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.google.com/chrome

Click on the button to download Chrome and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Chrome installed, you can use it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties viewing questions.
closing: If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. I want to make sure that you get the most out of IXL!
name: No problem -Family/individual

Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the problems on IXL again.

body:
The "Connection error" message indicates that traffic between our app and our servers is being blocked or modified. Please have your school's IT professional make sure that the following domains and subdomains are whitelisted on all network firewalls and proxy servers:

www.ixl.com
api.ixl.com
ixl.com
cloudflare.com
cloudflaressl.com
optimizely.com

In addition, all of IXL's traffic is sent securely via SSL. This can cause the app to show a connection error even when Safari allows members to visit www.ixl.com without any difficulties. Please make sure that your filters include an SSL decrypt exception for ixl.com and optimizely.com. This will prevent secure traffic from being modified or decrypted by your filters as it is sent to our app.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If you prefer, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. Feel free to ask for me by name. I am happy to help!
name: iPad app connect error school-Safari OK

body:
The COUNTRY edition doesn't have placement tests or pre- and post-tests. However, IXL tracks your child's progress in up-to-the-second reports that can show you their levels of improvement and preparedness across time.

The questions on IXL are adaptive, meaning that as your child practices them and improve in a skill, the questions will become more difficult. If they get questions wrong, the questions start getting easier.

After your child has spent a bit of time practicing on IXL in a year level that is close to their age group, I recommend browsing through our reports. Their final SmartScores in a few skills will give you an excellent impression of whether or not they should try an easier or more difficult year level instead.
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help!
name: Placement Tests (not math)

body:
While I can clear the data from your child’s account, please be aware that all report data, practice in all grades, and awards will be lost. You have a couple of options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! As children practice on IXL, their SmartScores will quickly adjust to their current level, so even if they have low scores on a skill, as long as they continue to practice the SmartScore will adjust to accurately show their current performance levels. If they have already mastered a skill, they can practice again and will see their SmartScores reset to 0. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options in your reports to monitor their progress.

2) Delete all data. We can clear out all practice data, awards, and account history, and you will have a brand new account to use with your child.
closing: Please let me know which option you would prefer, or if you have any questions about how to use Analytics to track your child's progress.  I will be happy to help!
name: Parent request Clearing Family Account

4) Enter initials or shortened names in the First name and Last name fields for each student.

IXL will use the information you've entered into each student's first and last name field to generate new usernames and accounts for each student. Using only students' initials will make these usernames much shorter.

To remove a class, please follow these steps:

Please try to sign in here using an affected computer at your school's computer lab:

http://www.ixl.com/signin

If you can't load this page at all but are able to see our regular homepage, it means that your network is blocking us from establishing a secure connection.

Ask your school's IT professional to make sure your network is enabled to use SSL and that the ixl.com domain is whitelisted. If needed, we have a list of commonly used school firewalls and the steps for whitelisting domains on them here.

This will allow you to communicate with our secure servers and sign in to IXL.

body:
You should be able to fix the issue with your iPad app not loading questions by reinstalling the latest version of the app. To do so, please follow these steps to uninstall the app, restart your iPad, and reinstall the app:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap and hold the IXL icon.
2) Tap the X in the top-left corner of the icon once it appears.
3) Turn off your iPad by holding the power button and then sliding the prompt to turn off your iPad when it appears.
4) Turn on your iPad by pressing the power button.
5) Reinstall the app by going to www.ixl.com or by searching for IXL in the App store.

In addition, if necessary, I strongly recommend that you upgrade to the latest version of iOS to make sure that the IXL app performs at its best. You can find steps to update your iPad's software by visiting this page:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4623

body:
I understand that you're having trouble practicing on IXL. Sometimes add-ons or extensions installed on your browser or security software such as firewalls can prevent computers from being able to communicate effectively with our site. When this happens, members practicing on IXL will sometimes experience long delays after clicking Submit or will not be able to load the next question at all.

If you disable any unknown extensions on your browser, there is a good chance that the practice pages will stop freezing up. You can find our guide to disabling extensions here.

If disabling add-ons does not fix the problem, then the easiest solution is to download and install a new browser such as Google Chrome. A new browser will not have any add-ons to interfere with data coming to and from IXL, and the default settings on a browser are best for accessing most sites, including ours. You can download Chrome for free here.

Click on the button to download Chrome and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Chrome installed, you can use it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties loading problems.

If you continue to experience difficulties, try adding "www.ixl.com" and "ixl.com" to your firewall's "safe list" or "accepted sites" list. If your network uses a proxy server, make sure our website is allowed "without restrictions". We have some instructions and contact information for common security programs here.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions at all. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. I will be happy to help you get IXL running properly on your computer.
name: Freezing when clicking

body:
Thank you for contacting us about clearing your students' accounts. I understand that your teachers want students to work on skills they’ve practiced before, and that it can be confusing for students if they see scores from their prior work.

However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”
closing: I would be happy to provide some suggestions that may help you when students are revisiting IXL skills. If it's more convenient to discuss these options over the phone, please feel free to give me a call.
name: Admin clearing student data (site)

In addition, only time spent practicing will appear in your Analytics. Time spent in the Diagnostic section will not be added towards the time you see in Analytics.

It sounds like your browser (Internet Explorer) is blocking some of the images we're trying to display.

Please follow these steps to configure IE to allow our site to display images:

1) Open Internet Explorer and go to http://www.ixl.com
2) Click Alt+X on your keyboard to open the Tools menu.
3) Select Internet Options.
4) Click the Security tab.
5) Click Trusted sites.
6) Click the Sites button.
7) Make sure the Require server verification (https:) for all sites in this zone check box is NOT selected.
8) If the text "http://www.ixl.com" is not entered in the box next to the Add button, enter it now. Otherwise, proceed to the next step.
9) Click Add.
10) Click Close.
11) On the Security tab, look at the area labeled Security level for this zone. If you can, click the Default level button.
12) Move the slider to Low.
13) Click OK.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. Feel free to ask for me by name. I want to make sure you can take full advantage of all of the skills on our site!

body:
I understand that you have a question about the time recorded on IXL. The time that IXL reports includes only the amount of time a child spends actively practicing questions. It does not include, for instance, the amount of time that a child may spend signing in to and navigating IXL. It also does not include any time spent in the IXL Diagnostic.

The clock that records time on IXL pauses after a child has spent a certain amount of time on a single question. This is to ensure that when children step away from the computer or take a break from practicing on IXL that their reports don’t mistakenly report that time as time spent practicing. The amount of time a child can spend on an individual question before the timer pauses varies by grade level as follows:

  • Pre-k to 2nd grade: Two minutes per question
  • 3rd grade to 5th grade: Four minutes per question
  • 6th grade and higher: Six minutes per question

When the timer pauses during practice, children will still get 2-6 minutes of credit for the questions they are working on, depending on their grade level. As soon as their answers are submitted to IXL the timer resumes counting and they receive credit for practicing the next question.

If you feel some practice is not being accurately reported, please let me know what skills were practiced, and when, and I can check your reports to find out exactly what happened.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

body:
I’m sorry to hear that you and your students have been frustrated by the scoring, and I appreciate that you’ve reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

I’d like to share some information and suggestions that may help alleviate some of the frustration you and your class are experiencing.

For you:
  • What is a SmartScore? The SmartScore is an up-to-the-minute measure of a student’s progress toward mastery, so you can think of 0-70 as practicing or learning a skill, 71-90 as refining a skill with questions of mid- and high-level rigor, and 91-100 as working through difficult questions to cement mastery. As a result, the SmartScore will go up and down at different rates as children progress through a skill.
  • 80 is a great place to start: When a student first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that a student has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge students to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit.
  • Set goals: Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
For your students:
  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you’ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL’s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.
I hope you and your class find some of these suggestions helpful. You can visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore explained (teacher)

body:
If you have followed the steps to clear your browser's cache and are still unable to view questions on IXL, your browser may not be loading all of the files necessary to show those exercises.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here.

For a more reliable solution, however, I recommend switching to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the problems on IXL again.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, open it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties viewing problems.

body: Accounts become inactive when they are removed from a school's roster of students. I recommend contacting your school to restore your account. If needed, your school's IXL administrator can contact us to restore your account so that it becomes active again and none of the work in your account is lost.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.
name: Account inactive (student)
versions: Accounts become inactive when they are removed from a school's roster of students. I recommend contacting your daughter's school to restore her account. If needed, her school's IXL administrator can contact us to restore the account so that it becomes active again and none of her work is lost.

Accounts become inactive when they are removed from a school's roster of students. I recommend contacting your son's school to restore his account. If needed, his school's IXL administrator can contact us to restore the account so that it becomes active again and none of his work is lost.

It sounds like your students' accounts have been removed from the school's master roster. When this happens, each student will receive a message that their account is inactive.

To reactive these accounts, I recommend having ADMINNAME (ADMINEMAIL), your school's IXL administrator, contact us to restore their accounts. Once their accounts are active again, they will be able to sign in and practice without interruption.

body:
Thank you for reaching out to us. I'm sorry to hear that you are having trouble signing in.

When I searched for your account, I was unable to find it with the information provided. If you are trying to sign in to an account purchased by your school, your child's teacher should be able to provide you with the correct username and password.

If you purchased an account, please provide me with any other e-mail addresses you might have used when purchasing your account and the last 4 digits on the credit card that you used, and I'll be glad to take another look.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all. I'm always happy to help!

body:
If you would like to turn off the weekly e-mail reports that you've been receiving, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that opens.
4) Clear the Receive weekly summary e-mails checkbox.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

You will no longer receive weekly reports on your students. If you would like to re-enable these reports, you can follow these same steps but check the box in step 4.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.
name: Turn off e-mail reports

body:
Now that you have successfully completed an online course, you can set up a new course with new classes each semester.

To start a new term with new students, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Locate the course you want to base the new course on.
3) Do one of the following:
* If you see a "Start new term" link beneath the course title, click on it and skip to Step 7.
* If don't see the "Start new term" link, click the course title (e.g. "Spanish 101").
4) Click the "Options" tab.
5) Click "Create new course".
6) Enter the course information in the appropriate fields.
7) Click "Submit" and your course will be created.
8) Fill out the form to create a class (i.e. section) for students to enroll in.
9) Click "Submit."
10) Click "Create another class" to set up additional sections or click "Done" when all of your classes are set up.

The activities that were previously assigned will remain assigned in the new term. However any due dates will not carry over as they would be now be invalid.

body: I understand you have a question about accepting late assignments. You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps: 1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up. 2) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in. 3) Click on the title of your course. 4) Click the "Classes" tab. 5) Use the links at the top of the gradebook to navigate to the appropriate section. 6) Click the "late" link that the Heinle Learning Center displays in place of the score for that exercise. 7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student. The Heinle Learning Center will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!

body:
A free, 3-week trial is available for some online books. This trial will allow you temporary access to your assignments.

To begin your free trial, please follow these steps:


1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.


2) Enter the course code your instructor gave you, if you have not already done so.


3) Click the link offering the free 3-week trial, beneath the information about your online book.


4) Follow the prompts to complete activating your trial.

You will be able to submit your assignments to your instructor. At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.
name: Free trial for book key?
versions:
A free, 3-week trial is available for some online books. This trial will allow you full access to your assignments for the duration of your trial.


To begin your free trial, please follow these steps:


1) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.

2) Enter the course code your instructor gave you, if you have not already done so.

3) Click the "buy" link for the book used in your course.

4) Click the link offering the free 3-week trial, above the information about your online book.

5) Follow the prompts to complete activating your trial.


You will be able to submit your assignments to your instructor. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key, which can be done at any time. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.

body:
To change the exercises that are assigned in your course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.

Please note that the exercises listed with a red dot contain questions that will require you to grade them before students' scores are final. Exercises listed with a green dot will be graded automatically.

If you wish to set a due date for an exercise, click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears. To assign the same due date to several exercises at once, please follow these steps:

7. Check the box to the left of each exercise that shares a due date.
8. Open the "Actions" menu at the top of the list of exercises and choose "Set due date."
9. Select a due date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for all of the exercises you selected.

We have a helpful info sheet for assigning activities with screen shots of each of the steps in this process. I recommend taking a look at it for more information:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/assigningActivities_HLC.pdf
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.

body:
If you would like, you can follow these steps to remove a class from your course:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Enter your username and password in the spaces provided and click "Log in."
3) Click the title of your course.
4) Go to the "Options" tab.
5) Click "Delete Class".
6) Select the class you want to delete from the list and click "Delete".

Your class will be deleted. Any students who were enrolled in that class will be dropped and their results will be lost.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

Some of the exercises your instructor has assigned are too complex to be automatically graded when you submit them. These exercises are displayed in your results with a red dot to indicate that the score is not yet final. When your instructor grades this exercise, the red dot will turn green and your final score will be displayed instead.

To learn more about how to view the results in your account, I recommend you read our helpful info sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/viewingResults_HLC.pdf

body:
When you answer the same problem multiple times, each score is recorded separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a small triangle next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. A number is displayed in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/viewingResults_HLC.pdf
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.
name: Student can't see multiple attempts
versions:
When you answer the same problem multiple times, Quia records each of the scores separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a plus sign (+) next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. Quia displays a number in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/QuiaBooks/viewingResults.pdf

body:
If you are having trouble recording, a good first step is to check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:
1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button. 2. Select "Settings". 3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it). 4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" checkbox are selected. 5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it). 6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.) 7. Click "Close". Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and click "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Microphone Check (Chrome)

body:
We have a helpful tutorial you can watch to learn how to set up your account and enroll in your instructor's course here:

http://books.quia.com/tutorials/student_registration

These steps will also guide you through enrolling in your online course:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com
2. Click "Students", then click "Create new account".
3. Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4. Click "Enter a course code".
5. Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6. If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor
cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click "Go". Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify that your name is entered correctly and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. Once completed, you can safely discard your book key.

If you need to purchase a book key, you can do so by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. From here, you can purchase a book key (and not a physical book) that Quia will instantly add to your account. When you make your purchase, you will not see an actual book key; instead Quia will enter it into your account automatically.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

To access your account in the future, go to http://books.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your
results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using Quia! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
name: Student Registration

body:
If you bought a used book, you will need to purchase online access to your Quia book.

To do so, log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information.

Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to click "Open book" to submit your work.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

body:
I understand you have a question about Flash.

There is an issue with Flash player that can occur on some Macs which can prevent you from being able to update your Flash settings. Without updated Flash settings, you will not be able to make recordings on our site. To work around this issue and update your settings, please follow these steps:

1) Click on the Apple icon in the upper left corner of your screen.
2) Click on "System Preferences".
3) In the "Other" section, click on "Flash Player".
4) Click on "Camera and Mic", and then click "Camera and Microphone Settings by Site".
5) In the new window that opens, click on the "+" sign in the lower left corner.
6) Enter "quia.com" (without quotes) as the website domain.
7) Select "Allow" from the drop-down box, then click the "Add" button.
closing: This will allow our site to use your microphone during your recording exercises. You should now be able to complete your assignments.
name: Mac cannot change flash settings

versions:
If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a Quia book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The Quia book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Quia package, you can purchase your online book access (the same as entering a book key) by going to http://books.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book.

However, if you purchased a book new from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please scan or take a digital picture of the receipt from your book purchase and send it to me in a reply to this e-mail. If you find it more convenient, you can also fax the requested information to (650)372-4072 and address your fax to my attention. Please be sure that the receipt (including the part with the phone number of the bookstore) is legible in your fax or e-mail message. Also include your name, e-mail address, Quia support ticket ID, and school name.

If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a Cheng & Tsui book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The Cheng & Tsui book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Cheng & Tsui package, you can purchase your online book access (the same as entering a book key) by going to http://iconline.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book.

However, if you purchased a new book from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please return to your campus bookstore to explain what happened. They are the only ones who may be able to provide you with a refund or a new book key.

body:
I'm sorry to hear that you've been having trouble accessing the eBook.

We have been contacted by other customers experiencing this same issue. The eBook is hosted by a different site so we aren't able to resolve the issue directly ourselves, but we have contacted the publisher Cengage and they are working with the eBook vendor Vital Source to fix the problem.

For many instructors, registering as a student in your own course and accessing the book through the student workstation seems to resolve the problem in the meantime. You can gain access to your course as a student by following these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the title of your course.
3) Click the "Classes" tab.
4) Click the "Submit activities as student" link in the "How do I grade?" box on the right side of the page.
5) A new window with the book in it will open. Close that window.
6) Click the "Student Workstation" link at the top of your main browser window.

A new window will open to show you your Student Workstation. You are now enrolled in your own course and can view the book as a student.

You can return to the Instructor Workstation at any time by going back to the other window. For the duration of this course, you will be able to switch back and forth between the student and instructor workstations.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Microphone Check (Chrome)

body:
When you answer the same problem multiple times, Quia records each of the scores separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a plus sign (+) next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. Quia displays a number in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/QuiaBooks/viewingResults.pdf
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

body:
I am happy to provide you with a book key and instructions to help you set up your course.

Here is an instructor book key:

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

These steps will guide you through setting up your course online:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
(If you have not yet created an account, click the "Create account" button in the bottom-right corner.)

2) Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field located in the upper-right corner of your screen. You will be prompted to create a course. You can now discard your book key as you will not need to use it again!

3) Enter the course information and click "Submit". (You will be able to edit this information later if you need to.)

4) Enter your class information and click "Submit". (Again, you can always make changes later.) If necessary, click "Create another class" to add more classes, until you have set up all of your sections. Click "Done" when you are finished. (At some point before students register, be sure to enter class times and locations to help them enroll in the correct class.)

5) Click the "Printable registration instructions" link at the bottom of the page. A new window will open with instructions you can print and hand out to your students to help them register. These instructions contain everything your students will need to enroll in your course, including your course code.

You might also find these info sheets helpful. They describe different grading options you can set up, how to assign homework, and how to grade it:

In addition, your Cengage Digital Solutions Coordinator will be able to assist you with setting up assignment and grading options if you should require assistance. Your Cengage DSC can be reached if you write to dsc.ss@cengage.com if you have any questions. Of course, I will also be happy to help!
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Instructor Book Key and Setup
versions:
I am happy to provide you with a book key and instructions to help you set up your course. Your publisher sales representative can also assist you with any instructor keys you or your colleagues will need in the future. We have created a helpful tutorial that you can watch to learn how to set up your course here:

http://books.quia.com/tutorials/instructor_registration

Here is an instructor book key: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

These steps will guide you through setting up your course online:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com.

2. Enter your username and password in the fields provided and click "Go".
(If you have not yet created an account, click the "Create a new account" link in the "Log In" section.)

3. Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field located in the upper-right corner of your screen. Quia will prompt you to create a course. You can now discard your book key as you will not need to use it again!

4. Enter the course information and click "Submit". (You will be able to edit this information later if you need to.)

5. Enter your class information and click "Submit". (Again, you can always make changes later.) If necessary, click "Create another class" to add more classes, until you have set up all of your sections. Click "Done" when you are finished. (At some point before students register, be sure to enter class times and locations to help them enroll in the correct class.)

6. Click the "Printable registration instructions" link at the bottom of the screen. A new window will open with instructions you can print and hand out to your students to help them register. These instructions contain everything your students will need to enroll in your course, including your course code.

You might also find these info sheets helpful. They describe different grading options you can set up, how to assign homework, and how to grade it:

Customizing Grading & Feedback Options: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/QuiaBooks/Customizing_Grading.pdf

Assigning Activities: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/QuiaBooks/assigningActivities.pdf

Grading Results: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/QuiaBooks/gradingResults.pdf

The publisher Cheng & Tsui is the sole distributor of instructor book keys. To obtain an instructor key, you can either request to adopt it from our bookstore or you can request it directly from the publisher.

You can request your key directly from the publisher at the ICOnline website:

http://www.cheng-tsui.com/contact

Once you have obtained your book key you can set up your online course by following these instructions:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com

2. Enter your username and password in the fields provided and click "Log In".
(If you have not yet created an account, click the "Create an account" link in the "Log In" section.)

3. Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field located in the upper-right corner of your screen. Cheng & Tsui will prompt you to create a course. You can now discard your book key as you will not need to use it again!

4. Enter the course information and click "Submit". (You will be able to edit this information later if you need to.)

5. Enter your class information and click "Submit". (Again, you can always make changes later.) If necessary, click "Create another class" to add more classes, until you have set up all of your sections. Click "Done" when you are finished. (At some point before students register, be sure to enter class times and locations to help them enroll in the correct class.)

6. Click the "Printable registration instructions" link at the bottom of the page. A new window will open with instructions you can print and hand out to your students to help them register. These instructions contain everything your students will need to enroll in your course, including your course code.

You might also find these info sheets helpful. They describe different grading options you can set up, how to assign homework, and how to grade it:

body:
The Heinle Learning Center provides an accent tool bar for all activities that require you to enter words with accented characters.

When you are completing these online exercises, you should see a navigation tool bar at the top of the window that has buttons for "Next Page", "Previous Page", and "Back". If the exercise calls for it, there will also be an accent tool bar beneath the navigation tools.

To use the accent tool bar, place your cursor in the answer field where you want the accented character to appear and click on the character in the tool bar. The accented character will be entered where your cursor was positioned.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Using the Accent Toolbar
versions:
In order to type in the special characters required to complete your exercises, you will have to activate support for the Chinese language on your keyboard. Depending on which operating system you have, follow the instructions at one of the following websites (if you do not know your operating system, contact us directly at 877-282-4400x4 for assistance):

For Windows 8 and Windows RT users:
http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-8/language

For all other versions of Windows:
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/258824

For Mac users:
1) Go to http://www.yale.edu/chinesemac/
2) In the left menu, put your mouse over the version of the operating system you are using (select 10.7 for both 10.7 and 10.8).
3) In the menu that opens, click "Installation"
4) Follow the on-screen instructions

Quia provides an accent toolbar for all activities that require you to enter words with accented characters. When you are completing these online exercises, you should see a navigation toolbar at the top of the window that has buttons for "Next Page", "Previous Page", and "Back". If the exercise calls for it, there will also be an accent toolbar beneath the navigation tools.


To use the accent toolbar, place your cursor in the answer field where you want the accented character to appear and click on the character in the toolbar. Quia will enter the accented character where your cursor was positioned.

body:
I'm happy to assist with your question about exporting students' results. You can follow these steps to export your students' results to a CSV file:

1. Go to http://ilrn.heinle.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2. Enter your username and password in the spaces provided and click "Log in."
3. Click the title of your course
4. Go to the "Options" tab.
5. Click "Export results".
6. Select the section you want to export. To select more than one section, press and hold the "CTRL" key as you click on each section with your mouse.
7. Click "Export".
8. Make a selection at the prompt to either open the file or save it to your computer for future use.

After you complete an exercise, your answers are submitted but the actual exercise is reset so that you can complete it again if needed. To view your results, follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the photo of your book.
3. In the banner at the top of the window that pops up, click on "Results".

You can then view your scores and click on the clipboard icon for each score to view a detailed performance summary, along with your instructor's comments. For more information, I recommend you take a look at our helpful info sheet:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/viewingResults_HLC.pdf

body:
If you purchased a new book from your campus bookstore and received this book key, please scan or take a digital picture of the receipt from your book purchase and of your book key (with the book key instructions included) and send it to me in a reply to this e-mail.

Please be sure that the receipt and the book keys are legible in your e-mail. Also include your name, e-mail address, Quia support ticket ID, and the name of your school. Once I am able to verify your purchase and the book key, I will be able to assist you further.

If you bought a used book, you will need to purchase online access to your Quia book. To do so, log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to click "Open book" to submit your work.
closing: Once I am able to verify that your purchase was supposed to include a book key, I will be able to assist you further.
name: Book has no key; might be standalone
versions:
If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The HLC book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Heinle Learning Center package, you can purchase a book key by going to http://hlc.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.

However, if you purchased a book new from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please scan or take a digital picture of the receipt from your book purchase and send it to me in a reply to this e-mail. Please be sure that the receipt (including the part with the phone number of the bookstore) is legible in your e-mail message. Also include your name, e-mail address, support ticket ID CASENUMBER, and school name.

If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a Cheng & Tsui book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The Cheng & Tsui book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Cheng & Tsui package, you can purchase your online book access (the same as entering a book key) by going to http://iconline.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book.

However, if you purchased a new book from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please return to your campus bookstore to explain what happened. They are the only ones who may be able to provide you with a refund or a new book key.

body:
To delete an attempt so that a student can submit an exercise again, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Classes" tab.
4. Click on the name of the student whose submission you wish to delete.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate section of the book.
6. Check the boxes under "Clear score?" next to the exercises you wish to remove submissions for, then click "Clear selected scores."
7. Confirm your choice to clear the scores for those exercises.

Your student will now be able to submit another attempt for that exercise.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

body:
I'm happy to assist with your question about viewing your book. It looks like you've already linked your book with your course in your account. I was able to open the book from your account and access the assignments. Please go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in to your account, then try to click the image of your book to open a new window and access the book.

If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!
name: Disable Popup Blocker

body:
When your instructor creates a course with the Heinle Learning Center, he or she automatically receives a course code. Once you enter that course code, you will be registered for your instructor's course. Course codes are unique codes that are made up of a series of 3-6 random letters followed by 3 numbers.

Please contact your instructor for your HLC course code. In instructor accounts, the HLC displays the course code below the course title.

If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please provide me with your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
