name: Using Chrome - Flash 30
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I noticed that you were using Google Chrome to access your book. Chrome recently released an update that now automatically blocks Adobe Flash which is needed in order to play the audio in your exercises. You may be able to temporarily un-block Flash by clicking the icon of a puzzle piece in the upper right corner of your exercise window and clicking "Run Flash this time". However, if this doesn't work or you don't see the icon of a puzzle piece when you open your exercise, I recommend switching browsers to Mozilla Firefox. You will then be able to play your audio files.

You can download Firefox for free from here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you can use it to go to our site and you should have no further difficulties with completing your course work.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions and I will be happy to help.

name: FAMBR - unable to purchase
body:
We are having problems accepting some payments in Brazilian real and we are in the process of fixing the issue.

Although we only accept credit or debit cards as payment for monthly memberships, we do accept alternative payment methods for yearly memberships via PayPal, wire transfer, or check/money order. For wire transfer there is an additional processing fee of $50.00 USD, and for check/money order there is an additional processing fee of $10.00 USD.

If you are interested in one of the alternative payment methods, please let me know the following information so I can send you instructions:
  • number of children
  • your city and country

name: Switch Intl Edition
body:
I see that you currently have a US membership with the Core subjects package: math, language arts, science, and social studies. Science and social studies are only available on the US edition of IXL. Switching editions will cause you to lose access to the science and social studies portions of your membership.

In addition, because questions differ according to edition on topics such as currency and measurement, switching editions will mean that you will no longer have access to the practice results, awards, and personalized recommendations for your child in the US edition.

Would you still like to change editions? Let me know how you would like to proceed.
versions:
I'm happy to help change the edition of your IXL family membership.

Because questions differ according to country edition on topics such as currency and measurement, switching editions will mean that you will no longer have access to the practice results and awards for your child in the COUNTY edition.

If you would still like to proceed with changing editions, you can do so using the following steps:
  1. Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your parent profile.
  2. Click Welcome, Parent! in the upper-right corner, and select Membership details.
  3. Under the Account overview heading, click change, next to Edition: COUNTRY
  4. Select the COUNTRY edition from the drop-down menu, and click submit.
If you have any further questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

Science and social studies are only available on our US edition, so we are not able to add these subjects to your current COUNTRY membership.

You are welcome to change your membership to the Core subjects package on the US edition. This package is the only way to get these subjects, and provides access to math, language arts, science, and social studies. Because questions differ according to edition on topics such as currency and measurement, switching editions will mean that you will no longer have access to the practice results and awards for your child in the COUNTRY edition.

If you would like to make this change, the prorated cost is PRICE USD for the remainder of your billing period. When your membership renews on DATE, the new cost would be AMOUNT USD per DURATION.

Please let me know your thoughts and how you would like to proceed. I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Free vs. Membership (intl)
body:
Thank you for reaching out!

While your children will be able to practice 10 questions in each subject for free each day without a membership, there are several key features that are only available to IXL subscribers. With an IXL membership, your children will have unlimited access to content from all grade levels, and they can practice as much as they'd like each day. They will also earn virtual prizes and printable certificates as they continue practicing and mastering skills.

As a parent, membership will give you access to IXL Analytics, which will allow you to see how long your children spend practicing, questions they have answered, and any trouble spots they may have.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.
closing: Let me know if you have any additional questions about IXL memberships and I will be happy to help.

body:
Although IXL does not integrate with Clever's SSO or file standard, exporting your CSV files using our auto-rostering specifications sheet will let you sync data from your district's SIS into your IXL account. This will allow you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

The following is a link to our Auto-Rostering Technical Specifications, which details the format we need your data to be in:

https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf

Once your auto-roster integration is set up, we will send an SFTP username and secure password link, which you will use to export your files to IXL.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I'll be happy to help!

name: MDM support on iOS app
body:
The IXL iPad app is compatible with all MDM providers. You can sync the Custom Domain and Remember Me settings by saving the IXL settings file in the App Configuration preferences of your MDM.

You can use the following settings file to sync the Custom Domain and Remember Me settings with your MDM:

<dict>
<key>Custom Sign-in @</key>
<string>CUSTOM DOMAIN</string>
<key>Remember Me</key>
<true/>
<key>Date Last Synced</key>
<string>TODAY’S DATE</string>
</dict>

You can replace CUSTOM DOMAIN with your school’s custom domain text (excluding the @ symbol). If the custom domain lines are not included in the file, managed apps will have no custom domain.

The Remember Me line can be either <true/> for on or <false/> for off. With the Remember me feature on, students will remain signed in to their accounts forever. With the Remember me feature off, students will be signed out of their accounts if they haven’t used the app for 10 minutes. By default, downloading the app sets Remember Me feature on.

Please note that while the exact date format does not matter, the TODAY’S DATE value should be updated each time these settings are edited. This is necessary in order for the settings to be sent out when a change is made.
closing: If you have any questions concerning this configuration settings, please let me know and I’ll be happy to help!

name: Clear cache - content not displaying

You can find steps to clear the cache of commonly-used browsers here.

If your results are not showing up in your gradebook, it means that your work was never received by our servers. After you click the "Submit answers" button, you should always receive a feedback page confirming that your answers have been received and providing you with a provisional score. If you see this page, it means your results have been stored and recorded on your results page and in your instructor's account for grading. If you do not see this page, you were not connected to our servers when you submitted your work.

Unfortunately, if our server did not receive your scores, we have no way to retrieve your grades for you.

name: Audio problems

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.

body:
I understand you have a question about accepting late assignments. You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps:

1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up.
2) Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
3) Click on the title of your course.
4) Click the "Classes" tab.
5) Navigate to the appropriate section using the "Book" and "Section" drop-down lists.
6) Click the "late" link that Cheng & Tsui displays in place of the score for that exercise.
7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student.

Cheng & Tsui will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!
name: Accept late scores - student

body:
To change the exercises that are assigned in your course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.

Please note that the exercises listed here with a red dot contain questions that will require you to grade them before students' scores are final. Exercises listed here with a green dot will be graded automatically.

If you wish to set a due date for an exercise, click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears. To assign the same due date to several exercises at once, please follow these steps:

7. Check the box to the left of each exercise that shares a due date.
8. Open the "Other actions..." menu at the top of the list of exercises and choose "Set due date."
9. Select a due date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for all of the exercises you selected.

We have a helpful info sheet for assigning activities with screen shots of each of the steps in this process. I recommend taking a look at it for more information:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/assigningActivities_CT.pdf
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.
name: Assigning exercises

body:
I understand you have a question about viewing your results. After you complete an exercise, your answers are submitted but the actual exercise is reset so that you can complete it again if needed. To view your results, follow these steps:

1) Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the image of your book to open it.
3) Click the "My Tools" menu in the top-right corner.
4) Choose "Results" to open that page.

You can then view your scores and click on the bar graph icon for each score to view a detailed performance summary, along with your instructor's comments. For more information, I recommend you take a look at our helpful info sheet:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/viewingResults_CT.pdf
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know!

You can now open your book and submit your work independently without an instructor. Please note that work you complete independently will be cleared from your account if you register for another course using this book.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know!
name: Use book independently

body:
There is an issue with Flash player that can occur on some Macs which can prevent you from being able to update your Flash settings. Without updated Flash settings, you will not be able to make recordings on our site. To work around this issue and update your settings, please follow these steps:

1) Click on the Apple icon in the upper left corner of your screen.
2) Click on "System Preferences".
3) In the "Other" section, click on "Flash Player".
4) Click on "Camera and Mic", and then click "Camera and Microphone Settings by Site".
5) In the new window that opens, click on the "+" sign in the lower left corner.
6) Enter "quia.com" (without quotes) as the website domain.
7) Select "Allow" from the drop-down box, then click the "Add" button.

This will allow our site to use your microphone during your recording exercises. You should now be able to complete your assignments.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Mac cannot change flash settings

body:
The publisher Cheng & Tsui is the sole distributor of instructor book keys. To obtain an instructor key from them, you can either request to adopt it from our bookstore or you can request it from them directly.

You can request your key directly from the publisher at the ICOnline website:

http://www.cheng-tsui.com/contact

Once you have obtained your book key you can add it to your online course by following these instructions:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Enter your book key into the appropriate field in the top-right corner of the screen.
3. Select "Add this book to an existing course" and choose your course from the menu provided.
4. Click "Next".
5. Click "Add Book".

The book will be added to your course.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist!

I'm happy to help you add files to your announcement board.

You can follow these steps to add your own files to your announcements board:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the title of your course.
3. Go to the "Announcements" tab.
4. Click inside the message text box where you want to insert the file.
5. Type what you want to name the file link. This is the text students click on to download the file, e.g. "Click here for your class syllabus".
6. Highlight the text you just typed.
7. Click the icon that resembles a chain to link your text to your file.
8. Click the small icon to the right of the "Link URL" box.
9. Select the appropriate file from your account and click "OK".
10. Click "Insert".
11. Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click "Save Changes".
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

Cheng & Tsui will delete the class. Any students who were enrolled in that class will be dropped and their results will be lost.

Your class has now been modified.

body:
You can create an account and enroll in your course by following these steps:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Click "Create an account".
3. Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4. Click "Enter a course code".
5. Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6. If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click "Go". Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify that your name is entered correctly and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. Once completed, you can safely discard your book key.

If you need to purchase a book key, you can do so by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. From here, you can purchase a book key (and not a physical book) that Cheng & Tsui will instantly add to your account. When you make your purchase, you will not see an actual book key; instead Cheng & Tsui will enter it into your account automatically.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

To access your account in the future, go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: Thank you for using Cheng & Tsui! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

body:
I'm happy to help you begin a new term!

Now that you have successfully completed a Cheng & Tsui course, you can set up a new course with new classes each semester.

To start a new term with new students, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Locate the course you want to base the new course on.
3. Do one of the following:
* If you see a "Start new term" link beneath the course title, click on it and skip to Step 6.
* If don't see the "Start new term" link, click the course title (e.g. "Chinese 101").
4. Click the "Options" tab.
5. Click "Create new course".
6. Enter the course information in the appropriate fields.
7. Click "Submit" and your course will be created.
8. Fill out the form to create a class (i.e. section) for students to enroll in.
9. Click "Submit."
10. Click "Create another class" to set up additional sections or click "Done" when all of your classes are set up.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Start a new term

body:
You can set the grading and feedback options for your course so that your students will see the correct answers for any questions they missed, but only after they have used up all of their available attempts for that exercise. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course (e.g. "Chinese 101").
3) Click on the "Books" tab.
4) Beneath the "Books" tab, click "Options".
5) Select the book from the drop-down menu next to the "Preview" button and click "Go." (Select "All books" if you wish to apply changes to all of your books at once.)
6) In the "Feedback" section, click on "Score and summary" and confirm your choice when prompted.

Now the feedback will be set to not show answers by default. The next step is to show students the answers once they have used up all of their attempts:

7) Click on the "Options" tab in the top row (in the same row as "Dashboard", "Classes", and "Books").
8) Click on the "Grading options" button.
9) In the "Multiple attempts" section, check the box next to "Ignore student results after the ___ attempt."
10) In the same line, select the number of attempts you would like your students to have for each exercise.
11) On the next line, check the box next to "Always show feedback as "score, summary, and answers" after students' final attempt."
12) Click the "Save changes" button.

Your students will now see their total score and which questions were correct or incorrect after each attempt, but they will not see the correct answers until after they have submitted their final attempt.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Set grading and feedback options

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Try recording the exercise again. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.

body:
When you answer the same problem multiple times, Cheng & Tsui records each of the scores separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a plus sign (+) next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. Cheng & Tsui displays a number in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/viewingResults_CT.pdf

body:
The publisher Cheng & Tsui is the sole distributor of instructor book keys. You can request your key directly from the publisher at the ICOnline website:

http://www.cheng-tsui.com/contact

Once you have obtained your book key you can set up your online course by following these instructions:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com

2. Enter your username and password in the fields provided and click "Log In".
(If you have not yet created an account, click the "Create an account" link in the "Log In" section.)

3. Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field located in the upper-right corner of your screen. Cheng & Tsui will prompt you to create a course. You can now discard your book key as you will not need to use it again!

4. Enter the course information and click "Submit". (You will be able to edit this information later if you need to.)

5. Enter your class information and click "Submit". (Again, you can always make changes later.) If necessary, click "Create another class" to add more classes, until you have set up all of your sections. Click "Done" when you are finished. (At some point before students register, be sure to enter class times and locations to help them enroll in the correct class.)

6. Click the "Printable registration instructions" link at the bottom of the page. A new window will open with instructions you can print and hand out to your students to help them register. These instructions contain everything your students will need to enroll in your course, including your course code.

You might also find these info sheets helpful. They describe different grading options you can set up, how to assign homework, and how to grade it:

Customizing Grading & Feedback Options: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/Customizing_Grading.pdf

Assigning Activities: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/assigningActivities_CT.pdf

Grading Results: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/ChengTsui/gradingResults_CT.pdf

body:
If you are having trouble watching the video in your book, then the Flash installed on your browser is not streaming the video properly. Adobe Flash Player is a technology your browser uses to play the video on our site.

You may be able to fix this problem by disabling any extensions installed on your browser that you do not use. Extensions can interfere with how your browser handles Flash content. You can view all of your extensions here:

chrome://extensions

Click the icon of a trash can to remove any extensions you do not recognize or use.

Alternatively, you can download and use a completely new browser. A newly installed browser will not have any extensions installed, and you will be able to log in to your account using it to open your book and view your videos.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you should have no further browser problems with the video in your book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.

closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include companion website access, you can purchase your book access online. To do so, please log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. Expired School Quote
body:
I see that your school's IXL membership has expired. If the school is not going to continue with IXL, you can purchase a separate family membership.

You and each of your children can access unlimited practice and comprehensive reporting tools with one IXL family membership. Each child using IXL may sign in with a shared family username and password, and then choose his or her personal profile to begin practicing.

IXL offers a number of different packages, starting at $9.95 a month for one child and $4 per additional child, or $79 for the year and $40 per additional child.

To view our membership options with pricing, please visit our Membership page.
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you!

Username: USER

If you cannot sign in, please contact your teacher to obtain your password. To protect the privacy of our students, only teachers can provide students with their passwords. Teachers can view students' passwords from their class rosters.

Once you sign in, you can add your own e-mail address to the account so that you can request your username and password from IXL anytime. You can follow these steps:

3) Enter your e-mail address in the space provided.
4) Click Submit to save your changes.

You will now be able to retrieve the username and password on your account at any time.

name: Diagnostic - Update Levels
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: While there is not a way to reset a student's Diagnostic levels, the Diagnostic will continue to update to the student's actual levels if the student answers more questions. The number of questions needed to update their levels will vary based on their performance and existing practice results. The Diagnostic will also take previous student practice into account which may be more questions if the student hasn't been practicing at their grade level. Once the student has finished the Diagnostic, we recommend they answer about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep it up to date.

The number of questions needed to update his score will vary based on his performance and existing practice results. Once the student has finished the Diagnostic, we recommend he answers about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep it up to date.

name: Timer problem
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Thank you for reaching out to us.

The time that IXL reports includes only the amount of time a child spends actively practicing questions. It does not include, for instance, the amount of time that a child may spend signing in to and navigating IXL. It also does not include any time spent in the IXL Diagnostic.

The clock that records time on IXL pauses after a child has spent a certain amount of time on a single question. This is to ensure that when children step away from the computer or take a break from practicing on IXL that their reports don’t mistakenly report that time as time spent practicing. The amount of time a child can spend on an individual question before the timer pauses varies by the grade level of the skill they are practicing:
  • Pre-Kto 2nd grade skills: Two minutes per question
  • 3rd grade to 5th grade skills: Four minutes per question
  • 6th grade skills and higher: Six minutes per question
When the timer pauses during practice, children will still get 2-6 minutes of credit for the questions they are working on, depending on the skill's grade level. As soon as their answers are submitted to IXL the timer resumes counting and they receive credit for practicing the next problem.

If you feel some practice is not being accurately reported, please let me know what skills were practiced, and when, and I can check your reports to find out exactly what happened.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Downgrade - account on hold
body:
I understand that you’ve recently adjusted your IXL subscription to include less student licenses. Because the number of students on your master roster now exceeds XXX, your subscription is currently on hold.

In order to reactivate your account, we will need to adjust your master roster so that no more than XXX students are listed. You are welcome to send me an updated list of students including only the students who will continue to use IXL, and I’ll be happy to update the master roster for you. Please include the following student information in separate columns of an Excel file:
  • First name
  • Last name
  • Student ID number
  • Grade level
  • School (if applicable)
Alternatively, you can manually remove XXXX students. You can follow these steps to manually remove students from your master roster:
  • Sign into your IXL admin account
  • Go to the Students page under the Account Management tab
  • Search for your desired student in the search bar at the top left of the student list
  • Click on the red "x" button directly to the right of the student's name
Once you remove enough students, your account will automatically be reactivated.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

body:

Since school subscriptions are set up a little differently than TRIAL ACCOUNT/CLASSROOM SUBSCRIPTION, we'll need to upload a student roster to ensure that the students are set up properly. Once you upload your roster, we can begin the transfer process.

To get started, you will need to upload a complete student list with the following student information in separate columns of an Excel spreadsheet:
  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Student ID
  • Grade

When ready, you can submit this information through the secure file upload tool by signing in to an admin account in the school subscription and clicking “Upload Roster” within the “Account Management” tab.

Please note the usernames and passwords will change, but these can be edited at any time. Additionally, if students already have accounts within the school subscription, their data will be overwritten.

name: Too Many Students

body:
We offer a secure way to upload your data through IXL’s Auto-Rostering feature. This feature allows you to sync data from your school or district SIS into your IXL account through an SFTP connection. This effectively allows you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS. Once the Auto-Roster feature is enabled, you will no longer be able to manage students and teachers manually through the IXL website. All changes are provided through your school or district SIS file transfer, which will be uploaded nightly through our Auto-Roster sync.

The following is a link to our Auto-Rostering Technical Specifications, which details the format we need your data to be in:

https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf

Alternatively, IXL supports the OneRoster v1.1 CSV standard. We only use a subset of the data, but we accept the standard set of files as described in the OneRoster specification, with no special additions or modifications needed.

Please note that we do not integrate with Clever for SSO or student rostering, so we are unable to accept files directly from Clever.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at this time.

body:
Thanks for submitting your student list. I have uploaded your master roster and created student and teacher accounts.

Your admin account information has been sent to XXXXX in a separate e-mail. From your admin account you will be able to manage student and teacher accounts, and monitor student performance.

You can access [ORG NAME’s] sign-in page at XXXX. Your custom sign-in page allows for simple and personalized access to IXL for administrators, teachers, and students. I recommend bookmarking this page for your students!

Teacher Accounts and Class Rosters

Your teachers’ accounts have been created, and each teacher will receive an e-mail confirming their account information. New teachers can create accounts at any time by following the attached instructions.

The next step is to create class rosters, in one of the following ways.
  • The quickest and most convenient way to create class rosters is to submit your student list with additional columns for “teacher name.” As soon as I receive it, I’ll upload it and assign students to teachers for you.
  • Teachers can set-up their own class rosters by following the instructions found in our Teacher Quick-start Guide. Please share these instructions with your teachers.
Teachers who have trial accounts may now merge into your new subscription by following the attached instructions under the heading, "If you already have a trial account.”

Once students are rostered they are ready to begin practicing and teachers will be able to begin monitoring their progress right away!

Getting Started Toolkit for Administrators

Need help getting started? We’ve created a toolkit of resources to help you, as an administrator, get your school set up using IXL.
  • Administrator Quick-start Guide The illustrated guide provide step-by-step instructions for how to manage student accounts and run school-wide reports.
  • Frequently Asked Questions Need more help? IXL’s Help Center offers answers to common questions.
In addition to the resources listed above, our Professional Learning team offers customized professional development services for you and your teachers. Check out IXL’s Professional Learning to discover how our extensive professional development services can help your school have the best IXL experience possible!

Please feel free to reach out and let me know if you’d like assistance setting up teacher accounts, or if there is anything I can do to help you get started.
closing: I look forward to working with you this year!

Thank you for reaching out!


Admins can remove students through their admin account by doing the following:
  • Sign into your administrator account
  • Go to the Account Management tab
  • Click on the Students page
  • Find the student
  • Click the red “X” in that student’s row


The student is now deactivated and you may delete another in the same manner. Please note that student accounts can be retrieved and added back to your roster if necessary by a simple roster upload.

If you would like to remove a number of students, you can remove them by using our new tool available in your administrator account. You can simply click the “Upload roster” link found under the Account Management tab to access a secure upload page. Just click the “Remove these students/teachers from my roster” option once you have submitted the file.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or problems with this process and I will be happy to answer them. Feel free to check out our Administrator Frequently Asked Questions page as well for more administrator related questions.
closing: none
name: Remove Students - ADMIN

body:
I have merged TEACHER’s classroom subscription into your school subscription. You’ll notice that usernames and passwords were updated to match the school-wide format, and all practice data has been transferred.

If the students’ first and last names on the classroom roster did not match those on your master roster, their accounts were left inactive on the teacher's roster. To reactivate them, TEACHER can sign in to their IXL account, go to the Students page and click "Activate" at the bottom left of the student list.

Otherwise, students are all set up and may begin practicing right away!
greeting: *INCLUDE BOTH ADMIN AND TEACHER IN E-MAIL*</br></br>
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions or if I can be of any further assistance.
name: Classroom Merge Confirmation

body:
I noticed we haven’t received a roster from you to set up your IXL subscription. It may go on hold soon due to a lack of activity with it. To avoid this please compile a roster with the following information in separate columns of an Excel spreadsheet:
  • First name
  • Last name
  • Student ID number
  • Grade level
  • School (if applicable)
  • Student or parent email (recommended)
  • Teacher name
  • Teacher email
The last two columns will allow me to create teacher accounts and class rosters right away. If a student is associated with more than one teacher, please list each additional teacher in a separate column.If teachers have trial accounts please exclude from teacher list and e-mail those teachers’ names to me.

Once the file is ready, please submit it to our secure uploading page using the following link: https://www.ixl.com/admin/upload-roster-files﻿

https://www.ixl.com/userguides/IXLQuickStart_UploadRoster.pdf

body:
Congratulations - your student and teacher accounts have been created, and your class rosters are in place! Students can begin practicing and teachers will be able to begin monitoring their progress right away.

Your admin account information has been sent to XXXXX in a separate e-mail. From your admin account you will be able to manage student and teacher accounts, and monitor student performance.

You can access [ORG NAME’s] sign-in page at XXXXXXXX. Your custom sign-in page allows for simple and personalized access to IXL for administrators, teachers, and students. I recommend bookmarking this page for your students!

Teachers will also receive e-mails confirming their account information. New teachers can create accounts at any time by following the attached instructions.

Teachers who have trial accounts should follow the attached instructions under the heading, "If you already have a trial account," to ensure that their trial is successfully merged into your new subscription.

Getting Started Toolkit for Administrators

Need help getting started? We’ve created a toolkit of resources to help you, as an administrator, get your school set up using IXL.
  • Administrator Quick-start Guide The illustrated guide provide step-by-step instructions for how to manage student accounts and run school-wide reports.
  • Frequently Asked Questions Need more help? IXL’s Help Center offers answers to common questions.
In addition to the resources listed above, our Professional Learning team offers customized professional development services for you and your teachers. Check out IXL’s Professional Learning to discover how our extensive professional development services can help your school have the best IXL experience possible!
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions - I'm happy to be a resource for you and your teachers so feel free to contact me anytime!
name: New Set-up (Class rosters set-up)

body:
Welcome to IXL! My name is NAME and I am your Account SPECIALIST/COORDINATOR. I will be assisting you in getting your students and teachers started with the program.

We currently have XXXX set as your first day of school. If this is incorrect, please let me know of the correct date so that I may update that in our system.

To get started, you will need to compile an Excel file with two sheets, one for your students and one for your teachers. You may use the attached template file to work from, or you can create your own. The last column in the student file will allow you to add students to your teachers’ class rosters right away.

If a teacher has a trial account, please exclude them from the teacher list. They will receive instructions on how to merge their account into the new subscription.

Once the file is ready, you may upload it to our secure uploading page using the following link: XXX

Follow the instructions on that page to format your files and upload your roster. You may use the Upload Roster Quick-start Guide to help you with the process.

If you are having trouble uploading your file, please feel free to use the "Work with an account specialist" button to request help, and I will be happy to assist you with the process.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I look forward to hearing from you and helping you get started with IXL!
name: Initial Contact

body:
We currently support SSO via Google Single Sign-On. To implement this, you must first have Google Identities set up for your users.

You'll then need to send us a list of e-mail domains used by your users in Google identity. The IXL Account Services team will add this list of domains to your IXL account.

After Google SSO is enabled for your account, your users will see a blue "Sign in with Google" button on the custom sign-in page (https://www.ixl.com/signin/school_name). When they click this link they will be prompted to sign in with their Google credentials. IXL will match their Google Identity e-mail to their IXL e-mail, and your users will be signed in.
closing: none
name: SSO - Explained (CSE approved)

body:
I hope you're doing well! I see your school is currently using XXX of XXX student licenses. I'm happy to help get the rest of your students on board with IXL.

To create accounts for your new students, you may upload a file with the following student information in separate columns of an Excel file:

  • First name
  • Last name
  • Student ID number
  • Grade level
  • School (if applicable)
  • Student or parent e-mail (recommended)
  • Teacher e-mail

When ready, you can upload this information through the "Upload Roster" tool by signing into your admin account and clicking "Upload Roster" within the "Account Management" tab.

body:

To use this tool, simply log in to your administrator account, go to “Account Management”, then “Upload Roster”. Then follow the instructions on that page to format your files and upload your roster. If you have any trouble please click the “Work With An Account Specialist” button to transfer the file to me securely and I will be happy to assist you.

For your convenience, we have included a PDF to help guide you through this process:

https://www.ixl.com/userguides/IXLQuickStart_UploadRoster.pdf

If you would like to add them individually, you can add students by going to the Account Management tab and selecting the “Add new students” button at the top of the Students page.

Teachers will then be able to pull this student onto their rosters by going to their individual rosters and selecting the “Add new students” button in the bottom right hand corner of their roster.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or problems with this process and I will be happy to answer them.

2. Upload an Excel spreadsheet through the secure “Upload Roster” page with the following student information in separate columns of an Excel file:

Hi NAME,

Thank you for uploading your student list. Your students have been created accounts and you can now view their usernames and passwords on your master roster.

The next step is to create teacher accounts and class rosters in one of the following three ways.

Below are instructions on how you can add students to your teacher roster.

  1. Sign in to your IXL account

  2. Click the drop-down menu at the top-right of the screen

  3. Click "Roster"

  4. Click “Add Students” at the bottom of the page

  5. Type your student's name into the blank entry field that appears.


If the student is already on your school's master roster, their name will auto-populate, and all you have to do is click to add them!

If the student is not on the master roster, simply type their full information into the blank entry fields, then click "Save". This will add the student to your teacher roster and to your school's master roster.


You can use our Teacher Quick-start Guide to help guide you in this process as well.

name: Disable audio
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: While there's not a way to disable audio support for Pre-K through 2nd grade, you can mute the volume on your iPad to prevent the audio from being played out loud. Once you mute your iPad, your children won't be to hear the audio on IXL even if they tap the speaker icon.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: No sound effects in iPad app
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
If you aren't hearing sound effects in the app, I recommend making sure that sound effects are enabled. You can make sure sound effects are enabled in the iPad app by following these steps:

1. Open the IXL iPad app and sign in.
2. Tap your name in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.
3. Ensure that the Sound effects switch is turned on.

If you continue to have trouble hearing the sound effects in the app, it may also be due to the "mute" switch on your iPad. There is a switch on the side of your iPad that can mute and un-mute system sounds.

Even while system sounds are muted, many sources of audio (such as playing a song in iTunes) will still work. However, when system sounds are muted the sound effects from the IXL app will not work.

If you flip the switch on your iPad to turn off muting and enable system sounds, you will be able to use the iPad app for IXL and hear the sound effects once more.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: SFTP Setup
body:
Dear NAME,

Thank you for your interest in auto-rostering! With auto-rostering your rosters will be updated on a nightly basis based on files sent to us through our SFTP server. Once we receive your initial files, we will begin the testing process. Since every file is different, the testing process may take up to two weeks.

When you are ready, you can upload your files to our SFTP server:

URL: sftp.ixl.com, port 22
Username: USERNAME

You can view your password by clicking the secure message link below. You'll only be able to access this link once before the message expires. Please save your new password somewhere secure after opening the message.

Click here to view your password: SECURELINK

Every set of files we receive is slightly different, so we’ll run a few tests once we receive your first upload. As soon as testing is complete, we’ll reach out to schedule nightly syncs.

Let me know when you've uploaded your files the SFTP, and our engineers will begin testing them.

name: Printing larger ? log reports
body:
Our engineers are working to allow printing again as soon as possible. In the meantime, you can save a copy of your student's reports in a PDF format and print them out that way to avoid this issue. To save a webpage as a PDF in Google Chrome, please follow these steps:

1) Open the Questions log report you would like to print
2) Press Ctrl + P on your keyboard
3) Click Change underneath the "Destination" section in the Print window that appears.
4) Click Save as PDF underneath the "Local destination" section.
5) Click the blue Save button in the top-left section of the Print window.

This will save a copy of the webpage as a PDF on your computer. You can then open the PDF and print it as you would any other PDF file and everything will print normally.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Third Contact
body:
I noticed we haven’t received a roster from you to set up your IXL subscription. Your account may go on hold soon due to a lack of activity with it. To avoid this please compile a roster with the following information in separate columns on an Excel spreadsheet:

  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Student ID
  • Grade


To get started, you will need to compile an Excel file with two sheets, one for your students and one for your teachers. You may use the attached template file to work from, or you can create your own.


The last column in the student file will allow you to add students to your teachers’ class rosters right away.


The last two columns will allow me to create teacher accounts and class rosters right away. If a student is associated with more than one teacher, please list each additional teacher in a separate column.


If a teacher has a trial account, please exclude them from the teacher list. I will send instructions on how to merge their trial account once the subscription is activated.


Once the file is ready, please upload it to our secure uploading page using the following link: XXXXXXXXXX


Then follow the instructions on that page to format your files and upload your roster. For your convenience, here is a link to our Upload Roster Quick Start Guide: https://www.ixl.com/userguides/IXLQuickStart_UploadRoster.pdf﻿
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns and I will be happy to answer them.

body:
Thank you for reaching out! Teachers can create classes within their rosters by taking the following steps:
  1. From your account menu in the upper-right corner, select “Roster”.
  2. Click "Start using classes" on the right side of the page, just above your roster. If this link is unavailable, it has already been clicked and you can skip to step 5.
  3. Type in a name for each class you would like to create.
  4. Click "Submit." Your classes have now been created!
  5. Click on the blank space in a student's "Class" column to choose a class in which to place that student.
  6. Click "Save" after you have selected the class.
  7. To create additional classes, click on the blank space in a student's "Class" column and click "Add a class."
Please let me know if you have any other questions or problems with this process and I will be happy to answer them.
closing: none
name: Create Classes - Teacher
iPad Contact form
body:
To help me further investigate the issue, please send a support form through the app. The support form will provide me with more information about your iPad and the IXL app installed. You can send us a support form on the app by following these steps:

1) Open the IXL app and sign in to your account.
2) Tap your name in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.
3) Tap Contact us.
4) Fill in your information in the boxes provided.
5) Tap Submit on the top-right hand corner of the screen.


This will send a support form directly to Technical Support and I'll be able to further investigate.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Delete u/p from Google Chrome
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
It sounds like the prior student's username and password was saved in your browser. You can permanently delete the old username and password by following these steps:

1) Open Google Chrome.
2) Click the three vertical dots in the upper right corner of your screen.
3) Click Settings.
4) Click Passwords underneath Autofill.
5) Click the three vertical dots to the right of the ixl.com username and password you would like to delete.
6) Click Remove.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be glad to assist.

name: QW Deletion Student
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: While you can no longer use your account, certain residual information remains associated with your account and under the control of your teacher. If you would like that information removed, please contact your instructor. If needed, we will be able to help your instructor delete all of your information.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.

name: e-mailing student u/p
body:
In an effort to protect the privacy of our students, we have replaced the option to e-mail parents/students their usernames and passwords with an option to print pre-filled username and password cards. You can then share these cards with your students.

While there's not currently a way to to e-mail your students, I have shared your experience with our design team.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Forwarding e-mails from gmail
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Only one e-mail address can be added to your account at a time. However, you can set up your gmail.com e-mail address to automatically forward e-mails from IXL to a second email account. I found more information about forwarding gmail.com e-mails here:

https://support.google.com/mail/answer/10957?hl=en
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Certified expert
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: To become a certified expert, I recommend attending IXL Live! This event is a hands on experience led by an IXL Professional Learning Specialist who will offer teachers a guided exploration of all IXL has to offer. Each participant will leave with a certificate and be recognized as a certified expert. You'll also return to your school with a wealth of insight to share. To learn more about the program and the series of scheduled events, you can go to www.ixl.com/live. If there is not an event in your area, you can enter your e-mail address and zip code to be notified when an event is scheduled nearby.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Deactivation
body:
Thank you for uploading your student list.

The students listed have been removed from your subscription, and the licenses are now free to use for new students.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions!

name: Auto-Rostering ClassLink Kickoff
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, an IXL Support Engineer.

IXL's Auto-Rostering feature will let you sync data from your SIS into your IXL account, effectively allowing you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

IXL supports the OneRoster v1.1 file standard. With ClassLink, you can set up an SFTP connection to IXL and export your user and class data in the OneRoster v1.1 standard.

If you would like to move forward with the Auto-Rostering feature, please let me know and I will enable this for the account. Enabling the feature will generate an SFTP key that I can provide to you so that you can access the server to upload files.

Do you have a preferred SFTP username? If you do not have a preference, your username will be a randomly generated 4 digit code.

​Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist further.

name: Auto-Rostering ClassLink Kickoff 2
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, a Support Engineer for IXL.

To confirm, are you writing about the IXL account at the following link:

https://www.ixl.com/signin/customurl

I can enable the Auto-Rostering feature for this account. This will allow you to export ClassLink data in the OneRoster v1.1 file format to IXL through an SFTP connection.

I do not currently see your e-mail address associated with this IXL account. I will need to have either the primary or secondary contact on the account e-mail me authorizing me to grant you access to connect via SFTP.

The points of contact I have for this account are [CONTACT]. Please have either one e-mail me authorizing me to grant you access.

Once I have the verification, I can enable the Auto-Rostering integration which will generate an SFTP key that I can provide to you so that you can access the server to upload files.

Do you have a preferred SFTP username? If you do not have a preference, your username will be a randomly generated 4 digit code.

​Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will be happy to assist further.

name: Certificate delay
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
It can take up to 72 hours between when your students earn a certificate and when that certificate is e-mailed to you. This can cause a discrepancy between the number of questions on a certificate and the number of questions they have actually completed. The data you and they see in your reports is always current, but there isn't a way to generate the certificates more quickly.

It may help to let them know that IXL is keeping track of all the hard work they're doing, it just takes us some time to award them with their new certificates.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Auto-Roster Manual Confirmation
body:
Thank you very much for the confirmation.

I have manually processed the Auto-Roster sync for your IXL account.

Please let me know if you have any questions, and I would be happy to assist.

If you are having trouble viewing practice questions, please follow the steps found here to uninstall the IXL app.

Once you have cleared the app from your device, please try reinstalling it from the Google Play store. You should then be able to view the questions on IXL.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!
name: Android issue (app)

body:
If you are having trouble viewing practice questions, you may need to add IXL as a trusted site on your iPad. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap the Settings icon.
2) In the list of settings in the left menu, tap General.
3) In the right menu, swipe down and tap Restrictions.
4) Enter your iPad passcode when prompted to access your list of website restrictions.
5) Tap Websites in the Allowed content section.
6) Tap Add a website... under the Always allow heading at the bottom of the list of allowed websites.
7) Enter "ixl.com" as the URL.
8) Tap Done on your keypad.

The next time you sign in to IXL on your app you should be able to view the questions. However, if you still have difficulties viewing all of the questions, please follow these steps to uninstall the app, restart your iPad, and reinstall the app:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap and hold the IXL icon.
2) Tap the X in the top-left corner of the icon once it appears.
3) Turn off your iPad by holding the power button and then sliding the prompt to turn off your iPad when it appears.
4) Turn on your iPad by pressing the power button.
5) Reinstall the app by going to www.ixl.com or by searching for it in the App store.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you. I want to make sure you can use your iPad to practice on IXL.
name: Questions don't appear on iPad-app
Switch to OneRoster data standard
body:
I will create an internal ticket with our development team to change the data standard for your account to accept the OneRoster v1.1 file format. I will let you know once this is done.

After this is completed, you can enter the SFTP information for IXL into ClassLink to perform the data export.

Once we have received the first upload, we match the new OneRoster data to the data on your account and perform a manual sync.

After that, we will sync any data we receive from ClassLink nightly.

I will follow up with you once our developers have changed the data standard for your account. Please let me know if you have any questions in the meantime.

name: Auto-Rostering Template 2 kickoff
body:
*********** partial template *********

Once you have connected, you may upload your first set of data.

After the initial upload, I will audit the data along with a member of our development team. I will communicate any issues with the data to you.

Once the first set of data has been audited, we will cover additional options for preexisting data on your IXL account.

After that, we will perform the first sync manually.

After the first sync has been run, IXL will sync data nightly based on data uploaded by you to the SFTP site.

name: Change Username (Family)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I would be happy to help you change your username. Because a lot of usernames in IXL are already taken, please let me know 3 usernames you would prefer to change yours to, in order of preference. Once I have a list of 3 usernames you would like to change your username to, I'll be happy to take a closer look at changing your username.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Failed by bundle overflow
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

We received an alert that your account did not sync because the number of students on the account would exceed the number of licenses available.

I see that the account is currently using X of Y licenses. In the uploaded CSV I see Z students.

We do have the ability to match any existing users to the files we receive via SFTP, and remove any users already in the account that do not appear in the CSV files we receive.

If this is something you would like me to do, please let me know. Otherwise, you will need to reduce the number of users in your IXL account before we can process a successful Auto-Roster sync.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

I understand you have a question about your "Basic Spanish" class. The eBook included in your book package is a digital copy of the general textbook for "Basic Spanish” without any subject specific material. The portions of your book dealing with the specific vocabulary being taught in your course are located in the student activities manual portion of your online book.

Your instructor will also be able to view this eBook to reference the page numbers and chapters that you and your classmates have access to. As you progress through each of the lessons assigned from the student activities manual, you will come across vocabulary and activities specifically geared toward the specific material being taught in your course.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Basic Spanish eBooks

body:
I understand you have a question about your "Basic Spanish" class. The eBook included in your book package is a digital copy of the general textbook for "Basic Spanish” without any subject specific material. The portions of your book dealing with the specific vocabulary being taught in your course are located in the student activities manual portion of your online book.

Your instructor will also be able to view this eBook to reference the page numbers and chapters that you and your classmates have access to. As you progress through each of the lessons assigned from the student activities manual, you will come across vocabulary and activities specifically geared toward the specific material being taught in your course.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Basic Spanish eBooks
Auto-Rostering Kickoff 3
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, an IXL Support Engineer for our Auto-Rostering feature.

IXL's Auto-Rostering feature allows you to sync data from your SIS into your IXL account, effectively allowing you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

If you would like to move forward with the Auto-Rostering feature, please let me know and I will enable this for the account.

Before enabling Auto-Rostering, there are a few things I need to know from you:
  1. Who will be the main technical point of contact for Auto-Rostering? This person should:
    • Be able to manage user data in your SIS
    • Be able to manage an SFTP connection and data export
  2. The SIS you are using
  3. Your preferred SFTP username (optional)
    • This will be the username used for your SFTP connection
    • If you do not have a preference, IXL will randomly generate a four digit code to act as your SFTP username
  4. The data format you will use for your exports into IXL. This can be one of two formats:
    • The data format developed specifically for IXL, which can be found documented here: https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf
    • IXL also supports the OneRoster v1.1 data format, which is documented here: https://www.imsglobal.org/oneroster-v11-final-csv-tables
  5. How to handle users already on your IXL account. These options will help your IXL account more closely match the data from your SIS, and will clean up previous years' teacher rosters.
    • Would you like us to archive any students not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to archive any teachers not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to archive any teacher rosters for any teachers uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
  6. Your first day of school
Once I know your main point of contact, as well as your preferences from the above questions, I can enable the Auto-Rostering feature for your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: Content  Concerns
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us. We appreciate very much that you've shared this with us, the thoughts and feedback of the families at your school are important to us.
body: IXL is used by students from diverse backgrounds, and it is important to us that students see themselves and their experiences represented in our content. As such, IXL's goal is to have the families shown in our various skills reflect the real-life diversity of families across the country. This would include same-gender parents, single parents, and mixed-race parents in the families portrayed in different questions. While we don't have a way to skip questions or exclude particular content, teachers are welcome to select from the available skills the ones that they feel are most appropriate for their classes.
closing: Thank you again for sharing your concerns with us, and please let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.

name: Removing Custom Domain
body:
Please follow these steps to remove the custom domain from the app settings:

1) Tap the Settings icon on your home screen.
2) Tap IXL in the left menu.
3) On the right side menu tap Custom sign-in @.
4) Delete the custom domain. The custom domain will no longer be stored on your iPad.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!

name: failed_by_num_changes grade level
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

Our nightly sync service detected a large number of changes were made to your uploaded CSV files. As a precaution, we do not automatically process files that will cause greater than 10% changes to your IXL account.

These changes are from students being added or removed from the student roster, or for grade level changes for existing students.

If these changes are intended, please let me know and I would be happy to process the roster sync for your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

name: failed_by_num_changes summer
body:
My name is Roland Estrada, and I am the support engineer for IXL's Auto-Rostering feature.

Our nightly sync service detected a large number of changes were made to your uploaded CSV files. As a precaution, we do not automatically process files that will cause greater than 10% changes to your IXL account.

These changes are from students being added or removed from the student roster, or for grade level changes for existing students.

If these changes are intended, please let me know and I would be happy to process the roster sync for your account.

Additionally, as many schools move into the new school year, I wanted to make you aware of some additional options available to you for your IXL data. These options will help your IXL account more closely match the data from your SIS, and will clean up previous years' teacher rosters.

At your request, IXL can:
  • Remove any students not uploaded via Auto-Rostering
  • Remove any teachers not uploaded via Auto-Rostering
  • Archive teacher rosters for any teachers created via Auto-Rostering
Please let me know if you would like me to process the roster changes on your account, as well as your preference for those additional options.

name: USE Restoring Data (Sample Note)
body:
Admin permission has been granted.

Please restore the students’ practice data for the following:

Account: AXX-###### [Name of the school]
Subject:
Students:

Please let me know if you have any questions via Slack. Thank you!
closing: N/A

name: Auto-responder
body:
It looks like you've been receiving these e-mails because your "summer vacation" auto-responder has been responding to our weekly e-mail reports. I suggest temporarily turning off your weekly reports to avoid receiving these "Help Request Received" e-mails.

If you would like to turn off the weekly e-mail reports that you've been receiving, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that opens.
4) Clear the Receive weekly summary e-mails checkbox.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

You will no longer receive weekly reports on your students. If you would like to re-enable these reports, you can follow these same steps but check the box in step 4.
version0Field: Taking a look, your auto-responder message that you were out of school responded to a class certificate we sent to you. All replies to certificates are sent to IXL Technical Support as a help request. Our auto-responder replied to yours about a request, even if you did not personally send one. Since you didn't send a request, please feel free to disregard the message from our auto-responder.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.
versions: Taking a look, your auto-responder message that you were out of school responded to a class certificate we sent to you. All replies to certificates are sent to IXL Technical Support as a help request. Our auto-responder replied to yours about a request, even if you did not personally send one. Since you didn't send a request, please feel free to disregard the message from our auto-responder.

name: AR Enabled kickoff 4
body:
Thank you very much for getting back to me. I have enabled the Auto-Rostering integration for your IXL account.

You may upload your Auto-Roster data to our SFTP site using the following information to connect:

URL: sftp.ixl.com, port 22
Username:
Password: The SFTP key sent in a secure message by e-mail to you at

After you have uploaded the initial set of data, I will audit the data along with a member of our development team. I will communicate any issues with the data to you.

Once we have reviewed the data, our development team will manually perform the first Auto-Roster sync in accordance with your preferences.

After the first sync, our nightly processor will run every night at midnight, eastern time. Any data uploaded before that time will be processed and synced to your account.

​Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: Choosing Subjects in the Diagnostic
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Students are able to choose if they only receive math or language arts questions in the Diagnostic from their account. To do so, students can follow these steps:

1) Go to https://www.ixl.com/signin/CUSTOMDOMAIN and sign in.
2) Click Diagnostic in the bar near the top of the page.
3) Click the "step in and answer more questions link" at the top of the page.
4) Click the arrows in the bottom-right corner of the "Take a peek at your levels" box.
5) Choose the subject the student would like to diagnose from the drop-down menu that appears. The circles indicate students will receive math and language arts skills, the triangle indicates they will receive only math questions, and the book will receive only language arts questions.

The student will then only see questions for the subject they have selected. Students will select their subject each time they answer questions in the Diagnostic.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Kid Quote
body:
I am glad to hear that you are interested in starting an IXL membership!

To view our membership options or register, parents and teachers may visit our Membership page.

If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you.
closing: Sincerely,

name: Quote Recipe
body:
I am glad to hear that you are interested in starting an IXL membership!

You and each of your children can access unlimited practice and comprehensive reporting tools with one IXL family membership. Each child using IXL may sign in with a shared family username and password, and then choose his or her personal profile to begin practicing.

The package you are interested in, which includes SUBJECTS for NUMBER children, is PRICE per month or PRICE per year. To view our membership options or register, visit our Membership page.

If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you.
closing: Let me know if I can help any further.

name: Account on hold - teacher
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I checked your school's subscription and it does appear to be on hold. I recommend speaking with ADMIN who is your school's IXL administrator. ADMIN will be able to assist with resolving any issues causing the hold.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Fall Set-up Reversed
greeting: Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
body:
IXL has an automated process that occurs two weeks prior to the first day of school that is listed in the system for a subscription. The process promotes all students up a grade level and clears teachers rosters to get ready for the new year. We send out automated e-mails warning about the process to the primary administrator (cc'ed here), but we need to be notified if it is to be deactivated.

Your school’s subscription has the first day of school listed as DATE, so the promotion and roster clearing occurred DATE.

I have reversed the promotion of the students, reactivated the dropped students, restored teacher rosters, and deactivated the process from occurring again this school year. All student progress and credentials are intact.
closing: I apologize for the inconvenience and frustration this has caused. Please let me know if there is anything else I can do for you.

body: If I remove access to your account, you will no longer be able to view your educational records. However, some residual information will remain in order to preserve the records under your instructor’s control. If you would like to have those records fully removed from our databases, please ask your instructor to contact us at help@quia.com to confirm that those records may be deleted and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber}.
closing: If you wish to proceed with removing your access to your account without deleting the information required to preserve your educational record, please let me know and I will be happy to help.
name: QW Student

closing: As requested, I have deleted your account and information from our records. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to let me know.
name: QW Instructor Confirm

body: I am happy to delete your account, as requested. Once your account is deleted, any quizzes or grades and any files uploaded to your account will be permanently deleted. If you wish to proceed, please confirm that you would like to delete all content and grades in your account.
closing: I look forward to receiving that confirmation and assisting you with your request promptly.
name: QW Instructor (single)

body: I am happy to delete your account, as requested. Once deleted, any quizzes or grades shared on your network and any files uploaded to your account will be permanently deleted. If you have teachers who have copied content you created that use pictures or other files uploaded to your account, or if you have shared content over your school’s Quia Network, deleting your account will affect those other teachers, too. In order to delete your account, please have your school’s Quia Web administrator NAME contact me at help@quia.com to request the deletion of your account as well. Please have your instructor include your case number ({!Case.CaseNumber}) when writing to us to process your request as quickly as possible.
closing: I look forward to receiving that confirmation and assisting you with your request promptly.
