body: I am happy to delete the account you requested. Once this is done, any quizzes or grades shared on your network and any files uploaded to this account will be permanently removed. In order to delete your account, please confirm that you would like to have this information permanently removed.
closing: I look forward to receiving that confirmation and assisting you with your request promptly.

While permission cannot come from your child’s teachers, they will be able to request the account be deleted from the principal or other designated staff member on your behalf. Please have the school include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} when writing to us to process your request as quickly as possible.

body: I am happy to delete your account, as requested.  Once completed, you will no longer have access to any of your students’ records.  If you wish to proceed with the deletion, please confirm that you no longer need access to your records at IXL and I will be happy to help.
name: IXL Teacher site Deletion

body: I am happy to delete your account, as requested. Once deleted, any student accounts and results will be permanently deleted, too. If you wish to proceed, please confirm that you would like to have this student information deleted as well.
closing: I look forward to receiving that confirmation and assisting you with your request promptly.
name: Deletion - Teacher(Primary Contact)

body:
I'm happy to help you purchase a book key!

To purchase a book key, log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to open your book to submit your work.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: How do I purchase a book key?

body:
If you do not currently have a course code, you have the option to use your book independently. To do so please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://iconline.cheng-tsui.com and log in.
2. Click the "Book details" link.
3. Click "Use book independently" and confirm it when prompted.

You can now open your book and submit your work independently without an instructor. Please note that work you complete independently will be cleared from your account if you register for another course using this book.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know!
name: Use Book Independently

body:
If you bought a used book, you will need to purchase access to your online book separately. Log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to click "Open book" to submit your work.

However, if you purchased a new book from your campus bookstore and received this book key, please return the key to your campus bookstore. They are the only ones who may be able to provide you with a refund or exchange the key you have for a new one.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Received Used Key (could be new or used)

body:
If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a Cheng & Tsui book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The Cheng & Tsui book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Cheng & Tsui package, you can purchase your online book access (the same as entering a book key) by going to http://iconline.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book.

However, if you purchased a new book from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please return to your campus bookstore to explain what happened. They are the only ones who may be able to provide you with a refund or a new book key.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Book has no key; might be standalone

body:
If you are having trouble watching the video in your book, then the Flash installed on your browser is not streaming the video properly. Adobe Flash Player is a technology your browser uses to play the video on our site.

You may be able to fix this problem by disabling any extensions installed on your browser that you do not use. Extensions can interfere with how your browser handles Flash content. You can view all of your extensions here:

chrome://extensions

Click the icon of a trash can to remove any extensions you do not recognize or use.

Alternatively, you can download and use a completely new browser. A newly installed browser will not have any extensions installed, and you will be able to log in to your account using it to open your book and view your videos.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you should have no further browser problems with the video in your book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Video problems (Chrome)

body: If you did not buy your online book through our online bookstore, please contact the vendor from whom you made your purchase.  They will be the only ones able to issue you a refund.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Refund from bookstore

body:
When you purchase your online book directly from us, access to the book is instantly added to your Cheng & Tsui account. Your book access is not a physical book or book key that you receive in the mail. Instead, it's an electronic book.

If you go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in to your account, you will see that access to your book has been enabled. Enter your course code, if necessary, and you will be able to open your book and complete your assignments.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions!
name: Purchased Key Online, Where is it?

body: If you bought your book key from our online bookstore, please provide me with the confirmation number e-mailed to you when you made your purchase.  If your transaction was made within the last 30 days, I will be able to provide you with a refund.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Student Requesting Refund

body:
If you are having trouble hearing the audio in your book, I recommend that you download and install the latest version of Flash from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist!
name: Audio Problems

body:
I understand you have a question about your book key. Your book is saved in your account, so you won't need to re-enter a book key. However, you do need to enter a new course code in the field provided to begin submitting activities to your new instructor. Your instructor can provide you with this course code.

If your instructor has trouble locating the course code or you are unable to contact your instructor, feel free to send me your instructor's name, e-mail address, and the title of your new course. I will be happy to try to find it for you.

You can follow these steps to change your course:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Registration options" link.
3. Click the "Change course/instructor" link.
4. Enter your new course code and click "Submit".

You will now be enrolled in your new course.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!
name: Change Instructor/Course

body:
To change the class or section you are enrolled in with your instructor, follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2) Enter your username and password in the spaces provided and click "Log in”.
3) Click the "Registration options" link.
4) Click "Change class".
5) Select your new class and click "Submit".

You will now be enrolled in your new class.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know!

4. Select your new class and click "Submit".

You will now be enrolled into your new class.

You will now be enrolled in your new class.

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Options" button.
3. Click the "Change class" link.
4. Select your new class and click "Submit".


You will now be enrolled into your new class.

I understand you have a question about your course code. When your instructor creates a course using Cheng & Tsui, he or she automatically receives a course code. Once you enter that course code, you will be registered for your instructor's course. Course codes are unique codes that are made up of a series of 3-6 random letters followed by 3 numbers.

Please contact your instructor for your course code. In instructor accounts, Cheng & Tsui displays the course code below the course title.
closing: If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please provide me with your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

body:
I understand you have a question about buying a book and then using it independently.

First, you can follow these steps to purchase online access to your book from our bookstore:

1) Go to http://iconline.cheng-tsui.com and log in.
2) Click the "Bookstore" link at the top of the page.
3) Enter the name of your book into the "Title" field and click "Search." We do not sell print versions of any books, so the prices you see will be for an online book only.
4) Click "buy" next to the book in the search results.
5) Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information.

Your online book will be instantly added to your account. You can then follow these steps to use it without a course code:

1) Go to http://iconline.cheng-tsui.com and log in.
2) Click the "Book details" link.
3) Click "Use book independently" and confirm it when prompted.

You can now open your book and submit your work independently without an instructor. Please note that work you complete independently will be cleared from your account if you register for a course using this book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Buy book, use independently

Course name:
Course code:

Enter your course code into your account to complete your registration. You will now be enrolled into your instructor's course, and can open your book and complete your assignments.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know!
name: Sending course code

body:
You can create an account and enroll in your course by following these steps:

1. Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2. Click "Create an account".
3. Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4. Click "Enter a course code".
5. Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6. If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click "Go". Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify that your name is entered correctly and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. Once completed, you can safely discard your book key.

If you need to purchase a book key, you can do so by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. From here, you can purchase a book key (and not a physical book) that Cheng & Tsui will instantly add to your account. When you make your purchase, you will not see an actual book key; instead Cheng & Tsui will enter it into your account automatically.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

To access your account in the future, go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using Cheng & Tsui! Please let me know if you have any questions.
name: Student Registration

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist!

body:
To purchase a book key, log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. I recommend purchasing the "Cengage Unlimited" package, as this is the most reasonably priced option.

If you do buy that package, follow these steps to obtain your book key:


1) After purchasing Unlimited, search on the product title or ISBN


2) In the results, add the iLrn product to Home (there can be several products, eBooks ,etc associated with a title--pick the iLrn one)


3) Close the green box


4) A blue "Open" button will appear--click on it!


5) You will go to the register/access page with instructions on how to register on the iLrn site. You will need to copy the book key generated on this page


6) Click on "Register"


7) You will go to the cengage.com/ilrn page--this is the page to bookmark as we will post updates on the ilrn conversion and other resources here.


8) Click on "Sign in"


9) You will go to hlc.quia.com where you either log into your existing student account or create a new one


10) Paste the book key you copied into the "Book Key" field in the upper right of the student workstation


11) Your iLrn course will appear (if you have multiple iLrn courses you might have to scroll)


12) Enter the course code you got from your instructor. You're done!
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Try recording the exercise again. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
name: Microphone Check

body: Please send me the book key you're entering into your account and I'll be happy to investigate further.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you soon.
greeting: I'm sorry to hear that your book key isn't working.
name: Key doesn't work, send key to investigate

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Microphone Check (Chrome)

body:
I'm happy to assist with your question about viewing your book.

It looks like you've already linked your book with your course in your account. I was able to open the book from your account and access the assignments. Please go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in to your account, then try to click the image of your book to open a new window and access the book.

If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all!

body:
I'm happy to help with your question about your books.

It appears you have purchased access to the "BOOKTITLE" activities manual. However, your instructor requires you to have access to the complete iLrn package, not just the activities manual. If you believe that your course will not use the online textbook activities, please have your instructor contact us directly to make the necessary changes to your course.

In order to access your assignments as your course is set up, you will need to purchase the $27 upgrade to the iLrn package. This pays for the textbook activities, eBook, and other materials included in the iLrn package but not found in the activities manual.

To upgrade to the iLrn, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the "buy" link beneath the name of the book.
3) Follow the prompts to purchase the textbook activities required to upgrade to the iLrn package.

When you're finished, you will instantly have access to the complete iLrn package and you will be able to do your homework.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: iLrn upgrade

body:
I'm happy to help with your question about accessing your book.

Your course does not require the full iLrn package that you have purchased access to. Your course is only requiring the eSAM component of the iLrn package, which you have access to already from your account. You will not need the materials in the iLrn to get full credit for the exercises your instructor assigns.

You do still have the option to use the rest of the iLrn package independently. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Book details" link for the iLrn package.
3. Click "Use book independently" and confirm it when prompted.

You can now click on the iLrn package to open the complete package and submit your work independently without an instructor. Please note that any work you complete independently cannot be reviewed by your instructor, and all your graded work should be accessed by first clicking on the title of your course in your account.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know!
name: Extra book in package

body:
You can follow these steps to enroll in your course and access your online book:

1) Go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in.
2) Enter your course code in the box and click Submit.
3) If prompted, select your specific class or section, then click Submit.

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click Go. Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify your name and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. You can then safely discard your book key.

If you do not have a book key, you can purchase one by clicking the buy link for the book in the My classes section of your account. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Your book key will be instantly added to your account.

Once you've entered your course code and purchased or entered your book key you will be fully registered and able to start your assignments!

To access your account in the future, go to http://iconline.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using Cheng & Tsui! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
name: Enrollment - Account already created

body:
If you bought a book from somewhere other than your campus bookstore, it may not have included a book key. The book key is usually packaged with your textbook in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. The HLC book key is a 19 character code that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Heinle Learning Center package, you can purchase your online book access (the same as entering a book key) by going to http://hlc.quia.com and logging in. Enter your course code and, when your course information appears, click the "buy" link for your book. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.

However, if you purchased a book new from your campus bookstore and received no book key, please scan or take a digital picture of the receipt from your book purchase and send it to me in a reply to this e-mail. Please be sure that the receipt (including the part with the phone number of the bookstore) is legible in your e-mail message. Also include your name, e-mail address, support ticket ID, and school name.
closing: Once I am able to verify that your purchase was supposed to include a book key, I will be able to assist further.
name: Book has no key; might be standalone

body: I am writing to let you know that we received permission from your instructor to delete your records from our database. Your instructor will no longer be able to access your educational records for that course.
closing: Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help!
name: Deletion-Student/Instructor confirm

body:
I am happy to delete your account as you requested. While checking your account I noticed that you are listed as the primary instructor on some of your courses and as a secondary instructor on others. If your account is deleted these courses will be handled differently.

For any courses where you are listed as the primary instructor, once your account is deleted, you and your students will lose access to all educational grades and records. If your school and your students no longer need access to those records, please confirm that you would like to delete your account and I will proceed with fulfilling your request.

For any courses where you are not listed as the primary instructor, all of your students' educational grades and records will remain listed under the course and available to them and the primary instructor. If you would like to have those records fully removed from our databases, please ask the primary instructor to contact us at bookhelp@quia.com to confirm that those records may be deleted and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber}.
closing: If you wish to proceed with deleting your account as detailed above, please let me know and I will be happy to help.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
name: Deletion - Instructor

body: As requested, I have disabled access to your account. Some information related to your educational record remains under the control of your instructor. Any book access remaining in your account has been lost.
closing: Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help!

body:
{!Contact.FirstName},

Thank you for reaching out to us.

I am happy to delete your account as you requested. Because you are not listed as the primary instructor, all of your students' educational grades and records will remain listed under the course and available to them and the primary instructor. If you would like to have those records fully removed from our databases, please ask the primary instructor to contact us at bookhelp@quia.com to confirm that those records may be deleted and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber}.
closing: If you wish to proceed with deleting your account without deleting the information required to preserve your students’ educational records, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

Thank you for your reply.

closing: Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help!

If you would like to have those records fully removed from our databases, please ask your instructor to contact us at bookhelp@quia.com to confirm that those records may be deleted and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber}.

Please know that since your book key has been saved in your account it cannot be reused or transferred to another student, even after your account is deleted. When your account is deleted you will lose any remaining access to your book.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Try recording the exercise again. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
name: Microphone Check

I'm happy to help with your refund request.

If you bought your online book through the Quia Bookstore, please provide me with the confirmation number e-mailed to you when you made your purchase. If your transaction was made within the last 30 days, I will be able to provide you with a refund.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist.

body:
If you are having trouble watching the video in your book, then the Flash installed on your browser is not streaming the video properly. Adobe Flash Player is a technology your browser uses to play the video on our site.

You may be able to fix this problem by disabling any extensions installed on your browser that you do not use. Extensions can interfere with how your browser handles Flash content. You can view all of your extensions here:

chrome://extensions

Click the icon of a trash can to remove any extensions you do not recognize or use.

Alternatively, you can download and use a completely new browser. A newly installed browser will not have any extensions installed, and you will be able to log in to your account using it to open your book and view your videos.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, please use it to download and install Flash again here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Once you have an updated version of Flash on the Firefox browser, you should have no further problems with the video in your book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
name: Video problems (Chrome)

Your book key is usually packaged with your book in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. Quia book keys are 19-character codes that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Quia package, you can purchase your book access online. To do so, please log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.

When your instructor creates a course on Quia, he or she automatically receives a course code. Once you enter that course code, you will be registered for your instructor's course. Course codes are unique codes that are made up of a series of 3-6 random letters followed by 3 numbers.

A free, 3-week trial is available for some online books. This trial will allow you full access to your assignments without requiring you to make a purchase.

To begin your free trial, please follow these steps:

2) Enter the course code your instructor gave you, if you have not already done so.

5) Follow the prompts to complete activating your trial.

You will be able to submit your assignments to your instructor. At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

If no audio plays when you click the play button, Adobe Flash Player is being blocked by your browser, Firefox. To fix this, please follow these steps

1) Open the Firefox browser.
2) Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines).
3) Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4) If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5) On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6) Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate".
7) Close the browser to save the changes.

Once you open a new window you should be able to play the audio with no further issue.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

body:
I'm happy to help you register!

You can follow these steps to create an account and enroll in your course:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2) Click "Create account".
3) Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4) Click "Enter a course code".
5) Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6) If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click "Go". Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify that your name is entered correctly and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. Once completed, you can safely discard your book key.

If you need to purchase a book key, you can do so by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

To access your account in the future, go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using the Heinle Learning Center! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

name: Video problems
What is the IXL Diagnostic?
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is designed to tell you exactly what students know and what to do next to help them improve by revealing your students’ working grade levels. It also helps you plan for small-group instruction by grouping students working at similar levels and displaying the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups.

To help your students get started, have them go to IXL.com to sign in and click Diagnostic. We recommend that students initially aim to answer 50-85 questions per subject to reveal complete Diagnostic data, which doesn’t have to be done in one sitting. Once complete data is revealed, students can answer 10-15 diagnostic questions per week to keep the IXL Continuous Diagnostic up to date.

You’ll know students have revealed completed Diagnostic data when their working grade levels narrow down to a single number, showing their level in each strand as well as their overall level. For example, a level of 500 indicates readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills.

To view your students’ Diagnostic data sign in, click Analytics and select Diagnostic. You will then be directed to the Diagnostic Overview where you can view and print your students’ detailed results. To view your students grouped by common skill recommendations, click on any of the strands listed on the top menu to view the Diagnostic Strand Analysis.

If you’d like, you can learn more about the IXL Continuous Diagnostic by viewing our QuickStart guide here.

The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is designed to tell you exactly what students know and what to do next to help them improve by revealing your students’ working grade levels.  It also helps you plan for small-group instruction by grouping students working at similar levels and displaying the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups.
 
To help your students get started, have them go to IXL.com to sign in and click Diagnostic. We recommend that students initially aim to answer 50-85 questions per subject to reveal complete Diagnostic data, which doesn’t have to be done in one sitting. Once complete data is revealed, students can answer 10-15 diagnostic questions per week to keep the IXL Continuous Diagnostic up to date.
 
You’ll know students have revealed completed Diagnostic data when their working grade levels narrow down to a single number, showing their level in each strand as well as their overall level. For example, a level of 500 indicates readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills.
 
To view your students’ Diagnostic data sign in, click Analytics and select Diagnostic. You will then be directed to the Diagnostic Overview where you can view and print your students’ detailed results.  To view your students grouped by common skill recommendations, click on any of the strands listed on the top menu to view the Diagnostic Strand Analysis. 
 
If you’d like, you can learn more about the IXL Continuous Diagnostic by viewing our QuickStart guide here.
version1Field:
The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is our latest feature and is designed to pinpoint your children’s working grade levels, providing you with insights on their ongoing growth and improvement in specific strands, as well as their level overall.  In addition, our unique Diagnostic will tell you exactly what to do next to help your children improve with individualized skill recommendations.
 
Your children can access the IXL Continuous Diagnostic by going to IXL.com to sign in to their profiles and clicking Diagnostic at the top of the page.  They will then be prompted to enter the Diagnostic arena and begin to answer questions.
 
We recommend that children initially aim to diagnose until they reveal complete Diagnostic data.  For most children this will be about 50-85 questions per subject that can be completed at their own pace and in multiple sessions if necessary.  The exact number of questions required will vary based on each child’s performance and existing practice results.  
 
Once your children have initially completed the Continuous Diagnostic by narrowing their working grade levels to single numbers in every strand, we recommend that they answer about 10-15 diagnostic questions per week to keep their Diagnostic data and individualized skill recommendations up to date.
 
When the Diagnostic is up-to-date, you can think of the working grade levels as indicators of your children’s current level of understanding, pinpointing what they are ready to learn next.  For example, a Diagnostic level of 500 would indicate readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills.
 
To track your children’s Diagnostic data, go to IXL.com, sign in to your parent profile, click Analytics at the top of the page and select Diagnostic from the menu that appears.  You will then be able to review the working grade levels in every strand and see the individualized skill recommendations that have been generated.  Having your children practice the skills recommended from the Diagnostic arena will target any learning gaps they may have in each strand and help them improve. 
 
To learn more about the IXL Continuous Diagnostic, click here to access our quick-start guide.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.  I'm always happy to help.

name: Seeing above/below grade recommend
body:
If your student is seeing recommended skills outside of their grade level, this means their recent practice or Diagnostic results have indicated there is a learning gap. To assist in closing the gap, IXL will show your student recommendations for foundational skills to practice.

Most students will receive recommendations for skills from multiple grade levels. Practice history, recently practiced skills, and Diagnostic levels will generate the best recommendations for students to work on in order to continue improving on the topics they’re learning. Students will also see recommendations for skills that will challenge them, these skills may be above their grade level but will match their area of understanding.

While students are always free to practice at any grade level, the recommendations for skills at a lower grade level are there to help your student strengthen their understanding of these skills before moving on.

While students are always free to practice at any grade level, the recommendations for skills at a lower grade level are there to help your student strengthen their understanding of these skills before moving on.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Individualizing w/ Recommendations
body:
IXL’s recommendations are based on the skills your students are currently working on and are individualized to each student. Your student’s recommendations are generated from their recently practiced skills, practice history, performance, and Diagnostic results. Having your students start with the Diagnostic will allow you to view your student’s learning gaps and recommendations to enrich their understanding of the skills.


For example, Work it out recommendations encourage students to practice skills determined to help them with any trouble spots. This and the other recommendations will allow your students to improve their knowledge of foundational skills to prepare them for the next skill they will be practicing.


IXL can also be used to support the RTI process when the IXL Continuous Diagnostic, Recommendations, and skill practice are used together. These tools are designed to target trouble spots and give students suggestions on what to practice for improvement.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!

name: What are recommendations?
body:
The IXL Recommendations can be used as a guide for students as they practice. If your students are just getting started they can begin by choosing a grade level and skill to practice. First, students will see Try something new recommendations encouraging them to practice new skills.

As your students practice, their recommendations will be generated according to what level they’re practicing at and how well they know the material. For example, if your students are stuck on a skill they will see Work it out recommendations. If your students are doing well, they will see Keep at it recommendations encouraging them to reach a SmartScore of 90.

If your students are using the Diagnostic, they will see From the Diagnostic arena recommended skills. These skills will be based on your students working grade level for each strand and are intended to help students narrow down their Diagnostic levels.
closing: If you have any other questions, please don’t hesitate to ask.

name: Showing growth in Diagnostic
body:
To monitor your students’ growth over time using the IXL Continuous Diagnostic, you can save or print their individual reports throughout the year. As students practice in the Diagnostic arena and practice on IXL, their overall levels will continuously change to show their progress.

You can save or print your students' individual reports by following these steps:

1) Go to https://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Click Diagnostic.
4) Selected the desired subject.
5) Click the paper icon next to Individual student levels & recommendations to print reports for your entire class.

These reports include the date, a student’s working grade level in each mathematical or language arts strand, and skill recommendations to continue growing. The changes in a student’s overall level or in the strands indicates a student’s progress over time.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be glad to assist.

To monitor your child’s growth over time using the IXl Continuous Diagnostic, you can save or print their individual diagnostic reports throughout the year. As your child practices in the Diagnostic arena and practice on IXL, their overall levels will continuously change since the Diagnostic is an ongoing assessment..


You can save or print your child’s individual reports by following these steps:

2) Click Analytics.

4) Selected the desired subject.

5) Scroll down to the bottom of the screen and click Diagnostic printout.


A full report will then be displayed showing your child’s current levels and recommended skills. The changes in your child’s overall level or in the strands indicates their progress.

name: Levels and growth
body:
After students have initially completed the IXL Continuous Diagnostic, their overall level will appear as a single number to indicate their working grade level. For example, a level of 500 represents readiness to begin working on fifth-grade level skills.

In order to keep the Diagnostic current, students should continue to practice 10-15 questions each week. As students continue to answer questions in the Diagnostic Arena and practice skills, their levels will change in the strands along with their overall score.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I am happy to help!

name: Standard notation - money
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I was able to sign in to your account and review the questions you answered for SKILLNAME. I see that the answers have been scored correctly.You are correct that 248.40 is the same number as 248.4. However, $248.4 is not counted as a correct answer because leaving out the second digit after the decimal is not standard notation when it is related to money. As long as you remember to use standard notation, your answers will be scored as correct.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Access chapter tests
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
body:
To access the chapter tests, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the Books tab.
4. Click the Book drop-down menu and select Textbook Activities, then click Go.
5. Click the Section drop-down menu and select the chapter exam you would like to assign, then click Go.

The exam(s) for the chapter you selected will appear below.

6. Check the box in the Use in Book column to assign the exam.
7. Click the set link in the Limit dates & times column to specify when this exam will appear in your students' accounts.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Auto-rostering Template
greeting: My name is Brooke, my role is to assist you in setting up your account, which includes help with rostering and unique username/password combinations.
body:
Hi (Customer),

My name is Brooke, my role is to assist you in setting up your account, which includes help with rostering and unique username/password combinations.


There are two ways you can upload your roster data to IXL.

The first way is to upload and edit roster files manually through the “Upload Roster” section of your IXL portal which will allow you to create teacher and student rosters. Choosing to upload the files yourself allows you to have full control of adding or removing teachers and students at your discretion. If you have any trouble please click the “Work With An Account Specialist” button to transfer the file to me securely and I will be happy to assist you.

The following is a link to our manual rostering specifications, which details the format the files need your data to be in:

https://www.ixl.com/userguides/IXLQuickStart_UploadRoster.pdf

The second way to upload roster data is through IXL’s Auto-Rostering feature. This feature allows you to sync data from your school or district SIS into your IXL account through an SFTP connection. This effectively allows you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS. Once the Auto-Roster feature is enabled, you will no longer be able to manage students and teachers manually through the IXL website. All changes are provided through your school or district SIS file transfer, which will be uploaded nightly through our Auto-Roster sync.

The following is a link to our Auto-Rostering Technical Specifications, which details the format we need your data to be in:

https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf

Alternatively, IXL supports the OneRoster v1.1 CSV standard. We only use a subset of the data, but we accept the standard set of files as described in the OneRoster specification, with no special additions or modifications needed.

Please note that we do not integrate with Clever for SSO or student rostering, so we are unable to accept files directly from Clever.

Please let me know which method is right for your account and I will be happy to provide more information.


Sincerely,

Account Services Rep
closing: Please let me know which method is right for your account and I will be happy to provide more information.

name: Change username
body:
I am happy to help you change the username for your IXL family membership. Remember, this username will be used by all users on the membership and must be unique throughout all of IXL.

Please provide me with your current username, as well as three different new username options, in order of preference.

I am also happy to assist you by phone. I am available at 855-255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Eastern Time, and please feel free to ask for me by name.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Site to Site Merge Confirmation
body:
I have successfully merged the ORIGINAL ACCOUNT school subscription into the NEW ACCOUNT subscription. All student accounts should be available there immediately.

Your new admin account has been created on the NEW ACCOUNT subscription as well. Please check your e-mail for your account confirmation.

Please ensure that you as well as all of your students and teachers utilize the NEW ACCOUNT custom sign-in page to sign in from now on. They can find it here: XXXX
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Site to Site Merge Initial
greeting: I hope this e-mail finds you well.
body:
I am reaching out to confirm the merge the ORIGINAL ACCOUNT school account into the NEW ACCOUNT account. All student accounts will be consolidated onto the new account.

Please let me know if there is a time that is best for this process to take place that will not interfere with student practice.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: New School Year Set-up
body:
Thank you for providing your roster.

Your school is all set for the upcoming school year. Students accounts have been created and should be available for practice immediately.

Any new teachers have been sent confirmation e-mails.

If you have any changes to your enrollment following this update to your master roster, please feel free to refer to the following guides to add or remove any students.
  • Administrator Quick-start Guide
  • Upload Roster Quick-start Guide
Please let me know if you have any questions or encounter any issues. Good luck in the new school year!
closing: none

greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us. I am happy to help!
body:
I see that your membership with the username USERNAME is canceled and expired on DATE.

It looks like that there was another membership is your family's name with the UN/EMAIL that had not been canceled.

I have canceled UN for you, and you will not receive any further charges. I have also refunded the AMOUNT charge, which will take about 5-7 business days to appear on your credit card statement.

greeting: I hope you are excited for back-to-school!
body:
My name is Erin and I recently started as your Strategic Account Manager. I will be working alongside ACCOUNTMANAGER to ensure successful IXL implementation. I am so excited to learn more about DISTRICT initiatives for this coming school year!

As the world of education is forever evolving so is IXL! We have some exciting enhancements coming to IXL for back-to-school 2018! I would love the opportunity to set up a time to speak with you, explore these new components, and discuss professional development for your teachers. Do you happen to have a free day/time next week? I promise to not take more than 20 minutes of your time!
closing: I look forward to partnering with COUNTY this year!

name: New Tool
body:
I want to draw your attention to our new tool in your administrator account that will allow you to upload teacher and student rosters directly and securely to your subscription.
To use this tool, simply log in to your administrator account, go to “Account Management”, then “Upload Roster”. Then follow the instructions on that page to format your files and upload your roster. name: Auto-Rostering Kickoff 3
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
IXL's Auto-Rostering feature allows you to sync data from your SIS into your IXL account, effectively allowing you to manage your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your SIS.

If you would like to move forward with the Auto-Rostering feature, please let me know and I will enable this for the account.

Before enabling Auto-Rostering, there are a few things I need to know from you:
  1. Who will be the main technical point of contact for Auto-Rostering? This person should:
    • Be able to manage user data in your SIS
    • Be able to manage an SFTP connection and data export
  2. The SIS you are using
  3. Your preferred SFTP username (optional)
    • This will be the username used for your SFTP connection
    • If you do not have a preference, IXL will randomly generate a four digit code to act as your SFTP username
  4. The data format you will use for your exports into IXL. This can be one of two formats:
    • The data format developed specifically for IXL, which can be found documented here: https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/IXL-Auto-Rostering-Specifications.pdf
    • IXL also supports the OneRoster v1.1 data format, which is documented here: https://www.imsglobal.org/oneroster-v11-final-csv-tables
  5. How to handle users already on your IXL account. These options will help your IXL account more closely match the data from your SIS, and will clean up previous years' teacher rosters.
    • Would you like us to remove any students not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to remove any teachers not uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
    • Would you like us to archive any teacher rosters for any teachers uploaded via Auto-Rostering?
  6. Your first day of school
Once I know your main point of contact, as well as your preferences from the above questions, I can enable the Auto-Rostering feature for your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: How to reactivate students - Admin
body:
Due to our compliance with updated student data privacy laws, we cannot accept student reactivation requests through e-mail. To reactivate student accounts, please list the following student information in an Excel spreadsheet: First Name, Last Name, Student ID, and Grade Level. Then sign in to your IXL administrator account and use the “Upload Roster” tool found under the “Account Management” tab.

To use this tool, simply log in to your administrator account, go to “Account Management”, then “Upload Roster”. Then follow the instructions on that page to format your files and upload your roster. If you have any trouble please click the “Work With An Account Specialist” button to transfer the file to me securely and I will be happy to assist you.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions!

name: Special needs quote - smaller class
greeting: I am glad to hear that you are interested in starting an IXL membership!
body:
Since you are working with a smaller caseload of students, a family membership would be the most cost-effective option.

You and each of your students can access unlimited practice and comprehensive reporting tools with one IXL family membership. With an IXL membership, you will have access to all grade levels, so your students will be able to practice in whatever grade level best suits their own learning needs. They will also have the option to go back and review previously studied material, or move ahead to try new skills at any time.

The package you are interested in, which includes SUBJECTS for NUMBER students, is PRICE per month or PRICE per year.

To view our membership options or register, visit our Membership page.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!

Thank you for your interest in IXL’s Auto-Rostering feature. This feature will allow you to sync teacher and student roster data from your student information system (SIS) to your IXL account. The IXL Auto-Roster feature will assist you in managing your IXL students, teachers, and classes centrally from your student information system (SIS).

Your subscription is currently set up for licenses as follows:

To ensure the smoothest integration set-up process, we recommend sending SIS records to match your purchased licenses as closely as possible.

Should you wish to proceed with the IXL Auto-Rostering feature, please fill out the questions in this short questionnaire to begin the process.

In preparation for collecting the information that IXL will be requesting from you, please refer to the IXL Auto-Rostering Timeline documentation.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

name: Sugarcane
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Unfortunately, Sugarcane is no longer available, which is why you cannot open your activities. Sugarcane was an experimental project created by a few engineers at IXL Learning to explore fun, fresh ways to make learning more effective. However, Sugarcane wasn't able to attract enough of an audience to be sustainable over the long term, so we made the difficult decision to discontinue the project.

While there is not a way to export the games themselves, I'm happy to help provide you with the data you've uploaded to create them. If you would like your Sugarcane data exported, please let me know and I'll be happy to help.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.

name: FTP Enabled
body:
I have enabled the Auto-Roster integration for your account. This will trigger an e-mail to you from our system with the SFTP connection information.

Please let me know when you have uploaded your first set of files, and I will audit them along with a member of our development team. I will communicate to you any issues with the data that will prevent a successful first sync.

Once the data has been audited, our development team will perform the first sync in accordance with the preferences you have sent me.

After that, our nightly sync service will process your uploaded files nightly at midnight, eastern time. Any files received before that time will be applied to your account.

Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

name: Grade levels hidden (shared)
body:
It sounds like another teacher is monitoring your student's progress, and that teacher has hidden the grade levels from his or her own account. This is why they are showing up as letters when your student signs in instead of the usual grade levels.

When the grade levels are hidden pre-K becomes "Level A", kindergarten becomes "Level B", etc. For your convenience, I am including the directions on how to hide/unhide grade levels, in case you need to refer to them. However, as long as your student is on the roster of a teacher who has hidden grade levels, you will not be able to unhide them.

To hide/unhide grade levels, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) In the upper right-hand corner of the page, click the arrow next to your name to open the account menu.
3) From the account menu drop-down, select Profile & settings.
4) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Settings section and select the Hide grade levels check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.
5) Click Submit.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: speed /accuracy old report
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can find details about your students' rankings for time spent and questions answered from the "Students Quickview" report. To view it, sign in to your account and click Analyticsat the top of the page. Then click Students to open that report.
This report will list practice details for all of your students. Click the "Sort" by drop-down menu to rank students in order from greatest to least.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: Lock passwords
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Although there isn't a way to lock a student's password, you are able to update the password to whatever you like. Changing this student's password to something more memorable will help ensure they are able to sign in and complete their assignments. To update a student password, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.
3) Click on the student password you need to change.
4) Type in the desired password.
5) Cilck Save.

After clicking Save, the student's password will update on your class roster. They will be able to sign in and practice using their current username and new password immediately.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: Resolved issue
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: It looks like you have resolved your issue. I see that you have successfully entered your course code and purchased your eBook. You can click the cover of your book to begin viewing and submitting assignments.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: Turn off certificates
body:
Since our e-mails are automatically sent, there isn't a way for us to control what time the e-mails are sent. If the e-mails are being sent at an inconvenient time, you can temporarily turn off these e-mails and view the certificates in your account. To turn off the e-mails we send, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that opens.
4) Clear the Receive weekly summary e-mails checkbox.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

If you would like, you can access certificates your children have earned by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Learning.
3) Click Awards.
4) Click Certificates center.
5) Select the child’s name from the drop-down menu.
6) Click View certificate to see the desired certificate.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be glad to help.

name: Certificate name
body:
Certificates are generated automatically and the " 's" is added at the end of all names. If you would like, you can create customizable certificates by going to the following link:

https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/printable-resources

You can right click any certificate to download it to your computer. When you open it, you can type in the information and print it out.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!

body:
While we host your online book and course, your Cengage Unlimited purchase was made directly from the publisher, Cengage.

From your Cengage Unlimited account (*not* your account on hlc.quia.com), please follow these steps to access your book key:

1) After purchasing Unlimited, search on the product title or ISBN
2) In the results, add the iLrn product to Home (there can be several products, eBooks ,etc associated with a title--pick the iLrn one)
3) Close the green box
4) A blue "Open" button will appear--click on it!
5) You will go to the register/access page with instructions on how to register on the iLrn site. You will need to copy the book key generated on this page
6) Click on "Register"
7) You will go to the cengage.com/ilrn page--this is the page to bookmark as we will post updates on the ilrn conversion and other resources here.
8) Click on "Sign in"
9) You will go to hlc.quia.com where you either log into your existing student account or create a new one
10) Paste the book key you copied into the "Book Key" field in the upper right of the student workstation
11) Your iLrn book will appear (if you have multiple iLrn books you might have to scroll)
12) Enter the course code you got from your instructor. You're done!

There is also a video here that illustrates the steps you will need to follow:

https://cengageo365-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/g/personal/sean_ketchem_cengage_com/EVT6iUsU_9FMhFVQLfnj-KMBy23h-hfcf_KjJOItfjkImA?e=N7QZoo

If you have any questions about this process, please reach out to Cengage at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 to recover your book key. Once you provide them with the order number from your purchase, they will be able to track it down and provide you with the book key you purchased.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Key doesn't work please send

body:
It looks like you've already linked your book with your course in your account. I was able to open the book from your account and access the assignments. Please go to http://www.alkitaabtextbook.com and log in to your account, then click on the image of your book to open a new window and access the book.

If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!
name: Disable Pop-up Blocker

body:
There is an issue with Flash player that can occur on some Macs which can prevent you from being able to update your Flash settings. Without updated Flash settings, you will not be able to make recordings on our site. To work around this issue and update your settings, please follow these steps:

1) Click on the Apple icon in the upper left corner of your screen.
2) Click on "System Preferences".
3) In the "Other" section, click on "Flash Player".
4) Click on "Camera and Mic", and then click "Camera and Microphone Settings by Site".
5) In the new window that opens, click on the "+" sign in the lower left corner.
6) Enter "quia.com" (without quotes) as the website domain.
7) Select "Allow" from the drop-down box, then click the "Add" button.

This will allow our site to use your microphone during your recording exercises. You should now be able to complete your assignments.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

If your book was sold with a book key, it is usually packaged with your book in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. Al-Kitaab book keys are 19-character codes that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include companion website access, you can purchase your book access online. body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
name: Microphone Check Chrome

I understand you have a question about accepting late assignments. You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps:

1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up.
2) Go to http://www.alkitaabtextbook.com and log in.
3) Click on the title of your course.
4) Click the "Classes" tab.
5) Navigate to the appropriate section using the "Book" and "Section" drop-down lists.
6) Click the "late" link that Al-Kitaab displays in place of the score for that exercise.
7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student.

Al-Kitaab will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!

body:
To change the exercises that are assigned in your course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.alkitaabtextbook.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.

Please note that the exercises listed here with a red dot contain questions that will require you to grade them before students' scores are final. Exercises listed here with a green dot will be graded automatically.

If you wish to set a due date for an exercise, click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears. To assign the same due date to several exercises at once, please follow these steps:

7. Check the box to the left of each exercise that shares a due date.
8. Open the "Other actions..." menu at the top of the list of exercises and choose "Set due date."
9. Select a due date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for all of the exercises you selected.

We have a helpful info sheet for assigning activities with screen shots of each of the steps in this process. I recommend taking a look at it for more information:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/Georgetown/assigningActivities_Georgetown.pdf

These instructions contain everything your students will need to enroll in your course, including your course code.

body:
You can set the grading and feedback options for your course so that your students will see the correct answers for any questions they missed, but only after they have used up all of their available attempts for that exercise. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.alkitaabtextbook.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course (e.g. "Arabic 101").
3) Click on the "Books" tab.
4) Beneath the "Books" tab, click "Options".
5) Select the book from the drop-down menu next to the "Preview" button and click "Go." (Select "All books" if you wish to apply changes to all of your books at once.)
6) In the "Feedback" section, click on "Score and summary" and confirm your choice when prompted.

Now the feedback will be set to not show answers by default. The next step is to show students the answers once they have used up all of their attempts:

7) Click on the "Options" tab in the top row (in the same row as "Dashboard", "Classes", and "Books").
8) Click on the "Grading options" button.
9) In the "Multiple attempts" section, check the box next to "Ignore student results after the ___ attempt."
10) In the same line, select the number of attempts you would like your students to have for each exercise.
11) On the next line, check the box next to "Always show feedback as "score, summary, and answers" after students' final attempt."
12) Click the "Save changes" button.

Your students will now see their total score and which questions were correct or incorrect after each attempt, but they will not see the correct answers until after they have submitted their final attempt.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Set Grading and Feedback Options

3. Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4. Click "Enter a course code".
5. Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6. If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

Once you have entered your course code you can purchase a book key by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. From here, you can purchase a book key (and not a physical book) that Al-Kitaab will instantly add to your account. When you make your purchase, you will not see an actual book key; instead Al-Kitaab will enter it into your account automatically.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

Can't add students SSO
