name: Old reports
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Since we no longer support these reports, these reports may not accurately reflect your students' practice.

While we no longer have any high-level reports which list the number of correct answers specifically, this is in part because the SmartScore will actually provide you with a more accurate assessment of your students' current performance. Our SmartScore not only considers whether a student got a question right or wrong, but how difficult the question was and how they've been performing on other questions before and after. For example, two students might each have answered 20 of 25 questions correctly, but might actually have quite different levels of understanding (and different SmartScores). If the one student answered the first 5 questions incorrectly, then understood their mistake and answered the next 20 questions correctly it would indicate that they're now doing quite well, even though they struggled initially, and that student would have a high SmartScore. If another student answered the first 20 questions correctly, but then got to a higher degree of difficulty and answered the next 5 questions incorrectly it would mean that they had hit a plateau and would likely benefit from some intervention. Such a student's SmartScore would be lower than the first student's, to reflect that they were struggling with the more difficult questions.

One report I would particularly recommend to how your class is doing on a particular skill is the "Skill Diagnostics" report. To view this report, click on the "Analytics" tab, then click "Skills" and select the skill you're interested in from the list, or find it using the drop-down list on the right side above the list of skills. This report will both provide you with overall let you see how each student is performing, broken down into the various stages of the skill. You can hover your mouse over a student's name to see the number of questions and time spent on that skill, or click on their name to see a log of all the questions they answered and how they performed over time.

Alternatively, for an even higher-level view that lets you see all your students results across all skills at once you can click "Scores" under the "Analytics" tab to access the Score Grid. The Score Grid will allow you to see each student's score in every skill, all at once. It can even be exported as a spreadsheet by clicking the icon next to the title of the report, in case that would help with your grading.

Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to assist.

name: How do I access CU book key?
body:
Please follow these step to find your Cengage book key:

1) After purchasing Unlimited, search on the product title or ISBN
2) In the results, add the iLrn product to Home (there can be several products, eBooks, etc associated with a title--pick the iLrn one)
3) Close the green box
4) A blue "Open" button will appear--click on it!
5) You will go to the register/access page with instructions on how to register on the iLrn site. You will need to copy the book key generated on this page
6) Click on "Register"
7) You will go to the cengage.com/ilrn page--this is the page to bookmark as we will post updates on the ilrn conversion and other resources here.
8) Click on "Sign in"
9) You will go to hlc.quia.com where you either log into your existing student account or create a new one
10) Paste the book key you copied into the "Book Key" field in the upper right of the student workstation
11) Your iLrn course will appear (if you have multiple iLrn courses you might have to scroll)
12) Enter the access code you got from your instructor. You're done!
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: How many questions to mastery
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Since IXL adapts to each student, there isn't a set number of questions for each skill. However, for most skills, students need to complete a minimum of 28 questions to reach a SmartScore of 100.

Instead of attempting to master a skill in one sitting, we recommend having students practice a certain number of questions or a certain amount of time each day. They'll be able to pick up later right where they left off, and you can monitor all of their progress by signing in to your account and clicking Analytics at the top of the page.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Diagnostic goals
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
The Continuous Diagnostic doesn't set or imply any specific expected goal for a student. That is up to each teacher to decide based on a student’s unique circumstances or learning goals.

The IXL Diagnostic is designed to give you a snapshot of each of your students’ working grade levels. For example, a level of 100 indicates readiness to work on first-grade level skills. It also groups students working at similar levels and can show the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups, allowing you to plan for small-group instruction. It tells you exactly what students know and what to do next to to help them improve.

All student levels start as a range while the Diagnostic continues to narrow down that data. When the Diagnostic has enough information to pinpoint the student's level, it will appear as a single number. If you’d like, you can learn more about the IXL Continuous Diagnostic by viewing our QuickStart guide here.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Skill Score Chart
body:
Our new Skill Score Chart includes the total number of correct answers and the total number of questions answered in a skill. You can access the Skill Score Chart by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your teacher account.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Hover over Scores.
4) Select Skill Score Chart from the Skills drop-down menu.
5) Select the desired class, date range, and skill from the drop-down menus.

You can then hover over the number of questions answered to see the number of correct and incorrect answers for that skill. You can also export the report to see all of the data in a spreadsheet by clicking on the icon to the right of the report title.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Admin reactivate account
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
When students are removed from your roster, they become inactive. However, if they return to your school, you can contact us to restore their accounts so that they'll be able to pick up where they left off. That way, you won't have to create a brand new account or username for them.

Alternatively, you can use the new Upload roster tool to reactivate students. If you upload a spreadsheet with a returning student's information and choose the "Add these students/teachers to my roster" option, IXL will automatically restore their inactive account. Please keep in mind that the Student ID on the spreadsheet you upload must match the Student ID of the inactive student in order for them to be reactivated.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Multiplication.com - Set Equations
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us!
body:
You can set specific equations for students using the following steps:
  1. Log in to your teacher account athttps://www.multiplication.com/user/login
  2. Click Settings to reveal the drop-down menu
  3. Click Set Equations
From this page you will be able to set equations for specific students for 24 hours. They will only see these equations when they practice for that amount of time.
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

name: Upload roster
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I have uploaded the students as requested. In order to upload the file successfully, the columns had to be rearranged in this format:

Last Name
First Name
Student ID
E-mail
Password

As long as your file is in this format, you can upload students, too:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Admin Tools in the left menu.
3. Click Student List near the upper right-hand corner of the page.
4. Click Import a list....
5. Click Choose File and select your file.
6. Click Import.

Quia will then ask you to confirm that you want to upload the students.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Convert Activity to Quiz
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
While there isn't a way to change an activity directly into a quiz, you can import questions from certain activity types into your Question Bank. You can then use these imported questions to build a new quiz.

To import activity questions into your Question Bank, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Go to the Question Bank page by clicking the link in the left menu.
3. Click Import questions.
4. Beneath the heading Import Questions from Activities, select the checkboxes next to the activities with questions you'd like to import.
5. Click Import at the bottom of the page.

Quia will add the questions to your "Question Bank", and you will be able to insert them into your quizzes.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Add Student Steps
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can add students that are already with your school to your roster through the "Roster" page. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click on Welcome at the top right corner.
3) Click on Roster in the drop-down menu.
4) Click the Add students button at the bottom of the chart.
5) Start filling in your student's information and click their name in the yellow box that appears.

Once you click on your student listed in the yellow box, they will be added to your roster, and you'll be able to view all of their progress in your Analytics.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.

name: Looking at wrong workstation
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
It sounds as if you are viewing the instructor workstation instead of the student workstation. If you view the student workstation, you will not be asked to enter another book key. You will also be able to see your courses and work on your assignments.

You can view your student workstation by logging in to your account and clicking the "Student workstation" link in the upper-right corner of the page. You should then have no further issues.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions and I will be happy to help.

name: Wrong Book (HLC)
body:
Taking a look, I see the book key you provided is for access to "BOOK." However, it appears that your course requires access to "BOOK" instead. To complete your enrollment and submit exercises for this class, you will need this book.

To gain access to your book, I recommend reaching out to the publisher of your book, Cengage. They can be reached at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706. Once you provide them with the order number from your purchase, they will be able track it down and provide you with the correct book key.
closing: Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.

name: Pause Diagnostic Breaks
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can pause diagnostic breaks for one hour at a time through the "Parent" profile on your account. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click on Welcome at the top right corner.
3) Click on Profile & settings in the drop-down menu.
4) Scroll down to the bottom of the pop-up and clickPause for 1 hour next to "Pause diagnostic breaks".
5) ClickSubmit to save your changes.

Once you click "Submit", your children will not be interrupted with the diagnostic for one hour.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.
versions: Unfortunately, there is not a way for students to pause the integrated diagnostic at this time. However, I recommend contacting your teacher about pausing the diagnostic for you. Your teacher will be able to pause the diagnostic through their "Profile and settings" menu.

name: Assigning to specific students
body: While there's not a way to assign skills to individual students at this time, you can direct students to the appropriate skill by sharing its link with them (e.g., EXAMPLEURL). We are also exploring more ways for teachers to highlight skills in the future.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Integrated Diagnostic
greeting: Thank you for reaching out about the new integrated diagnostic.
body:
First, I want to make sure you know how to pause the diagnostic breaks for all of your students, any time you’d like. After signing in toIXL.com, open the "Welcome" menu in the upper-right, and click Profile & settings. Scroll to the bottom to find the row marked Pause diagnostic breaks. Click the link, and your students will forgo diagnostic breaks for the next hour! This can be especially helpful if you’re doing targeted review or working in a small group setting.

I also want to let you know that the new integrated diagnostic means that you'll have a lot of valuable information about your students--much more than ever before. If you haven’t used the diagnostic reports yet, go to www.ixl.com/diagnostic/overview to see each student’s overall levels. From there, you can dive into an individual strand, or see a detailed action plan for any individual student!

While we are excited about the potential to provide you with automatically updated diagnostic information for every student, we are also paying close attention to how this feature is being received, and I am sharing all feedback with our product team.
closing: Please do let me know if you have any additional feedback to share!
versions: After hearing from a number of teachers, we have decided to suspend the integrated diagnostic changes until we can offer more options to support the many different ways that teachers use IXL, including the option to turn diagnostic breaks on or off permanently. We plan to make these available in the next week or so. In the meantime, the Diagnostic is still available for your students from www.ixl.com/diagnostic/arena, and any diagnostic data they may have (including from Diagnostic breaks over the last couple days) is preserved for you. If you haven’t tried the diagnostic reports yet, go to www.ixl.com/diagnostic/overview to see each student’s overall levels. From there, you can dive into an individual strand, or see a detailed action plan for any individual student!

We are glad to hear (you found it valuable / you and your students were able to try it out / your students enjoyed it / you’d like to learn more about it). We heard from a number of other teachers who weren’t ready to have the diagnostic integrated with their IXL implementation.


To better support all teachers and the many different ways they use IXL, we have decided to temporarily suspend the integrated diagnostic changes until we can offer more options to support different implementations of IXL.


In the meantime, the Diagnostic is still available for your students from www.ixl.com/diagnostic/arena, and any diagnostic data they may have (including from Diagnostic breaks over the last couple days) is preserved for you. If you haven’t tried the diagnostic reports yet, go to www.ixl.com/diagnostic/overview to see each student’s overall levels. From there, you can dive into an individual strand, or see a detailed action plan for any individual student!


While we are excited about the potential to provide you with automatically updated diagnostic information for every student, we want to make sure we’re able to offer the control and flexibility to support all teachers.

greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us about this new feature.
name: Integrated Diagnostic
Submit assignments as student
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can view the assignments by date by enabling the "Submit activities as student" option in your teacher account. You can enable this option by following these steps:

1) Log in to https://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course.
3) Click the "Classes" tab.
4) Click the "Submit activities as student" link in the "How Do I Grade?" box on the right side of the page.

You will then see a list of your assignments by date. The next time you log in, you can view the assignments by clicking on the name of your book.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions and I will be happy to help.

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

We have reintroduced the integrated diagnostic experience after making some changes to reduce the frequency of the diagnostic breaks, and to give customers more control over them:

Children will receive breaks less frequently, every 15-20 questions. A new animation and text on the screen will also help learners better understand the purpose of the break. If needed, children can now skip the break by clicking a button at the top right of the screen.

Parents can use their Profile and settings to customize the integrated diagnostic experience. Your can pause the diagnostic breaks for 1 hour, pause for 1 day, or turn them off completely.
closing: We hope these changes will allow you to use IXL and the Continuous Diagnostic in a way that works best for you and your children. Please do let me know if you have any additional comments or questions!
name: Integrated Diagnostic (on)
Pause diagnostic breaks
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can pause the diagnostic breaks for your students by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that appears.
4) Next to "Pause diagnostic breaks", click Pause for 1 hour.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

body:
We have suspended the integrated diagnostic until we can offer a more complete set of options for turning it off and on and controlling how often it appears.

In the meantime, the Diagnostic is still available for your children from www.ixl.com/diagnostic/arena, and any diagnostic data they may have (including from Diagnostic breaks over the last couple days) is preserved for you. If you haven’t tried the diagnostic reports yet, go to www.ixl.com/diagnostic/overview to see each child's overall levels.
closing: Please do let me know if you have any additional comments or questions. I will be happy to help!
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us about this issue.
name: Integrated Diagnostic (off)
No eBook, manual only
greeting: Thank you for reaching  out to us.
body: The online book being used in your course includes the activity manual only, and does not have a textbook available on our site. You do have access to all of the online activities which will be assigned for your course.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

If you bought a new package from your bookstore and received this book key, you may have been given the wrong book key. I recommend that you reach out to your bookstore regarding the correct book for this course.

name: Teacher - change username (site)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I recommend contacting ADMIN NAME, your school's IXL administrator, to change students' usernames. Administrators can update usernames from their accounts in the same way you can update passwords from your own account, by clicking on a username from the master roster and making changes.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: iTunes accounts - e-mail info
body:
Thank you for reaching out to us.

It looks like you currently have a membership that was purchased through the App Store.

If you purchase your membership through IXL.com, you will have unlimited access to IXL through your iPad as well as on any other device (computer, laptop, tablet) with an Internet connection. Plus, our memberships offer you the most flexibility - you will have the option to select the number of children and the subjects you wish to have on your account, and you can also choose between monthly and yearly options.

When you are ready to create a membership directly through IXL, please first cancel your membership through the App Store. To cancel your membership you can reference these cancellation instructions from Apple. In addition, memberships purchased through the App Store are billed through iTunes, so refund requests must be submitted directly to Apple Support. To contact the iTunes team regarding a refund for your App Store purchase, you can submit their Report a Problem form.

For more information or to purchase a family membership through our website, please visit our Membership page.
closing: If you have any other questions, please let me know! You may also call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET.

name: iTunes ISSUES with finding acct
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
After looking into this issue further, I was unable to locate your membership with your name or e-mail address (EMAIL). It sounds like Apple may be experiencing technical issues, so I have reported this to our engineers for further investigation.

In the meantime, I will be happy to help you get started on IXL with a complimentary month of access. You will first need to cancel your App Store purchase so you are not charged for an account that you cannot access. To cancel your App Store membership, you can review these cancellation instructions from Apple.

In addition, memberships purchased through the App Store are billed through iTunes, so refund requests must be submitted directly to iTunes support. To contact the iTunes team regarding a refund for your App Store purchase, you can submit their Report a Problem form.

Once you have canceled this account, I will set you up with a membership through IXL.com with a complimentary month.

Please let me know the following information so I can provide further instructions:
  • Subscription plan (monthly or yearly)
  • Number of children
  • Subjects you want to purchase (ex: math, language arts)
  • Country edition (ex: US, UK, Canada, etc)
  • Preferred username
closing: I look forward to hearing from you.

greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.

While we have an app available for tablets, IXL is not fully supported on phones, which is why you cannot download it. I recommend your student use a desktop or laptop computer to practice IXL as we continue to work toward supporting phones in the future.

If you could let me know more about your phone, such as it's operating system, make, and model, and the browser you're using to access IXL, I'll be able to make sure our engineers see it as we continue to move towards being fully supported on phones.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.

name: Assign skills to one student
body:
While there is not a way to assign skills to a small group or a specific student, there are alternatives that will help your students find assigned skills. You can assign skills to all your students by highlighting them from our practice pages.

You also have the option of letting specific students know which skills they should practice by referencing the skill code or by copying the skill url and sending it to the student's e-mail.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!

We are also exploring more ways for teachers to highlight skills in the future.

name: School Time
body:
School time is considered Monday through Friday, 7 am - 3 pm, regardless of when your individual school starts or ends its day, or where the student is practicing IXL. There is no way to change this, but you can use the "Student Details" report to see the date and time students practiced.

Please follow these step to view the Student details report:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Analytics.
3)Hover your cursor over Students and then click Student Details.
4) Click on a student's name to view detailed information about their practice.

You will be able to scroll down to see the starting and ending time of the student's most recent practice session. Navigate to each student using the menu at the top of the report to view their most recent practice sessions.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!

name: How many questions per skill
body: IXL is a self-paced practice environment designed to fit the needs and learning styles of students at all levels. Our flexible, web-based curriculum allows every child to have a customized experience. The amount of questions vary based on each student's performance. There is no specific number of problems under each topic.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!

closing: I look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: developers tools -family
body:
As long as NAME is signed in to his account, all of HIS/HER work will be saved to your reports.
I see in NAME's "Score chart" report that SHE/HE practiced ……... SHE/HE reached a SmartScore of…..

You can view the Score chart report that shows NAME's proficiency, too:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to the parent profile.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Click Scores.
4) Select a child, subject, skill grade, and date range from the drop-down menus near the top.

A list of skills NAME has practiced will be displayed along with HIS/HER current SmartScores, time spent, and number of questions answered for each skill.

If you saw scores of 90 or higher for all of those skills on the 6th grade math page, it means that the page itself had been altered to show those scores. When students visit any page on the internet, the page is saved and displayed by their browser. All browsers have tools that allow you to change the HTML on that page, allowing students to change how the SmartScore appears in IXL, the headlines at cnn.com, or anything else they want to modify online. The changes students make aren't saved to our servers, so there is no way for students to manipulate their true scores or the data in their reports. The changes they made affect their browsers only and disappear as soon as they navigate to another page. Refreshing the page (Ctrl+R) will make the text go back to normal and will display the accurate scores and information again.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: Installing Firefox/enabling Flash
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
If you are having trouble hearing the audio from your assignments, then your current browser is not streaming the audio properly. To fix this problem, please try the following steps:

1) Install a new browser. Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer.

2) After installing Firefox, you'll next need to install Adobe Flash. While using Firefox, download Adobe Flash at the following link:

https://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/

3) Activate the Adobe Flash software (plug-in) within the Firefox browser. Follow this steps to do so:

1. Open the Firefox browser.
2. Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines).
3. Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4. If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5. On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6. Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate".
7. Close the browser to save the changes.

After following these steps, you'll have no further problems with the audio from your assignments.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions!  If you need any assistance with following these steps, please give us a call at 877.282.4400 extension 2.

name: Teacher requesting list of skills
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I suggest exporting the "Score Grid" report for a list of skills in a particular grade level. You can export the "Score Grid" by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2. Click Analytics.
3. Click Scores.
4. Select the desired grade level from the drop-down menu near the top.
5. Next to the title "Score Grid", click the spreadsheet icon.
6. Click Export.

You can then open the downloaded CSV file. If you remove your students' names and scores from the spreadsheet, you'll have a list of all the skills in that grade level.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Translate IXL
body: While IXL is only available in English at this time, you may be able to use a translation extension to translate the content on IXL into Spanish. While we don't officially support third-party extensions, some teachers have had success with Google Translate and other free translation extensions.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!

name: Assign Students To Multiple Teacher
body:
Students can be added to as many teachers as they need to be either through the admin account via roster upload or by the teachers themselves in their teacher rosters.

You can simply click the “Upload roster” link found under the Account Management tab to access a secure upload page for all of your student and teacher information. Just upload the file being sure that the following information is provided in separate columns:
  • First name
  • Last name
  • Student ID number
  • Grade level
  • School (if applicable)
  • Teacher e-mail/username*
To assign a student to multiple teachers, please include one student row for each teacher, or list teachers in one cell and separate each teacher with a semicolon (example: "teacher1@ixl.com; teacher2@ixl.com").

The second option is to have your teachers create their own rosters manually and add the students. They can use our Teacher Quick-start Guide to help them with the process.
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions or problems with this process and I will be happy to answer them.

name: App for Android
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
While the IXL app is not yet supported on Android phones, we are actively working on making our site more mobile friendly and adapting our tablet apps for use on phones. In the meantime, we have developed apps for the following supported devices:

iPads/iPhones: Available on iOS 9.0 or later
Android devices: Available on devices with 7-inch screens or larger, with Android OS 4.4.2 or later
Kindle Fire: Available on devices with 7-inch screens or larger, with Fire OS 4.1 or later
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Doesn't remember old password iPad
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
If you don't remember the old password, you can add your e-mail address to your child's account. This will allow you to receive an automated password reset link from IXL that doesn't require you to know the old password.

To add your e-mail to your child's account, please follow these steps:

1. Open the IXL iPad app.
2. Tap your child's name in the upper left-hand corner.
3. Tap Settings.
4. Enter your e-mail address in the space provided and tap Done.

You can then use your iPad's web browser to go to our Help Center and reset your password.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Awards on the iPhone app
body:
While awards aren't available through the iPhone app at this time, they are available from our site and are accessible on any web browser.

To access all of your child's awards, sign in to your account using a web browser at IXL.com, choose Learning, then tap Awards near the top of the page. You will then be able to use the menus at the top of the page to select a subject or grade level and view all of your child's awards.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Account activation - PR
body:
I have activated your IXL membership with a complimentary month.

Your month will expire on DATE. If you would like to continue using IXL after that date, the monthly price will be PRICE. To continue, you may sign in to the parent profile and click here: https://www.ixl.com/membership/family/renew.

Your account information is as follows:

Username: username
Use the following link to create your password: LINK

1. Sign in to your account
  • Go to the IXL Sign in page.
  • Enter your username and password, then click Sign in.
  • Choose Parent.
2. Set up your family profile
  • Click on Welcome, Parent!at the top of the page.
  • Select Profiles & settings from the drop-down menu, scroll down and enter each name and choose a picture.
  • Click Submit.
3. Start practicing
  • Click Welcome, Parent! near the top-right corner of the page.
  • Click your child's icon to switch to their profile.
  • Have your child start practicing!
Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Copying a quiz w/o sharing question
body:
It sounds like you are trying to a copy a quiz from within the Basic quiz manager. If you'd like to copy a quiz without modifying shared questions, you can do so from the Advanced quiz manager, instead:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Near the top of the page, click Advanced.
4. Next to the quiz you'd like to copy, click the Copy icon ().
5. Select Copy quiz and copy questions.

You will then be able to make changes to the questions in your copy without changing the original questions.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: HSBC want to add a child (HSBC)
greeting: I am happy to hear that you would like to add a child to your membership!
body:
I see that you purchased your IXL membership through the Homeschool Buyer's Co-op (HSBC). In order to take advantage of HSBC's discount, I recommend upgrading from their website at a cost of $30.00.

To add a child through the HSBC, please use the following steps:
  1. Using your web browser, click here: https://www.homeschoolbuyersco-op.org/ixl-math
  2. Scroll down and click the option UPGRADE: Additional Student for a Current IXL Subscriber
  3. Enter 1 in the box under Qty.
  4. Complete the payment information at the bottom of the page.
Once we receive a confirmation of the purchase, we will process your order, add the new child to your account, and send you a confirmation e-mail.
closing: Let me know if I can help any further.

name: Steps to Remove a Child
body:
I'm happy to help your remove a child from your family membership.

You can remove a child using the following steps on your web browser:
  1. Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your parent profile.
  2. Click Welcome, Parent! in the upper-right corner, and select Membership details.
  3. Under Membership information, click the remove link next to the number of children.
  4. Select the child you would like to remove from your membership.
Alternatively, let me know which child needs to be removed and I can make the change for you.
closing: Please let me know if I can help any further.

name: Session expired (student)
body: The "session expired" message indicates that your browser lost its connection to the network. I recommend attempting the quiz again and making sure that you are starting and completing it in a timely manner. I also recommend making sure you have access to a good internet connection when attempting the quiz again.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Class/student limit
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: There is not a limit to how many classes or students you can add to your account. We have many accounts with thousands of students using hundreds of classes for both academic and corporate accounts.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: How to transfer a student
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can transfer a student and his or her grades from one class to another by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Classes in the left menu.
3. Above the student's old class, click the Roster link.
4. Next to the student's roster entry, click the checkbox.
5. Click the Actions for selected student(s)... drop-down menu at the upper right-hand corner of your roster.
6. Under "Transfer to another class" choose the class to which you'd like to transfer the student.

The student and his or her grades will then show up under the new class.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Request to use public-domain photos
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: The photos you referenced were posted by a member of our site, but are considered part of the public domain. You are welcome to use the photos on your site, however, to credit the Quia Web member who created the activity, please include the link you provided (LINK HERE).
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Who can access Quia?
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: Quia may be used by anyone, teacher or student, to create content to be used publicly or privately. When a quiz is created, several options are available to restrict access to that quiz. Teachers can make a quiz available to the entire public, or they can require students to log in with privileged accounts. To register students for a class, teachers can either create unique accounts for each student or they can allow students to create their own accounts and provide them with a code with which to register.
closing: In short, anyone may create content on our site, and the creator has full control over how publicly available that content is.  If you have any questions at all, don't hesitate to let me know.

name: Restrict browser
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: There isn't a way to restrict students to using a particular browser in Quia, and the links are visible to make it easier for teachers to share that content with students. We have several security features in Quia to make it more difficult to cheat, but as with pen and paper tests, the only way to be sure students are not cheating is to proctor them as they take any quizzes.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Cloudflare error on question upload
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: There are protections on our site that can prevent code from being uploaded. While we can't remove the protections that are causing the error you see, I recommend uploading or writing the questions without any formatting for the code, instead. You should then be able to write the questions in a way that cannot be mistaken for actual code.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Refer to IT
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I recommend reaching out to your school's IT professional for assistance in setting up your students' computers. The settings you will have to change are all going to be very specific to how your IT department has set up your school's computers, and it will require someone with specialized knowledge to configure your computer properly.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Suggestions
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia and sharing your suggestions with us. While not every request can be implemented, your feedback is instrumental in shaping our understanding of our members' needs.
closing: In that spirit, please continue sharing your ideas with us, and of course questions are always welcome.

name: Adding video
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can add video to any of the fields in Quia that accept HTML. The blue plus symbol marks fields that support HTML.

For information about using HTML to add video, you can visit the following link:

https://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_video.asp

Please keep in mind that the "Activate HTML and LaTeX" option must be enabled for any quizzes that require HTML.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Extend answer field (fill-in)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can extend the answer field length for any fill-in answers that are longer than the default answer field. This will allow students to see their entire answers before submitting.

To change the answer field length, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz you'd like to modify, click Edit.
4. If needed, switch to edit mode.
5. Beneath the fill-in question you'd like to modify, click the arrow next to "Other options."

You can then change the answer field length to accommodate the full answers. Please keep in mind that the maximum length is 60 characters. When you are finished editing your quiz questions, click Done at the bottom of the screen.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Remove results from gradebook
body:
You can archive your quiz results to remove them from your gradebook. Once they are archived, results can be viewed, but they cannot be altered.

To archive your quiz results, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz whose results you'd like to archive, click the Send results to archive icon ().
4. Click Send to archive.

For any quiz that has results that have been archived, only new submissions for that quiz will be available to grade.

To view these results later, scroll past the list of quizzes and view the archived results in the Archived Quiz Results folder. Click the folder to open it and then click the View link to view the archived results.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: How to copy a quiz
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can copy a quiz by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz you'd like to copy, click the Copy icon ().

Your quiz will then be copied.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: How to enable or disable a quiz
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can enable or disable a quiz from your quiz's assignment options. To enable a quiz, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz you'd like to enable, click Assign.
4. Under Global Settings, change Enabled? to Yes.
5. Click Done.

The quiz will then be enabled.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Quiz feedback (student)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: The type of feedback you can see after you've taken a quiz is determined by your instructor. I recommend contacting your instructor to inquire about obtaining access to your quiz feedback.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Question w/ more than 1 fill in
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Although there is not a way to add more than one blank to our fill-in questions, you can use the Advanced quiz editor to enter the question text as it's own item above the questions, with blanks entered where the missing words should be. Then, you can create questions beneath the question text with blanks in which the students can answer the questions. For example:

Question text: This is my favorite ___1___. I really ___2___ reading it.

1. __________
2. __________

To set up a question in this way, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Click Advanced at the top.
4. Click Create a new quiz.
5. In "Section 2: Questions", click the Insert drop-down box and choose Text/HTML.
6. Enter your question text, putting blanks and numbers where you'd like students to fill in the text (e.g., This is my favorite ___1___.)
7. Click Insert beneath the question text and choose One or more new questions.
8. Choose the Fill-in question type and click Add.
9. In the "Question" field of your newly created question, enter the number of the matching blank (e.g., 1.)
10. In the "Correct answers" area, enter the correct answers for that blank.

You can then create as many fill-in questions as needed to match the number of blanks in your question text. If you'd like, you can uncheck the Display question numbers option in "Section 3: Settings" so that Quia will hide the original question numbers and only display the numbers you have typed into the questions themselves.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Lost quiz while making
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Unfortunately, there's not a way to retrieve a quiz that has been lost. It sounds like the issue may have been related to your network or web browser losing its connection with the internet.

In the future, if you are creating a quiz with lots of questions, and there is the possibility of a poor internet or network connection, I recommend saving the quiz after every 5 or 10 questions created. Also, if you walk away from your computer for any amount of time, I suggest saving the questions you've created. This will help ensure that most of the progress you've made on your quiz is saved.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Enable Flash - Firefox (updated)
body:
If no audio plays when you click the play button, Adobe Flash Player is being blocked by your browser, Firefox. To fix this, please follow these steps

1) Open the Firefox browser.
2) Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines).
3) Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4) If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5) On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6) Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate".
7) Close the browser to save the changes.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions and I will be happy to help.

name: How to move a quiz to a folder
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can move a quiz into a folder by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz you'd like to move, select the checkbox.
4. Click the Other actions... drop-down box at the top of your list of quizzes.
5. Beneath the Move to heading, select a folder.

The chosen quiz will then be moved to the specified folder.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Restore results from archive
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can restore quiz results from the archive by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Scroll past the list of quizzes and click the folder Archived Quiz Results.
4. Click View next to the desired quiz.
5. Click the checkbox next to the results you'd like to restore.
6. From the Actions... drop-down menu at the top of the list, select Restore from archive.
7. Click Confirm.

The selected quiz results will then be restored.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Quiz submitting prematurely
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
The quizzes you mentioned were not automatically submitted by Quia. Quia does not submit a quiz automatically unless there's a timer on the quiz, which was not the case with either of the quizzes you mentioned.


It sounds like these students may have accidentally submitted the form using either a keyboard shortcut or simply clicking in the wrong place. The Chrome and Firefox browsers don't have the option to submit forms using keyboard shortcuts, so using one of those browsers may help to ensure that students' quizzes aren't submitted prematurely as long as no other extensions are installed.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Change time zone
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can change your time zone by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and sign in.
2) Click "Account" in the blue banner at the top of the page.
3) Click the "Time Zone" drop-down box and select the correct time zone.
4) Click "Save changes" at the bottom of the page.

Once you update your time zone, the time slots you place on your quizzes will reflect the your correct time zone and your students should be able to access your quizzes at the appropriate times.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Add Domain to iPad
body:
You can add your school's domain to your iPad through the "Settings" menu. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Tap "Settings" on the home screen of the iPad.
2) Tap the "IXL" icon on the left-side menu.
3) Tap "Custom sign in @" on the right side.
4) Type in "SCHOOLDOMAIN" in the field that comes up.

Once you re-open the IXL app on your iPad, you'll see "@SCHOOLDOMAIN" added to your username on the sign-in screen.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Student wanting to read book awards
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: Although you can view the book cover awards you earn, you aren't able to read them. However, if you are interested in reading these books, I recommend reaching out to your teacher. They may be able to help you find copies of the books to read.
closing: Keep on practicing and keep up the good work!

name: Clear complete
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: As requested, I have cleared the accounts for you.When they sign in again, their accounts will have no practice data.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Admin: student not signed in
body:
It sounds like the student is signing in to an old, inactive account that's no longer on your school's roster of students. You can make sure that they have their correct usernames and passwords. You can check your students' up-to-date account information at any time by viewing your IXL roster online. To view your roster, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin/mcpsva and sign in to your administrator account.
2) Click Account management.
3) Go to "Students".
4) Use the search bar to locate the student's information.

Your students will be listed here and each of their usernames and passwords can be found to the far right of their names. If your student continues to see this message please provide me with their username and I will be happy to investigate further.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I am happy to help!

name: Mobile browser bug (iPad app works)
greeting: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.
body:
Our engineers are currently working on a fix for this issue. In the meantime, you should be able to use the IXL iPad app to practice skill CODE. You can download our app for free by searching the App Store for "IXL practice" or by visiting our home page on your iPad and tapping on the link at the top of the page for the app.

I apologize for the inconvenience this caused. Issues like this are rare, and we are constantly monitoring our site to prevent them, or to fix them if they do come up.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Did not receive refund yet
body:
I am sorry to hear that you have not seen the refund on your statement. I recommend speaking with your financial institution for a status update. The following information can be helpful when speaking with them:
  • Date of refund:
  • Amount of refund:
  • Card refunded:
  • Confirmation #:
  • Transaction ID:
closing: Please let me know if I can help any further.

name: NYSDF
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Quia is a Web site that allows instructors and educators to create quizzes and activities that can be distributed to their students. As a result, access to quizzes is maintained by the person or company that purchased the subscription to Quia.

If you have questions associated with certification with "New York State Dental Foundation" that uses Quia, I would suggest contacting Carley Libertucci (clibertucci@nysdental.org) directly for more information. She will be able to provide you with the next steps to complete the certification process.
closing: Please let me know if there's any way I can assist.

name: Teach same student twice
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
While you can have the same student on the roster for multiple teachers, there is not a way to place the same student on your roster more than once. If you teach the same students for your Math lab, you won't be able to assign them to a second class on your roster unless you create an additional teacher account.

I will be happy to share this with our design team for consideration in future versions of IXL. We are always looking for ways to enhance our site and we rely on insights from educators like yourself to guide our planning as IXL grows.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Admin clearing data for one student
greeting: Thank you for contacting us about clearing your student's account. I understand that you want your student to work on skills they’ve practiced before, and that it can be confusing for students if they see scores from their prior work.
body:
However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your student'shard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your student's personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking your student's achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”
closing: I would be happy to provide some suggestions that may help you when your student is revisiting IXL skills. If it's more convenient to discuss these options over the phone, please feel free to give me a call.
versions:
However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your student'shard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your student's personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking your student's achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”

There are other options available to monitor your student's progress if you would like to keep data for teachers, parents, and your student to see. If students have already mastered a skill, they can practice again and will see their SmartScores reset to 0. If students haven’t yet reached mastery, they can keep practicing and their SmartScores will naturally adjust to their level of proficiency. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options in your reports to monitor their progress.

name: Inactive student (teacher)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
The "account inactive" message indicates that a student is signing in with a username and password that is no longer on your school's roster of students. However, if the student signs in with the username and password that is currently on your roster, he'll be able to practice successfully.

You can check your students' up-to-date account information at any time by viewing your IXL roster online. To view your roster, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.

Your students will be listed here and each of their usernames and passwords can be found to the far right of their names.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Want two different editions
greeting: Thank you for your interest in IXL.
body:
We are unable to combine two different editions of IXL into one family account. In order to access both the COUNTRY edition and the COUNTRY edition, you will need to purchase two separate memberships.

To view international membership options, please click here: https://www.ixl.com/international.
closing: Please let me know if I can help further.

name: Spanish Edition for ESL / ELL
body:
Thank you for your interest in the Spanish edition of IXL!

This edition is a recent release and is available for math, PreK - 6th grade. The math skills are aligned to COUNTRY's national curriculum and the questions will differ slightly from the US edition in terms of currency and measurement. Additionally, because this edition is intended for the international market, a subscription for NUMBER student would be PRICE per month or PRICE per year.

If you decide to purchase this edition, please keep in mind that the entire interface will be in LANGUAGE, including the Analytics reports and account management page.

To purchase a subscription, you may click here: https://es.ixl.com/membership/family/subscribe/monthly/math

For individual memberships, we accept credit or debit cards. For a yearly subscription, we can also accept PayPal, check/money order, or wire transfer.

I would be happy to walk you through the sign-up page or set up a subscription for you over the phone. You may call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET and ask for Paige.
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help.

name: What happened to Sugarcane?
body:
Unfortunately, Sugarcane wasn't able to attract enough of an audience to be sustainable over the long term, and we made the difficult decision to discontinue the site last spring.

While there is no way to access, play, or export your games any longer, if you have data sets you would like to keep, please let me know and I can provide you with a zip file containing the information from your Sugarcane data set.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Steps to change to yearly/monthly
body:
I'm glad to hear you are enjoying IXL!

To switch your membership to the yearly plan, please follow these steps from your web browser:
  1. Go to https://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your parent profile.
  2. Click the arrow next to Welcome, Parent! in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Membership Details.
  3. Under Membership information, select switch to yearly.
  4. Click Submit.
Since we are unable to apply past monthly payments to your new yearly membership, the PRICE fee for the yearly membership won’t be charged until the current month ends. The yearly membership will then begin on the same day, DATE.
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help.

name: Instructor asking about capacity
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: We have thousands of instructors actively using Quia, so there should be no issues with SUMMARIZEQUESTION. As always, we will be actively monitoring our site for any performance issues.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Limbo Mobile Accounts
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
It sounds like Apple may be experiencing technical issues so I have reported this to our engineers so they can investigate.

In the meantime, I will be happy to help you get started on IXL. You will first need to cancel your Apple iTunes purchase so you are not charged for an account you cannot access.

To cancel your App Store membership, you can reference thesecancellation instructionsfrom Apple.

Once you have canceled this account, I will set you up with a membership throughIXL.comwith a complimentary month of access.

Please let me know the following information so I can provide further instructions:
  • Subjects you want to purchase (ex: math, language arts)
  • Number of children
  • Country edition (ex: US, UK, Canada, etc.)
closing: I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Tracking progress in the Diagnostic
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
We are actively working to develop a way for teachers like yourself to track the progress students have made on their Diagnostic levels. For now, we recommend periodically saving or printing students' Diagnostic stats to keep track of their progress.

You can save or print students' Diagnostic stats by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2. Click Analytics.
3. Click Diagnostic.

To generate a PDF with all of your students' stats in one document, click the paper icon to the right of the words "Individual student levels & recommendations." If you'd like to save or print an individual student's stats, you can click the paper icon to the right of their levels.

name: Recommended Flash Approach
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
If you're having trouble recording and hearing audio for your assignments, then the Flash installed on your browsers is not streaming the audio properly. To ensure you can hear audio, we recommend using Firefox and enabling Flash on that browser. You can enable Flash on your browser by following these steps:

1) Open the Firefox browser.
2) Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines).
3) Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4) If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5) On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6) Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate".
7) Close the browser to save the changes.

You should then be able to record and hear audio on our site when using Firefox.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions and I will be happy to help.

name: Used Amazon Book key
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I can confirm the book key or access code providedXXXXXXXXXXXXX has been used.

Your book key is usually packaged with your book in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. Heinle Learning Center book keys are 19-character codes that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Heinle Learning Center package, you can purchase your book access online. To do so, please log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.

name: Partial credit for multiple correct
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
We agree that it would be helpful to be able to give partial credit for "multiple correct" question types. However, the issue comes down to how exactly they should be graded. For example, would incorrect matches count negatively toward a student's total?

We do have an alternative that you may find helpful. The "matching" question type can be graded giving partial credit for each correct match. If the left column in the question is all the various question options, and the right column is just two options, true or false, then students can get credit for each correct match in this question type as long as you select that option on creating the question.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Clearing results from accounts
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
If you'd like students to no longer see their results when they log in to their accounts, I suggest exporting your gradebook for your records, then deleting their results.

You can export your gradebook by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Classes in the left menu.
3. Next to the desired class, click Gradebook.
4. At the upper right-hand corner of your gradebook, click Export. Your students' results will be exported to a CSV file.

You can then delete any results that you don't want to appear in students' accounts by following these steps:

5. Click the pencil icon above the quiz with results you'd like to delete.
6. Under the "Student Summary" heading, select the checkbox next to the results you'd like to delete.
7. Click the Actions... drop-down menu and choose Delete.
8. Click Delete.

​Once you've deleted your students' results, they won't show up in their accounts any longer.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

body:
If you are having trouble viewing practice questions, you may need to add IXL as a trusted site on your iPad. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap the Settings icon.
2) In the list of settings in the left menu, tap Screen Time.
3) In the right menu, tap Content & Privacy Restrictions.
4) If prompted, enter your Screen Time Passcode.
5) Tap Content Restrictions.
6) Tap Web Content.
7) Tap Add Website under the Always allow heading at the bottom of the list of allowed websites.
8) Enter "ixl.com" as the URL.
9) Tap Done on your keypad.

The next time you sign in to IXL on your app you should be able to view the questions. However, if you still have difficulties viewing all of the questions, please follow these steps to uninstall the app, restart your iPad, and reinstall the app:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap and hold the IXL icon.
2) Tap the X in the top-left corner of the icon once it appears.
3) Turn off your iPad by holding the power button and then sliding the prompt to turn off your iPad when it appears.
4) Turn on your iPad by pressing the power button.
5) Reinstall the app by going to www.ixl.com or by searching for it in the App store.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you. I want to make sure you can use your iPad to practice on IXL.

greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Classes in the left menu.
3. Above the student's old class, click the Roster link.

6. Under "Transfer to another class" choose the class to which you'd like to transfer the student.

The student will then show up under the new class.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Games Not Loading  - Flash
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I am sorry to hear that the games are not loading. As you probably know, all the major browsers now block the Flash player be default. Even if you have it installed you still are required to enable it for every website you visit. The easiest way to enable Flash in the Google Chrome web browser is to click the green word “Secure” next to the URL in the URL bar. There you can manage your Flash settings for the particular website you’re visiting. You can also reference the attached image.

Additionally, by visiting our Test Your Browser page, you will be able to see if your computer is supported to use all of the features of Multiplication.com. This test was created to help users with the most common issues we see. On this page you can see if your browser has support for Flash, HTML5, and how well WebSockets can work with your Internet Connection, your Antivirus, and all other software you have. The test checks WebSocket operation by connecting to our WebSocket-enabled server and exchanging a simple data packet.

If you are still experiencing issues after diagnosing with the Test Your Browser page, please send me a screen shot image of the results along with the following details:
  • what kind of device you are using to practice
  • what browser you are using (If you are unsure of the web browser, you can go to https://www.whatismybrowser.com/ to find out.)
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to help. You may also call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET. Please feel free to ask for me by name.

name: Number of diagnostic questions
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: The Dashboard, along with the other non-Diagnostic reports in Analytics, is designed to provide you with deep insights on skills that students have practiced. However, IXL’s Continuous Diagnostic gives you a bird's-eye view of where students currently stand in relation to readiness for grade-level skills. As a result, we haven't developed a way to view the number of questions answered in the Diagnostic, but rather focus on the diagnostic results to drive learning that is targeted to students' needs.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

2) Tap General.
3) Swipe down and tap Restrictions.
4) Enter your iPhone passcode when prompted to access your list of website restrictions.
5) Tap Websites in the Allowed content section.
6) Tap Add a website... under the Always allow heading at the bottom of the list of allowed websites.
7) Enter "ixl.com" as the URL.
8) Tap Done on your keypad.

The next time you sign in to IXL on your app you should be able to view the questions. However, if you still have difficulties viewing all of the questions, please follow these steps to uninstall the app, restart your iPhone, and reinstall the app:

4) Turn on your iPhone by pressing the power button.
5) Reinstall the app by going to www.ixl.com or by searching for it in the App store.

You can follow these steps to enroll in your course and access your online book:

1) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2) Enter your course code in the box and click Submit.
3) If prompted, select your specific class or section, then click Submit.

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click Go. Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify your name and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. You can then safely discard your book key.

If you do not have a book key, you can purchase one by clicking the buy link for the book in the My classes section of your account. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Your book key will be instantly added to your account.

Once you've entered your course code and purchased or entered your book key you will be fully registered and able to start your assignments!

To access your account in the future, go to http://books.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using Quia! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.

body:
If you are having trouble watching the video in your book, then the Flash installed on your browser is not streaming the video properly. Adobe Flash Player is a technology your browser uses to play the video on our site.

You may be able to fix this problem by disabling any extensions installed on your browser that you do not use. Extensions can interfere with how your browser handles Flash content. You can view all of your extensions here:

chrome://extensions

Click the icon of a trash can to remove any extensions you do not recognize or use.

Alternatively, you can download and use a completely new browser. A newly installed browser will not have any extensions installed, and you will be able to log in to your account using it to open your book and view your videos.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you should have no further browser problems with the video in your book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.

body:
You can follow these steps to create an account and enroll in your course:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2) Click "Create account".
3) Enter your information and click "Submit". Remember to write down your username and password.
4) Click "Enter a course code".
5) Enter your course code in the appropriate field and click "Submit".
6) If prompted, select a specific class or section, then click "Submit".

If you do not know your course code, please contact your instructor to obtain it. If you are unable to contact your instructor or your instructor cannot locate the course code, please e-mail me your instructor's full name and e-mail address and I can try to locate it for you.

If you have a book key, enter it now and click "Go". Your book key is a series of 16-19 letters and numbers and the 4th digit should be "S". Verify that your name is entered correctly and follow the prompts to save your book key to your account. Once completed, you can safely discard your book key.

If you need to purchase a book key, you can do so by clicking the "buy" link for the book in the "My classes" section of your account. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course!

To access your account in the future, go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and your instructor's feedback.
closing: Thank you for using the Heinle Learning Center! Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Try recording the exercise again. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
