7. Confirm your choice to clear the scores for those exercises.

Your student will now be able to submit another attempt for that exercise.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Delete student attempt

body:
To change the exercises that are assigned in your course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.

Please note that the exercises listed here with a red dot contain questions that will require you to grade them before students' scores are final. Exercises listed here with a green dot will be graded automatically.

If you wish to set a due date for an exercise, click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears. To assign the same due date to several exercises at once, please follow these steps:

7. Check the box to the left of each exercise that shares a due date.
8. Open the "Other actions..." menu at the top of the list of exercises and choose "Set due date."
9. Select a due date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for all of the exercises you selected.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.
name: Assigning exercises

body:
You can set the grading and feedback options for your course so that your students will see the correct answers for any questions they missed, but only after they have used up all of their available attempts for that exercise. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course (e.g. "Spanish 1").
3) Click on the "Books" tab.
4) Beneath the "Books" tab, click "Options".
5) Select the book from the drop-down menu next to the "Preview" button and click "Go." (Select "All books" if you wish to apply changes to all of your books at once.)
6) In the "Feedback" section, click on "Score and summary" and confirm your choice when prompted.

Now the feedback will be set to not show answers by default. The next step is to show students the answers once they have used up all of their attempts:

7) Click on the "Options" tab in the top row (in the same row as "Dashboard", "Classes", and "Books").
8) Click on the "Grading options" button.
9) In the "Multiple attempts" section, check the box next to "Ignore student results after the ___ attempt."
10) In the same line, select the number of attempts you would like your students to have for each exercise.
11) On the next line, check the box next to "Always show feedback as "score, summary, and answers" after students' final attempt."
12) Click the "Save changes" button.

Your students will now see their total score and which questions were correct or incorrect after each attempt, but they will not see the correct answers until after they have submitted their final attempt.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Set grading feedback options

body:
I understand you have a question about accepting late assignments.

You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps:

1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up.
2) Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
3) Click on the title of your course.
4) Click the "Classes" tab.
5) Navigate to the appropriate section using the "Book" and "Section" drop-down lists.
6) Click the "late" link that eStudio displays in place of the score for that exercise.
7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student.

eStudio will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!
name: Acccept late scores

body: Please tell me which exercises you were working on and I will be happy to investigate.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you soon.
name: Problem w/ exercise

body:
When you answer the same problem multiple times, eStudio records each of the scores separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a small triangle next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. eStudio displays a number in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/eStudio/Viewing_Results.pdf
closing: Thank you for using eStudio!  Please let me know if you have any questions.
name: Student can't see mult. attempts

body:
I am happy to help!

To create your course, you will need to contact the Glencoe/McGraw-Hill Education Subscription Management team for a book key. The team can be reached by phone or e-mail:

Phone: 1-800-598-4077
E-mail: subscriptionmanagement@mheducation.com

Once you have obtained your book key you can follow these steps to create your eStudio course:

1. Go to http://estudio.quia.com

2. In the "Log In" section, enter your username and password to log into your account.
(If you have not yet created an account, click the "Create an account" link at the bottom of the "Log In" section.)

3. Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field, located in the upper-right corner of your screen. You will be prompted to create a course. If you wish, you can now discard your book key; you will not need to use it again.

4. Fill out the form and click "Submit". (Don't worry, you will be able to edit this information later if you need to.)

5. Enter your class information and click "Submit". Create as many classes as you need to match the number of sections you teach and then click "Done" (again, you can edit this information and add or remove classes later on if you need to).

Your course will now be created and displayed in your account. To enroll your students in your course, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the name of your course (e.g. "Spanish 1").
3. Click the "Classes" tab.
4. Click "Roster" beneath the "Classes" tab.

If you have a spreadsheet in CSV form with your students' names, you can click the "Import student list" link on the right side of the page, above the roster. You can find instructions for how to prepare your list of students for import here:

http://estudio.quia.com/help/activities/manager/importstudentlistteacher.html

If you do not already have a roster to import, fill in the first and last names of your students in the spaces provided. If you need more space to add students, click the "Add more rows..." button beneath the roster. Click "Save Changes" when you are finished.

Accounts will now be created for each of your students--their usernames will be displayed to the right of their names, and you can see their passwords by clicking the icon of a lock. Click the appropriate "Send" button beneath your roster to have a complete list of students' usernames and passwords e-mailed to you. The easiest way to distribute them is to print out this list and cut it into strips for each student.

You might also find these info sheets helpful. They describe different grading options you can set up, how to assign homework, and how to grade it:

Customizing Grading & Feedback Options: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/eStudio/Customizing_Grading.pdf

Assigning Activities: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/eStudio/Assigning_Activities.pdf

Grading Results: http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/eStudio/Grading_Results.pdf
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Instructor book key setup

body:
I understand you need to add an additional book to your course. To do so, you will need to contact the Glencoe/McGraw-Hill Education Subscription Management team for a book key to add another book to your existing course. The team can be reached by phone or e-mail:

Phone: 1-800-598-4077
E-mail: subscriptionmanagement@mheducation.com

Once you have obtained your book key, you can follow these steps to add it to your course:

1. Log into your account at http://estudio.quia.com
2. Enter your book key into the appropriate field in the top-right corner of the screen.
3. Select "Add this book to an existing course" and choose your course from the menu provided.
4. Click "Next".
5. Click "Add Book".

The book will now be added to your course.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Add book to course

body:
Please follow these steps to access a summary of your students' performance and results for your entire course via the eStudio integrated grade book:

1. Log in to your account at http://estudio.quia.com
2. Click on the title of the course you want to access (e.g. "Spanish 1")
3. Go to the "Classes" tab and click on "Gradebook"
4. In the "Book" menu, choose "All Books" and click "Go"

For each student you will see a cumulative score per book and an overall score for the entire course.

To view scores for individual exercises within a book and book section, select the book from the "Book" menu, click "Go," then select a corresponding section or chapter from the "Section" menu and click "Go."
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Viewing gradebook/results

body:
In an effort to protect the privacy of our students, we ask that you please contact your instructor to find your username and password. Instructors can view students' usernames and passwords from their class rosters.

If you add your e-mail address to your account you will always be able to retrieve your username and password. To do so, please follow these steps

1) Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the "Profile" link in the top-right corner.
3) Enter your e-mail address in the space provided.
4) Click "Save changes."

You will now be able to retrieve the username and password on your account at any time.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.
name: Student can't provide pass

body:
It sounds like the resolution on your screen may be set too low. Here are the steps to change the resolution so that you can see the "My Tools" box:

1. Right click an empty spot on your computer's desktop and choose "Properties" from the menu
2. Click on the "Settings" tab
3. Under "Screen Resolution", slide the bar to the right so that your resolution is set to a minimum of 1024 x768
4. Click Ok

You should now be able to open the course and view the "My tools" menu in the top-right corner.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know!
name: Cannot find my tools

body:
I'm happy to help you begin a new term!

Now that you have successfully completed an eStudio course, you can set up a new course with new classes each semester. In most cases, as long as you are using the same book as last semester, you do not need a new book key. In cases where a book key is required, eStudio prompts you to enter the key.

To start a new term with new students, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2. Locate the course you want to base the new course on.
3. Do one of the following:
* If you see a "Start new term" link beneath the course title, click on it and skip to Step 6.
* If you don't see the "Start new term" link, click the course title (e.g. "Spanish 1").
4. Click the "Options" tab.
5. Click "Create new course".
6. Enter the course information in the appropriate fields.
7. Click "Submit" and your course will be created.
8. Fill out the form to create a class (i.e. section) in which to enroll students.
9. Click "Submit."
10. Click "Create another class" to set up additional sections or click "Done" when all of your classes are set up.

The activities that were previously assigned will remain assigned in the new term. However any due dates will not carry over as they would be now be invalid.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Start new term

body:
You can follow these steps to delete a course:

1. Go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the title of the course you want to delete.
3. Go to the "Options" tab.
4. If you have any classes in your course, you will need to delete them first by clicking the "Delete class" button for each.
5. Click "Delete Course".

These steps will delete a course that has already ended as well as a course that is still active.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
name: Delete course

body:
It looks like you've already linked your book with your course in your account. I was able to open the book from your account and access the assignments. Please go to http://estudio.quia.com and log in to your account, then click on the image of your book to open a new window and access the book.

If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!
name: Disable popup blocker

body:
I understand you have a question about getting a book key.

You will not need a book key to complete your homework online. Instead, your teacher will give you a username and password to use to log in to eStudio. When you log in with the username and password your teacher gives you, you will immediately be able to open your book and do the work your teacher assigns.

Please contact your teacher for your username and password.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
name: Where/What is book key

body:
When you created your class roster, eStudio automatically generated accounts with usernames and passwords for your students. To view their account information, you can follow these steps:

1. Log into your account at http://estudio.quia.com
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click "Classes".
4. Click the "Roster" link.

eStudio will display each student's username to the right of the student's name. You can click the padlock icon to see or change individual passwords.

If you would like a full list of all usernames and passwords in a class, scroll to the bottom of the page and press the appropriate "Send" button to e-mail yourself your students' usernames and passwords. The other "Send" button mails each student his or her username and password at the e-mail address listed in your roster.
closing: Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.
name: View student user/pass

body: Some of the exercises your instructor has assigned are too complex to be automatically graded when you submit them. These exercises are displayed in your results with a red dot to indicate that the score is not yet final.  When your instructor grades this exercise, the red dot will turn green and your final score will be displayed instead.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!
greeting: I understand you have a question about your grade for an assignment.
name: Red dot, no credit

body:
I understand you have a question about viewing your results.

After you complete an exercise, your answers are submitted but the actual exercise is reset so that you can complete it again if needed. To view your results, follow these steps:

1) Log in to http://estudio.quia.com
2) Click on the image of your book to open it.
3) Click the "My Tools" menu in the top-right corner.
4) Choose "Results" to open that page.

You can then view your scores and click on the bar graph icon for each score to view a detailed performance summary, along with your instructor's comments.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know!
name: Answers cleared out

body:
eStudio provides an accent tool bar for all activities that require you to enter words with accented characters.

When you are completing these online exercises, you should see a navigation tool bar at the top of the window that has buttons for "Next Page", "Previous Page", and "Back". If the exercise calls for it, there will also be an accent tool bar beneath the navigation tools.

To use the accent tool bar, place your cursor in the answer field where you want the accented character to appear and click on the character in the tool bar. eStudio will enter the accented character where your cursor was positioned.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist!
name: Using accent toolbar

body:
You can view assignments from either the calendar or assignment list. Assignments that have due dates will show up on your calendar. To open your calendar, first open the book in your account and click the "My Tools" tab in the top-right corner. Select "Calendar" from the menu to open your calendar. You will see a list of all exercises due in the upcoming weeks. Click on an exercise title to open and complete it.

If you do not have a calendar available (because your instructor has set no due dates), you can click on the "Assignment List" link under "My Tools" to view your exercises.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!

You can follow these steps to remove a class from your course:

3. Go to the "Options" tab.
4. Click "Delete Class".
5. Select the class you want to delete from the list and click "Delete".

eStudio will delete the class. Any students who were enrolled in that class will be dropped and their results will be lost.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.

body:
I'm happy to help you add files to your announcement board.

You can follow these steps to add your own files to your announcements board:

1. Log into your account at http://estudio.quia.com
2. Click the title of your course.
3. Go to the "Announcements" tab.
4. Click inside the message text box where you want to insert the file.
5. Type what you want to name the file link. This is the text students click on to download the file, e.g. "Click here for your class syllabus".
6. Highlight the text you just typed.
7. Click the icon that resembles a chain to link your text to your file.
8. Click the small icon to the right of the "Link URL" box.
9. Select the appropriate file from your account and click "OK".
10. Click "Insert".
11. Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click "Save Changes".
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Add files to announce board
Child's practice missing (parent)
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
When your child is successfully signed in, all of their practice will be saved and will show up in the weekly reports. It sounds like they might be accidentally practicing from the parent profile in your account. While signed in as the parent, they can practice as much as they wish, but work will only be recorded if they are signed in to their own profile, instead.

I suggest monitoring your child as they sign in to their account. On an iPad, your child's name will appear in the upper left-hand corner when they are signed in. If needed, you can tap the name in the left-hand corner to change the profile. On a computer, the "Welcome, Child’s name" message will appear in the upper right-hand corner of the page as long as they are signed in. While they are signed in to their profile, they will be able to practice an unlimited number of questions and all of their practice will show in their reports.

I noticed that there is no secret word for your parent profile. If you set a secret word for your parent profile, your child will not be able to accidentally practice in your profile. You can set a secret word by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to the parent profile.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu.
3) SelectProfile & settingsfrom the drop-down menu that appears.
4) Scroll down in the window that opens and enter a secret word for your parent profile.
5) ClickSubmit.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Do you have a free trial?
greeting: I'm excited to hear that you're considering joining IXL for your family!
body:
While we do not offer a free trial for family memberships, we do offer 10 free questions in each subject every day so you can see if IXL is a good fit for you and your children.

To get started, just click theLearningtab then the name of the subject you'd like to practice at the top of the page. You'll see a full list of the skills we offer and can practice the same content that you can access to with an IXL membership. You'll also be able to engage with our SmartScore, which is a real-time snapshot of your child's understanding of a particular skill.

Once you purchase an IXL account, your child will have access to unlimited practice. You'll also have access toIXL Analytics, our extensive reporting suite that provides an in-depth look at your child's progress and trouble spots.

We do have a 30-day satisfaction guarantee as well, so if you purchase a membership and find that it is not a good fit, you may contact us within the first 30 days of your purchase for a full refund.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, please visit ourMembership page.
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help!

name: Audio not working (Windows 10)
body:
The sound settings in Windows 10 were recently changed, which can cause the audio on our website to stop working. If you change your sound settings from "Surround sound" to "Stereo", the audio will work in IXL again.

To change your audio settings, please follow these steps:

1. Go to your Windows Control Panel.
2. Click Sound.
3. Under the Playback tab, select your output device and click Configure.
4. Select Stereo in the window that appears.
5. Click Next and continue through the rest of the setup process.

You should then be able to hear the sound on IXL once more.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: free trial mistake
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I apologize for any confusion. We do not have a free month trial for family memberships. The membership that was registered was a paid membership for PRICE.<br clear="none" /><br clear="none" />At IXL, we do have a 30-day satisfaction guarantee and refund policy. If you find that IXL is not a good fit for your family, you can reach out to us by phone or e-mail within the first 30 days and we will be happy to refund the charge for you.
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions or would like to make any changes to your membership. I am happy to help!

name: Why we are increasing Quia prices
body: Though cost of maintaining Quia Web has steadily increased over the past 15 years, this is the first time we have ever increased our subscription price. With this increase, we will be able to support ongoing maintenance and services for the site, as well as compliance with district requirements on security.
closing: Thank you for your understanding. Let me know if you have any other questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Flash broken in Chrome
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
I noticed that you were using Google Chrome to access your book. Chrome recently released an update that now automatically blocks Adobe Flash which is needed in order to record audio. You may be able to temporarily un-block Flash by clicking the icon of a puzzle piece in the upper right corner of your exercise window and clicking "Run Flash this time". However, if this doesn't work or you don't see the icon of a puzzle piece when you open your exercise, I recommend switching browsers to Mozilla Firefox. You will then be able to record audio.

You can download Firefox for free from here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you can use it to go to our site and you should have no further difficulties with completing your course work.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help!

name: Purchase; Use independently QB/AK
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
In order to obtain access to the online version of the book, you will need to purchase access on our site. When you purchase your online book directly from us, access to the book is instantly added to your account. Your book access is not a physical book or book key that you receive in the mail. Instead, it's an electronic book.

You can follow these steps to purchase online access to your book from our bookstore:

1) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the "Bookstore" link at the top of the page.
3) Enter the name of your book into the "Title" field and click "Search." We do not sell print versions of any books, so the prices you see will be for an online book only.
4) Click "buy" next to the book in the search results.
5) Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information.

Your online book will be instantly added to your account. You can follow these steps to use it without a course code:

1) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the "Book details" button.
3) Click "Use book independently" and confirm it when prompted.

You can now open your book and submit your work independently without an instructor. Please note that work you complete independently will be cleared from your account if you register for a course using this book.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all!

name: AR Failed by Bundle Overflow
body:
I wanted to reach out because we noticed that the number of students in your SIS data exceeded the maximum number of students on your subscription, preventing a successful sync. There are currently XXX students submitted in the data out of XXX purchased licenses.


Do all of these students need access to IXL? If this is a temporary increase in students due to a new semester transition, we can provide a temporary buffer to process that change in enrollment.


We also have the ability to filter your data to reduce the number of students applied to your subscription. If you have any filter criteria that we can use to specify which records should be applied (i.e. classes, students, or teachers), our engineers can work to build those for your account.

We have paused your Auto-Roster sync to preserve the existing data in your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Create Class
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
To create a course, please follow the instructions below:

1) Go to http://www.alkitaabtextbook.com.

2) Enter your username and password in the fields provided and click "Log In".

3) In the course box for your course, click on the "Create a new class" button.

4) Enter your class information and click "Submit". (You can always make changes to this information later.)

Your class will be created and students will be able to register using the course code you provided them.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I'll be happy to help.

name: How to Purchase US Edition with Sci
greeting: I am happy to help you with purchasing a US edition of IXL!
body:
Please use the following steps to purchase the US edition membership:
  1. Using your web-browser, go tohttps://www.ixl.com/international
  2. Select the United States option.
  3. ClickMembership in the upper right hand side of the page.
  4. Under Families, click Join Now.
  5. Select the Core subjects package option. This is the only option that includes IXL Science.
  6. Fill in your contact and payment information and click Join Now.
You will set up your account on the following page. Once the set up is complete, you will be automatically signed in and you can start practicing!
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to help. You may also call us at +44 20 3318 5967 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET.

name: Limbo - initial questions
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body: I am happy to help, however I am not able to find a membership with your name or e-mail address (EMAIL). Please provide me with the e-mail or username that you registered to IXL, and I'll take another look.<br clear="none" /><br clear="none" />Did you purchase the membership from Apple on iTunes, or directly from our website's membership page?<br clear="none" /><br clear="none" />With your clarification, I will be able to help further.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Book Access Duration

closing: If you have any questions please let me know!

As long as you are logging in to your account at https://hlc.quia.com and clicking on the image of the book to open your class, you will be able to view and submit assignments.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

closing: Let me know when you upload your first files so that I can send them to our engineers for testing!

name: Clear/reset diagnostic data
body: While there's not a way to clear the Diagnostic, the IXL Continuous Diagnostic is designed to reflect your students' current levels of understanding. When they begin diagnosing again, the Diagnostic will automatically update to show you where they are now, even if they have diagnosed previously.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Enable Flash on Firefox (THE REAL)
body:
1. Open the Firefox browser.
2. Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines)
3. Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4. If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5. On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6. Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate."
7. Close the browser to save the changes.

name: Show answers after final attempt
body:
If you would like to change the grading options so students can see the correct answers only after the third attempt, please follow these steps:

1) Log in to your account and click the course title.
2) Click the "Options" tab. Then click the "Grading options" link.
3) Make sure the box for "Ignore student results after the 3rd attempt" is checked.
4) Make sure the box for "Always show feedback as 'score, summary, and answers' after students' final attempt" is checked.
5) Click Save Changes and then click Continue when prompted.
5) Click the "Books" tab. Then click the "Options" tab underneath the "Books" tab.
6) Click the link for "Score and summary" underneath the "Feedback" section.

Once you have completed these steps, your students will see the correct answers only after the third attempt.

Please let me know if you have any questions at all!

name: Fixed
body:
I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We were able to resolve the issue with the eBook not loading correctly. Once you log in to your account and open the eBook, you should be able to access it without any issues.

I apologize for any inconvenience this has caused. If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Audio Pre-K-5
body:
While some screen readers and other extensions such as Google Read & Write can provide limited audio assistance for students using IXL, their functionality can be limited.

Audio for math and language arts questions in grades pre-K - 2 are available on our site. Students can have questions read aloud to them by clicking on the blue speaker icon to the left of the question. When students are practicing on our iPad or Android apps, tapping anywhere on the question or the speaker icon will play the audio. Even if students miss the speaker icon, if they tap on the question itself, the question will be read aloud.

You can also enable audio for all the math and English language arts questions in grades 3 - 5 on IXL. To enable audio for these higher grade levels, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that appears.
4) Check Extend audio support for skill practice.
5) Click Submit.

The audio button will now be available for students practicing math and English language arts up to grade 5.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Permission from School
body:
We have received permission from NAME school to transfer the practice data from the school account to the family account.

Now we have permission from the school, the next step is for you to add NAME to your family account. Instructions on how to add a child to your family account can be found here:

https://www.ixl.com/help_docs/AddChild.pdf

If you need assistance adding NAME to the family account, please contact support@ixl.com or call 855-255-8800.

After you have added NAME to the family account and notified me, I will be happy to transfer the practice data. Also, please include the case number ######## in your e-mail.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: STAAR Test
body:
While we don't have a specific STAAR practice, the IXL skills that are aligned to the Texas State Standards will assist your child in preparing for the STAAR test. You can view the Texas State Standards by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.

2) Click TX standards at the top of the page.

3) Click on a subject near the top of the page.

4) Click on the desired grade level located underneath the subjects.

You will be able to see the Texas State Standards aligned with the skills to assist your child in preparing for the STAAR test.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I'll be happy to help.

name: Hiding/unhiding timer
body:
I see that Name has hidden the timer for the students on her roster. To unhide the timer for the students, please ask Name to follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.

2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.

3) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Settings section and uncheck the Hide timer check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.

4) Click Submit.

Once the students sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin, they will see the timer when practicing in IXL.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: Viewing the U.S. edition in Spanish
body:
This is a good question, and I can understand why you and other teachers would find it beneficial to have a tool where students could view the U.S. edition in Spanish. Currently, though, we do not have a tool that allows a student to view different languages.

I will be happy to share your feedback with our design team. As we always appreciate feedback from teachers, students, and parents as we continue to build our site to better meet your needs.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: Remove Custom Domain from iPad app:
body:
Please follow these steps to remove the custom domain from the app settings:

1) Tap the Settings icon on your home screen.

2) Tap IXL in the left menu.

3) On the right side menu tap Custom sign-in @.

4) Delete the custom domain.

The custom domain will no longer be stored on your iPad.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

A screenshot of the 2 charges as they appear on your statement, excluding any personal information, can also be helpful.

At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you soon.

body:
I was able to log in to your account and see that your book was entered on DATE and will expire on DATE. You can also see this information by following the steps below:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the "Details" link under Class tools.
3) You can view the book details under "Book Information"

body:

To purchase your book key, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to click "Open book" to submit your work.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

name: Reset Skills / Clear data
body:
While it’s possible to clear the practice data or reset SmartScores, you have several options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! Our skills are designed to naturally adjust to students' current levels of understanding even if they’ve practiced before. If they mastered a skill previously, the SmartScore will reset to 0 automatically when they begin practicing again.

To allow students to demonstrate their understanding in previously practiced skills, we recommend having them practice 20 questions or until they reach mastery, whichever comes first. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options at the top of your reports to monitor their current progress.

2) Reset the SmartScores. If you’d like to reset the SmartScores, please let me know the following:
  • Students’ usernames or the grade level
  • Grade level of the skills
3) Clear the practice data and awards. However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”
closing: Please let me know which option you would prefer, or if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!
versions:
While it’s possible to clear the practice data or reset SmartScores, you have several options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! Our skills are designed to naturally adjust to children's current levels of understanding even if they’ve practiced before. If they mastered a skill previously, the SmartScore will reset to 0 automatically when they begin practicing again.

To allow children to demonstrate their understanding in previously practiced skills, we recommend having them practice 20 questions or until they reach mastery, whichever comes first. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options at the top of your reports to monitor their current progress.

2) Reset the SmartScores. If you’d like to reset the SmartScores, please let me know the following:
  • Grade level of the skills.
  • Skill codes and full names of the skills you’d like reset (e.g., A.1 Learn to count - up to 3).
3) Clear the practice data and awards.However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your child's hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your child’s personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent you from tracking any achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that children become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”

name: student view results
body:
I'm happy to help you with viewing your results. To do so, please follow the instructions below:

1) Go to https://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course.
3) Click on the "Results" link at the top of the window that opens.
4) Select the appropriate book in the "View" drop-down menu and click "Go".
5) Select the appropriate section in the "Section" drop-down menu and click "Go".
6) Click the clipboard icon to the right of an exercise you have submitted.

You will then be able to see your submission and score for the exercise.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I'll be happy to help.

name: AR Failed Parsing
body:
I wanted to reach out because we noticed that your SIS data was formatted incorrectly, preventing a successful sync.


Please update your files to ensure that they match the IXL data standard in our technical specifications to generate a successful sync
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: AR Failed by Errors
body:
I wanted to reach out because we noticed that your SIS data generated too many errors, preventing a successful sync.


Our engineers were able to confirm the following based on our logs:

[Copy CSE Notes Here]

Is this an expected change, or is this an unexpected result based on the submitted data? If this change is expected, let us know and we can process the data moving forward.

We have paused your Auto-Roster sync to preserve the existing data in your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: AR Account Not Syncing
body:
Your subscription is currently utilizes our Auto-Roster feature, meaning accounts are managed and provisioned via data synced from your SIS. I wanted to confirm with you whether or not you are interested in continuing to sync your SIS data to IXL via your SFTP integration.

If you would like to resume this process, please notify me when you submit new files so I can coordinate with our engineers to ensure your files are successfully synced going forward.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Admin AR Question
body:
Your subscription currently utilizes our Auto-Roster feature. Auto-rostered accounts use data synced from your current SIS to provision student and teacher rosters, or accounts. If your IXL rosters or information don’t appear to be correct, please contact your SIS manager to ensure that your information is accurately reflected in the SIS data being sent to IXL.

If you do not know who manages your SIS syncs, please use your school’s technical support escalation workflow to submit the issue to the appropriate parties.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Teacher AR Question
body:
Your subscription currently utilizes our Auto-Roster feature. Auto-rostered accounts use data synced from your current SIS to provision student and teacher rosters, or accounts. If your IXL rosters or information don’t appear to be correct, please contact your admin or SIS manager to ensure that your information is accurately reflected in the SIS data being sent to IXL.

If you do not know who manages your student accounts, please use your school’s technical support escalation workflow to submit the issue to the appropriate parties.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Customer Filtering vs IXL Filtering
greeting: Thank you for sending your files.
body:
We noticed that your files contained too many students for the number of licenses that were purchased for the subscription. As a result, this data will need to be filtered to send less students.

Are you able to filter your exports to include only the students who need active IXL accounts? If you are unable to filter the data on your end, could you let us know what classes, grades, or teacher rosters should be filtered in the data for us to apply on our end?
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Updating Filters
body:
In order to process your data correctly, I'll need to know how we should filter your data to fit within your subscription. We can filter by grade, class enrollment, and/or teacher roster based on the information in your submitted files.


How would you like your filter preferences to be updated?
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Deferred Integration Setup
body:
I’m reaching out regarding setting up an SIS integration for your subscription. We have received your survey responses containing your contact information and preferences and I wanted to confirm with you whether or not you are interested in continuing the SIS integration set up.

If you would like to proceed with this process, please let me know and I will generate your SFTP credentials to begin exports.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Enable Manual Rostering Request
body:
The best way to roster students to your IXL teacher rosters that are not currently rostered is to ensure they are enrolled with that teacher in your SIS data. Some schools find it is easiest to create a separate roster in your SIS for teachers that need students not on their class rosters. These dummy classes wouldn't have to function for anything other than the exported data to IXL to provision those students to teacher rosters.

Alternatively, we do have the option to enable manual rostering for accounts, however this would allow all users on the account to make manual changes to your rosters and potentially take the account out of sync with your Auto-Roster Data. Manual changes are not affected by Auto-Roster data unless a hard sync is performed to realign the account information on your subscription with your submitted SIS data.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Bulk to Site Merge Check
body:
My name is Kevin and I am your IXL Account Specialist.

I saw that you have two separate IXL subscriptions, a classroom subscription and a site subscription. I'm writing to ask if you would like to merge the data from the classroom subscription into the larger school subscription.
closing: Please let me know if you are interested or if you have any questions!

body:

name: Translated - Alternative payments
body:
Thank you for contacting us.

Although we only accept credit or debit cards as payment for monthly memberships, we do accept alternative payment methods for yearly memberships via PayPal, check/money order, or wire transfer.

For check/money order there is an additional processing fee of $10.00 USD, and for wire transfer, there is an additional processing fee of $50.00 USD.

If you are interested in one of the alternative payment methods, please let me know the following information so I can provide further instructions:
  1. Number of children
  2. Your city and country (for BR edition and ES edition)
I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Install Firefox and Enable Flash
body:
If you are having trouble hearing the sound in your homework, then the Flash installed on your browser is not streaming the audio properly. To fix this problem, please try using a new browser.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have installed Firefox, please follow these steps to enable Flash on the Firefox browser:

1. Open the Firefox browser.
2. Click the menu button in the top right corner of the screen (looks like 3 parallel lines)
3. Click Add-ons in the menu that appears.
4. If not already highlighted in blue, click Plug-ins on the left of the page.
5. On the right of the page, find the "Shockwave Flash" plug-in.
6. Click the drop-down menu in the Shockwave Flash plug-in row and select "Always activate."
7. Close the browser to save the changes.

Once you enable Flash and use the Firefox browser to access your homework, you should be able to hear the sound in your homework.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.

name: Print student names on each paper
body:
You can have your students' names print on the left side of each sheet of paper by changing the Page Layout settings after downloading the spreadsheet. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Open your downloaded spreadsheet in Excel.
2) Click thePage Layouttab.
3) ClickPrint Titles.
4) Type$A:$A in the white box to the right of "Columns to repeat at left". This will repeat Column A with the students' names on each page.
5) ClickOK.

Once you have adjusted the layout of the spreadsheet to look the way you want it to, press Ctrl+P on your keyboard to print your spreadsheet. Each page will now show your students' names on the left-hand side.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be glad to assist.

name: Wrong Book Purchase New One
body:
I was able to check and see that the book key gives you access to "BOOK." However, it appears that your course requires access to "BOOK" instead. To complete your enrollment and submit exercises for this class, you will need this book.

You can obtain the correct book key for your class by clicking the "buy" link beneath the title of the course in your account. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. After you make your purchase and are provided a book key, please log in to your HLC account again and enter the key into your account to begin completing your work. If you have any questions about making your purchase or obtaining the correct book key from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions at all.

For now, students can access the Diagnostic by signing in to IXL.com with their mobile browser. Additionally, any practice done through the app will be tracked and taken into account by the Diagnostic when determining students' levels.

name: Accept all late assignments at once
body:
I'm happy to help.

If you would like to accept all of the late submitted assignments at once, you can do so by changing the due date of the assignment. For example, if an assignment has a due date of February 1, 2019, and several students submit the assignment on February 5, 2019, you can accept all of the late submitted assignments at once by changing the assignment due date to February 5, 2019.

To change the due date of an assignment, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for the assignment you selected.

We have a helpful info sheet for assigning activities and selecting due dates with screen shots of each of the steps in this process. I recommend taking a look at it for more information:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/assigningActivities_HLC.pdf

Please let me know if you have any questions at all!

name: External Link
body:
I'm happy to help.

It looks like you might be trying to log in to your account through an external link. If you try to log in to your account through an external link, you will receive the "Uh-oh" message.

I recommend logging in to your account from here:

http://books.quia.com

When you try logging in to your account from our website, you shouldn't have any further problems.

Please let me know if you have any questions at all!

name: Sharing quizzes on the Network
body:
You can share your quizzes on the Network by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Select the checkbox next to the quiz or folder you'd like to share.
4. Click the "Other actions" drop-down menu near the top of your list of quizzes.
5. Select Sharing: on.

The selected quizzes will then be available for your colleagues to copy or assign to their students. For more information about using the Network to share your content, you can click here.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Adding files to a quiz
body:
You can upload a FILETYPE to your Files by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Files in the left menu.
3. Click Upload.
4. Click Choose file and select the file you'd like to upload.
5. Click OK.

Once you've uploaded the FILETYPE to your Files, you can add a link to it in your quiz by following these steps:

1. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
2. Click Advanced at the top of the page.
3. Click Edit next to the quiz you'd like to modify.
4. Click the Insert drop-down menu where you'd like to add the link, then choose File.
5. Select the PDF you'd like to link from the new window that appears, then click OK.

A link to download your PDF will then appear in your quiz.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Extra credit questions
body:
In order to make a question extra credit, I suggest giving it a point value of 0 when you're creating the quiz. Then, you can "grade by question" to add extra credit points for the students who earn them.

To grade by question and award your students extra credit, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click Quizzes in the left menu.
3. Next to the quiz you'd like to grade, click Grade.
4. In the "Question Summary" section, click the pencil icon to the left of your extra credit question. This allows you to grade all of your students' responses for that question.

You can then change the values in the "Points" column to award certain students extra credit on that question.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: IP Addresses
body:
If you would like to check for any practice done at school versus home, I recommend taking a look at the times included in the "Student details" report. To view this report, please sign in to your account and click Analytics at the top of the page. Then hover your cursor over Students and select Students Details.

In the report that loads, you can select a student from the drop-down menu and their practice details, including the start and end times of each session, will be listed.

If you would still like to see the IP addresses of a user during a session, the request will need to come from your school's principal or IXL administrator. Please have your principal or IXL admin e-mail us at help@ixl.com and include the username of the student and the date and time of the sessions in question. Please ask the them to also include the case number CASENUMBER in their e-mail.

In the meantime, you should be able to avoid the issue if you tell Chrome to stop saving passwords. To do so, you can follow the instructions for "Start or stop saving passwords" here:

https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95606

https://hlc.quia.com/support

In the new request, please include the case number # and mention my name, Brendan, to ensure the ticket reaches me.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I'll be happy to help.

body:
I have now refunded the COST charge, which will take about 5-7 business days to appear on your credit card statement.

This charge was made directly from the parent profile. For further security, we suggest adding a secret word to your profile so that no other charges are made without your consent.These secret words act as a secondary password and must be entered each time the corresponding profile is accessed. For directions on how to add secret words to your profile, you can view theseinstructions.

body:
We are working to adapt the skills from science and social studies to the iPhone app. At that point, we will update the app and you will be able to access skills from all four subjects.

In the meantime, some skills from Science and Social Studies will be accessible from the iPhone if you use Safari to navigate to www.ixl.com and sign in to your account. These skills are not supported on the iPhone browser, but many of them will still be available to practice. The best way to practice science and social studies is still to use a desktop or laptop computer.

name: Assign individually
body:
At the moment, we do not have a feature that allows you to assign specific skills to one student. If you wish to direct your student to a specific skill, all of the skills on IXL have a unique letter/number designator. This makes it easy for you to relay specific skills to practice to your student.

Additionally, you can also provide the student with a direct URL to the skill through a link. Once the student has the link to the specific skill they need to work on, they'll be able to practice that skill without it being assigned to the rest of the class.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: Co-Teacher
body:
If your co-teacher has their own teacher account set up, they can add all of your students to their roster. I recommend reaching out to your school's IXL administrator,NAME,to have your co-teacher's account created.

Once your co-teacher's account has been created, they can add students to their roster and view students' practice by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin/CUSTOM and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then selectRoster.
3) Begin typing in a student's name in the space provided and a list of students will appear matching the name you've typed.
4) Click on a student's name to add them to your roster.
5) Repeat steps 3 and 4 until your roster is complete.

Your students will use the same username and password to sign in, and now both of you will have access to their practice data.

Selecting the green icon of a person's silhouette from this menu will activate Google Classroom sharing.

name: Assign Exams
body:
If you would like to assign assessments for the course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Customize" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the Book drop-down menu to select "Exploraciones 2e Assessments" and clickGo.
6. Use the section drop-down menu to navigate to the appropriate chapter and clickGo.
7. Check the gray "Use in Book" box next to an exam you want to assign.
8. Click the "Set" link to assign a due date and time limit for the exam.

Once you have followed these steps, you will have successfully assigned an exam for the course. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to our technical support team at 877-282-4400 x4. You can also ask for me by name.

name: # of diagnostic questions answered
body:
While there isn't a way to see how many questions your students have answered in the Diagnostic arena, you can tell if your students have fully diagnosed their working levels if their levels appear as a single, pinpointed number.

You can then save or print your students' individual reports by following these steps:

1) Go to https://www.ixl.com/signin/CUSTOM and sign in.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Click Diagnostic.
4) Select the desired subject.
5) Click the paper icon next to Individual student levels & recommendations to print reports for your entire class.

These reports include the date, a student’s working grade level in each mathematical or language arts strand, and skill recommendations to continue growing. The changes in a student’s overall level or in the strands indicates a student’s progress over time.

name: Update browser, do everything
body:
If you're having difficulty recording, your browser may not be allowing Flash to operate properly.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here.

If you prefer, you can switch to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to access your exercises again.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed or have updated your current browser, please use it to download and install Flash again here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Once you have an updated version of Flash on the Firefox browser, you should have no further problems with the exercises in your book.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Chargeback
body:
I checked our records and was able to verify that we received a chargeback notice from your credit card company, informing us that the cardholder did not recognize this charge and that the payment will be refunded. When this happens, access to the online book is removed unless the chargeback is canceled.

To fix this, I recommend having the cardholder reach out to the card company and let them know that the charge was authorized and that the chargeback can be canceled. Once we hear from the bank, access will be restored within 5-7 business days and you can pick up where you left off.

name: How many attempts student submitted
body:
If you would like to see how many attempts a student has used out of their maximum of 3, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://books.quia.com and sign in.
2) Click on the title of your course.
3) Navigate to the due date of the exercise you'd like to check.
4) Hover your cursor over the exercise number and click the pencil icon.
5) Scroll down to the "Student Summary" section, then click "Expand Multiple Attempts" above the list of your students.

You will see a list of all your students who submitted that exercise, along with a separate entry for each attempt. For example, if a student named George Washington submitted 2 attempts, you will see "Washington, George [2]" and "Washington, George [1]" to indicate each attempt.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Clear exam attempt thru dashboard
body:
To delete an attempt so that a student can submit the exam again, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course.
3) Locate the exam beneath your calendar, under Tuesday, April 25.
4) Hover your mouse over the exercise number of the exam: 10-EX-FB
5) Click on the pencil icon to open the grading section.
6) Scroll down to the bottom of the page to see each student's exam attempt.
7) Check the box to the left of the student whose exam you wish to clear.
8) Click the "Actions" drop-down list at the top of your list of students, then click "Delete". You will be asked to confirm that you wish to clear the scores for those exercises.

Your student will now be able to submit another attempt for that exam, as long as the exam is still open.

name: Setting default due date
body:
You can set up a default due time for each class so that whenever you assign due dates, the default due time you chose will go into effect.

You can follow these steps to set a default due time for a class.

Now whenever you select a due date for an exercise, it will also apply the specific due time you chose.
