name: PEMDAS
body:
I calculated the answer to the problem you mentioned and was able to verify that the answer is 4. I'm happy to explain.

Before we start working on the problem, let's review the order of operations for math problems. This determines which parts of the problem you should solve first:

1. Parentheses
2. Exponents
3. Multiplication or division (whichever appears first in the problem)
4. Addition or subtraction (whichever appears first in the problem)

While PEMDAS can be a helpful way of remembering the order of operations, multiplication (M) and division (D) are done together in left-to-right order.

Here's the problem you mentioned: -1 – -7 + -4 ÷ 2

Since there's a division part, we should complete that first:

-4 ÷ 2 = -2

Which gives us the simpler problem:

-1 – -7 + -2

Since only addition and subtraction remain, we can keep working from left to right:

-1 – -7 = 6

The complete problem is now:

6 + -2

And the solution is:

4
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist!

name: View Instructor ebook
body:
To open your eBook, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click on the title of your course.
3) Select "View instructor book" from the "My tools" section on the right.
4) Click on the picture of the cover to open it.

You can then view the online, page-by-page version of the book.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Unassign exercises w/out due dates
body:
I checked your gradebook and noticed that although due dates were added to the exercises you intended to assign, the remaining exercises are still marked as assigned. This is causing students' grades to appear lower in your gradebook.

To fix this, you can unassign the exercises that don't have a due date by following these steps:

1. Log in to your account at: http://hlc.quia.com
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.
closing: Let me know if you have questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: uh oh page submit from shared url
body: You received an error message after submitting your exercise because you opened the exercise from a link that was shared in an e-mail or classroom portal. To open and submit your exercises, please sign in at http://hlc.quia.com and click on the picture of your book. The Assignment Calendar will open, and you will see a list of all exercises due in the upcoming weeks. Click on an exercise title to open and complete it.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Shareit install/enable flash safari
body:
If nothing happens when you click the "Browse" button, Adobe Flash Player is either not installed or disabled by your browser. Uploading files to Share It activities requires Adobe Flash Player to be installed and enabled. As a first step, I recommend that you download and install the latest version of Flash from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.

In addition, newer versions of Mac OS X block Flash by default, even if Flash is up to date. You can follow these steps to enable Flash Player:

1. Open Safari.
2. Click the Safari menu in the top left corner.
3. Select "Preferences".
4. Click the "Security" tab.
5. Make sure that the "Allow Plug-ins" box is checked.
6. Click "Plug-in settings..."
7. Check the box next to Adobe Flash Player in the left menu.
8. Switch "When visiting other websites" at the bottom of the window to "Allow".
9. Click "Done".
10. Close the Security window.
11. Click the Safari menu and choose "Quit Safari".

You can then open Safari again and use it to upload your file to the Share It activity.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: Set Exam Access Date
body:
You can follow the steps below to assign an exam to your students:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of the course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. In the "Section" drop-down list, choose the exam for the chapter (it should say something like Chapter 1 - Exam) and click "Go".
5. Check the box underneath "Use in Book" to assign the exam.
6. Click "set" underneath "Limit dates & time" to bring up a new window that allows you to set specific times and dates that students can access the exam.

After you have specified that a test should be used in your book, you can assign it from the "Books" tab and set a due date like you would any other exercise so it'll appear on your students' calendars.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: QB incognito window chrome
body:
It sounds like there may be an add-on installed on your browser causing the site to function incorrectly. I recommend opening an Incognito Window, a feature in your Chrome browser that temporarily disables add-ons, to play these games

To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open Google Chrome.
2. Click the Chrome menu (three vertical dots) in the top-right corner of the screen.
3. Select "New incognito window."

A new window will open with a darker shaded navigation bar. Use this window to log in at http://hlc.quia.com and open the exercise again.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: Unassign chapters
body:
By default, exercises in the book are "assigned" even before you add a due date. If you want to unassign chapters you won't be covering, you can follow the steps below:

1. Log in to your account.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section (for example, Chapter 4 if you won't be covering that in class).
6. Click on the top-most checkbox to automatically check the boxes for every exercise in the chapter.
7. Click the "Actions" drop-down list and select "Unassign and clear due date".

The chapter will be unassigned and won't count towards students' scores. Please note you will need to repeat steps 5-7 for both the eSAM and Textbook Activities.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Super Recording
body:
I'm sorry to hear that you have not been able to record using other browsers and computers. I double-checked and was able to successfully submit a test recording to make sure there weren't any issues.


Would you be able to verify that you see the green and red bar move up and down as you speak into your microphone in the Flash Player settings box? This will help me narrow down what might be preventing you from recording.

If you're seeing the green and red bar move up and down in your Flash Player settings, this means your voice is being picked up, but your recording is being prevented from transmitting to our servers. If this is the case, I recommend checking your network settings to make sure port 1934 is open. Port 1934 is used by Adobe Flash Player applications, like our recording feature, for communication to and from our servers.


If you don't see the green and red bar when you speak into the microphone, the next step I recommend is using a USB microphone. USB microphones include their own built-in hardware that don't use your computer's integrated sound card, and this may resolve the issue.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Submit audio recording/no recording
body:
If you are able to play back your recording but are seeing a message that your recording was not submitted after clicking the submit button, your browser may be blocking Flash Player content from being transmitted to our servers.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/Extensions/extensions.html

If you prefer, you can switch to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this should correct the issue.

If you are not currently using Google Chrome, it is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.google.com/chrome

Click on the button to download Chrome and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Chrome installed, you can use it to access your book and you should have no further difficulties completing activities.

However, if you are having this issue while using Chrome, it may help to try the Firefox browser here:

http://firefox.com

If you continue to have difficulties in both Chrome and Firefox, your network might be blocking the recording from going through. I recommend trying your computer on another wifi network, or using a computer in your school's computer lab.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: share it enable flash chrome
body:
If nothing happens when you click the "Browse" button to upload your file, Adobe Flash Player is being blocked by your browser. Uploading files to Share It activities requires Adobe Flash Player to be enabled.

To fix this, open your exercise and click on the padlock icon at the top-left corner of your browser's address bar. From the drop-down list, go to Flash and change the value to "Always allow on this site." You may need to click the puzzle piece icon to the right of the address bar, then click "Run Flash this time."

Refresh the page to allow the settings to go into effect, then try to upload your file again.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to assist.

name: Safari Flash blocked audio
body:
Newer versions of Mac OS X block Flash by default, even once Flash is up to date. You can follow these steps to enable Flash Player:

1. Open Safari.
2. Click the Safari menu in the top left corner.
3. Select "Preferences".
4. Click the "Security" tab.
5. Make sure that the "Allow Plug-ins" box is checked.
6. Click "Plug-in settings..."
7. Check the box next to Adobe Flash Player in the left menu.
8. Switch "When visiting other websites" at the bottom of the window to "Allow".
9. Click "Done".
10. Close the Security window.
11. Click the Safari menu and choose "Quit Safari".

You can then open Safari again and you should be able to click on the record button normally. When you do, you should be prompted to give us permission to access your microphone so we can record your responses. If you don't see this prompt, or if you have any trouble submitting your recordings, you can follow these steps to ensure that Flash has access to your microphone:

1. Open a recording exercise and control-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

You should then be able to complete your recordings with no further trouble.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: Safari flash blocked
body:
If the option to record isn't appearing, Adobe Flash Player is being blocked by your browser, Safari.

You can follow the steps on the following page to enable Flash Player:

https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player/kb/enabling-flash-player-safari.html

You can then open Safari again and navigate back to your recording exercise.

When you do, click the record button that appears. You should be prompted to give us permission to access your microphone so we can record your responses. If you don't see this prompt, or if you have any trouble submitting your recordings, you can follow these steps to ensure that Flash has access to your microphone:

1. Open a recording exercise and control-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

You should then be able to complete your recordings with no further trouble.
closing: If  you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: One key over student limit
body: I checked the book key you received and noticed that it is currently at the limit of students who can use the key. I recommend asking your teacher to reach out to your school's Cengage sales representative, who can request that additional licenses be added to the key. If extra licenses are added to the key, you can enter it and begin submitting assignments.
closing: Let me know if you have questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: No record button install flash
body:
If you're not seeing a record button, Adobe Flash Player is either not installed or disabled by your browser. Audio recording activities require Adobe Flash Player to be installed and enabled. As a first step, I recommend that you download and install the latest version of Flash from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.

Once you have installed Flash, open the audio recording activity again.

If the record button still doesn't appear, please let me know which browser you are using and I can provide you with the steps you can take to make sure Flash Player is turned on in your browser.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: my alerts multiple attempts
body: You will see an alert in the "What do I need to grade" section for any exercises where a student submitted it multiple times and there's at least one submission that hasn't been graded yet. For example, I see that one of your students submitted ************ twice and only one of the attempts was graded. The alert will disappear once all attempts have been graded or you delete the other submissions.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Answer Key
body:
There isn't a traditional answer key for the online exercises, as any exercises that are computer-graded are graded automatically. The answers are included on the grading page, which you can access by hovering your cursor over an exercise number on your Dashboard and clicking on the pencil icon. Computer-graded exercises usually include short answer, fill in the blank, multiple choice, and other question types.

Some exercises are too complex to be graded automatically, usually because they're open-ended or require a student voice recording. These are indicated with a red dot in your gradebook to let you know you'll need to grade them for students to receive a score.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!

name: No audio for student exams
body:
If the audio doesn't play when a student clicks the play button, Adobe Flash Player is being blocked from running. Flash Player is used to run the audio players in exercises and exams on our site. Even if students have set their browsers to allow Flash to always run, newer browsers sometimes require that they specifically allow it to run on each exercise.

I recommend that students continue to contact us through the Technical Support form, as that will let us know the exact browser and Flash Player versions they are running so we can give specific steps they can take to fix the issue.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help. I want to make sure your students get the most out of their online books.

name: How to record
body:
For the recording exercises, the easiest way for two students to partner up and start recording is through the Voiceboard. Here are some steps they can take to link up and submit a partner recording:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the picture of the book to open it.
3. Find the exercise number you would like to complete and make note of it.
4. Click "Voiceboard" from the links at the top of the page.
5. Find your partner's name and click the invitation to connect.
6. Find the exercise number from the drop down, then click the link to open it.
7. Click the "Connect" button in the recording box to link up and be able to hear each other.
8. Click "Record" when you're ready to record. (Only one partner needs to press record, then both will record automatically)
9. Click "Stop" when you're finished.
10. Press the play button to play your recording back and make sure it sounds good.
11. Click "Submit answers" at the bottom of the page.

Your instructor will then receive your recording.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help!

name: Can't access eBook, extra book
body:
Your course is set up in a way that does not require the full iLrn package that you have purchased access to, which is why the eBook doesn't appear when you open your course.

You can still use the rest of the iLrn package independently, including the eBook, by following these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Book details" link for the package labeled "iLrn: Heinle Learning Center."
3. Click "Use book independently" and confirm it when prompted.

You can now click on the iLrn package to open the complete package and view your eBook. Please note that any work you complete in this package cannot be reviewed by your instructor, and all your graded work should be accessed by first clicking on the title of your course in your account.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know. I will be glad to assist.

name: Entered key early contact rep
body:
Once a book key is entered, the clock begins to run and there's not a way to pause or reset the timer.

I recommend that you ask your instructor to contact your school's Cengage sales representative on your behalf. Although I cannot guarantee that the extension will be approved, your sales representative may authorize us to issue you a new key to use for next semester.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: dual enrollment two classes
body:
If you will be enrolled in two classes you will need to select both classes before confirming your enrollment. You can follow these steps to enroll in both classes:

1. Go to http://ilrn.heinle.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2. Enter your username and password in the spaces provided and click "Log in."
3. Enter the course code for the other class at the top of your student workstation and click "Go".
4. Select both boxes for both the classes you want to be enrolled in online and click "Submit".

You will now be enrolled in both your classes.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: clear attempts multiple students
body:
To delete student submissions so that they can submit an exercise again, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Classes" tab.
4. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate section of the book.
5. Click on the pencil icon above the activity that has submissions you wish to delete.
6. Check the boxes next to the students you wish to remove submissions for, then click the "Actions" menu.
7. Click "Delete."

Your students will now be able to submit another attempt for that exercise.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: Chargeback
body:
I checked our records and was able to verify that we received a chargeback notice from your credit card company, informing us that the cardholder did not recognize this charge and that the payment will be refunded. When this happens, access to the online book is removed unless the chargeback is canceled.

To fix this, I recommend having the cardholder reach out to the card company and let them know that the charge was authorized and that the chargeback can be canceled. Once we hear from the bank, access will be restored within 5-7 business days and you can pick up where you left off.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Card Declined
body: As long as your card has a Visa, Discover, American Express, or MasterCard logo on it and has sufficient funds, it should be accepted on our site. However, your bank may be declining your purchase because it is trying to protect you from potentially unauthorized transactions. I recommend contacting your bank to see if they can remove any holds from your card that would prohibit you from making transactions through our site.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: No record button - Safari
body:
If you're not seeing a record button, Flash Player is either blocked or not installed on your computer. I recommend downloading and installing the latest version of Adobe Flash Player from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.

In addition, you can follow the steps on the following page to enable Flash Player:

https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player/kb/enabling-flash-player-safari.html

You can then open Safari again and navigate back to your recording exercise.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: no audio - Firefox
body:
If you're still not able to play the audio or record, Flash Player might be blocked by Firefox. To see if this is the case, click on the building block icon to the left of the address bar at the top of your screen. Click "Allow and Remember" if the option appears. If not, click "Continue allowing." You may need to refresh the page for the changes to go into effect.

However, if it continues, there may be an extension installed on your browser preventing the audio from playing. I recommend opening a "Private Window" which temporarily disables these extensions, to see if you're able to play the audio.

To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open Firefox.
2. Click the Firefox menu (three horizontal lines) in the top-right corner of the screen.
3. Select "New Private Window."

A new window will open, which you can use to return to http://hlc.quia.com and log in. Try accessing the audio again.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be glad to assist.

name: Resolved - Already started trial
body:
It looks like you have already resolved the issue and successfully started your free 3-week trial from your account.

You are now able to submit your assignments to your instructor. At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.

name: Al-Kitaab Arabic Keyboard
body:
In order to type in Arabic, you will first need to enable the Arabic language keyboard on your computer. For instructions on how to add Arabic to your Mac, please see the following instructions:

https://arabiconline.eu/adding-arabic-keyboard-mac-os/

Once you enable Arabic on your keyboard, you will be able to complete the drills in Arabic.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: Purchased Key Elsewhere - HLC
body:
I checked our records and was able to verify that the purchase you made was not from our website. I'm only able to refund purchases from our online bookstore (https://hlc.quia.com/books/bookstore.html).

Since you purchased your book key from somewhere other than our website, I recommend contacting the vendor that sold you the book key in order to request a refund.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Partner Recording issues
body:
As a first step, if you and your partner want to try recording another exercise together, I recommend that you both try opening the exercise in a different browser. Although Google Chrome usually works without any issues, if you both try another browser such as Mozilla Firefox, that will help me narrow down what might be causing the connection issues you mentioned.

Because Chrome includes its own built-in version of Flash, you may need to re-download Flash separately when attempting to record in Firefox. While browsing in Firefox, you can download and install the latest version of Flash from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation.

Once you are both in Firefox and have a fresh copy of Flash Player installed, try connecting through the Voiceboard again.

Let me know if you have any questions or run into any issues at any point, and I'll be glad to help.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions or run into any issues at any point, and I'll be glad to help.

name: Need new book edition
body:
I checked your account and see that you have access to NAME, but your instructor this semester is requiring the NAME instead. To submit activities with the way the course is currently set up, you need a new book key for the new edition of the book.

Since you purchased the older edition last semester and still have time remaining on it, I recommend that you have your instructor contact your school's publisher's sales representative on your behalf. Although I cannot guarantee that a new book key will be approved, your sales representative may authorize us to issue you a new key.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: Update Kindle Fire Tablet
body:
Here are some steps you can take to update the operating system on your Kindle Fire tablet:

Your tablet needs to be fully charged and connected to Wi-Fi before you can download the update.

1. Swipe down from the top of the screen and then tap Settings.
2. Tap Device Options.
3. Select System Updates.
4. Tap Check Now. If an update is available, it will automatically start downloading.
5. After the update is downloaded, tap Update.

Your tablet will restart during the update. After it restarts, the message "Installing system update" will appear.

Once the update has finished, open the IXL app and try practicing again.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: skillanalysis rpt explanation leves
body:
Each skill progresses in difficulty at different points, depending on the concepts and questions. Our curriculum design team carefully determines how best to scaffold the material, to determine how many levels there are on the road to mastery of the skill.

Moving students between levels is determined by the student's SmartScore in the skill. The SmartScore represents the student's current level of understanding of the skill, and determines the level of difficulty of questions the student is ready to tackle. Since the number of levels in a skill varies, there's not a pattern that maps a SmartScore to a specific level.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be glad to help.

name: Student details report
body:
You can print out the "Student details" report with separate pages for each student by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.ixl.com and log in.
2. Click Analytics at the top of the page.
3. Select Students from the report options at the top.
4. Click on a student's name to view the Student details report. (You can click on any student's name, as the option to print for all students appears on the next page)
5. Click the printer icon next to the Student details title, and select the option Print reports for all students to generate a PDF with a separate page for each student on your roster.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help.

name: iPad -remove custom domain
body:
You can follow these steps to remove the custom domain from the memory of the iPad app.

1. On the home screen of your iPad, tap the "Settings" icon.
2. In the list of settings in the left menu, scroll down and tap "IXL".
3. In the right menu, make sure that "Remember Me" is turned off.
4. Tap the field labeled "Custom Sign-in @" and erase the custom domain text.

The next time you return to IXL on your app you will be able to sign in from either child's account.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.

name: iPad can't sign in cookies
body:
The reason you see the message about the practice limit is because your web browser is not allowing our site to set cookies on your device, preventing you from being able to sign in. A cookie is a small file saved to your computer, which we use to record the fact that you are signed in successfully. To allow cookies from our site so that you may sign in, please follow these steps:

1. From the home screen of your iPad, choose "Settings".
2. Choose "Safari" from the left menu.
3. Make sure that "Block Cookies" is set to "Allow from Websites I Visit".

Once you have enabled cookies from our site, you will be able to sign in with no further trouble and will be able to practice an unlimited number of maths questions.

However, the IXL iPad app, available for free in the App Store, is the best way to practice on the iPad. If you use the app instead of our full site on the Safari browser, it will resolve this issue and provide a much smoother experience while practicing with your tablet.

You can download our app for free by searching the App Store for "IXL practice" or by visiting our home page on your iPad and tapping on the link at the top of the page for the app.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

name: Student Workstation
body:
It sounds as if you are viewing the instructor workstation instead of the student workstation. If you view the student workstation, you will not be asked to enter another book key. You will also be able to see your courses and work on your assignments.

You can view your student workstation by logging in to your account and clicking the "Student workstation" link in the upper-right corner of the page. You should then have no further issues.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Student Workstation
body:
It sounds as if you are viewing the instructor workstation instead of the student workstation. If you view the student workstation, you will not be asked to enter another book key. You will also be able to see your courses and work on your assignments.

You can view your student workstation by logging in to your account and clicking the "Student workstation" link in the upper-right corner of the page. You should then have no further issues.

name: Split subjects for different kids
body:
With a family membership, all children on the account have access to the same subjects. There are two different options you could consider:
  • One membership - NUMBER children with SUBJECTS - PRICE per TIME
  • Two separate memberships - TOTAL PRICE per TIME
    • NUMBER child with SUBJECT - PRICE per TIME
    • NUMBER child with SUBJECT - PRICE per TIME
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help.

name: Multiple accounts
body: I found your book saved under an account with a different email address. I have sent a link to your @EMAIL address to help you choose a new password and log in to your account. Please check that email inbox to access the link.<br clear="none" /><br clear="none" />If needed, you can update your account details by clicking on "Profile" at the top page after logging into your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Mindtap questions

http://www.cengage.com/repfinder/

Cengage Support can also be reached directly at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706. They will be better able to answer your questions about your book "Nexos".

body:
While we do not have English awards available on our Android app at this time, we do plan to add Awards to our app in the future. In the meantime, language arts awards are available from our site and are accessible from any web browser.

To access all of your child's awards, sign in to your account using a web browser at IXL.com and click on Awards at the top of the page. You will then be able to use the menus at the top of the page to select a subject or grade level.

name: Limbo Troubleshoot/ comp Month
body:
I apologize for the confusion. It appears there was a technical issue when you registered for IXL, and I have reported this to our engineers so they can investigate.

To help me report the issue to the engineers, if you are able to answer these questions, that would be very helpful!
  • What screen did you see after confirming payment? Is the "Become a Member" screen showing?
In the meantime, I will be happy to help you get started on IXL. You will first need to cancel your Apple iTunes purchase so you are not charged for an account you cannot access.

To cancel your App Store membership, you can reference these cancellation instructions from Apple.

Once you have canceled this account, I will set you up with a membership through IXL.com with a complimentary month of access.

Please let me know the following information so I can create the account:
  • Subjects you want to purchase (ex: math, language arts, science (US only), social studies (US only))
  • Number of children
  • Country edition (ex: US, UK, Canada, etc.)
  • Desired username
closing: I look forward to hearing from you.

name: 8.13 AR Account Incorrect Data
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us
body:
I understand that there is an issue with the data on your IXL account. Since your account is managed by Auto-Rostering, all of your data is updated by syncing with files from your SIS system.

In order to best address the issue with your data, can you please answer any of the following questions?

What specific teachers are affected by this issue?

What specific classes are affected by this issue?

What specific students are affected by this issue?

This information will help us determine the source of the issue and provide the best solution for your account.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Deactivate student book key
body: I was able to look into this further, and it appears that your book key has been deactivated due to a cancelled order from Cengage. If you believe this is in error, I recommend reaching out to Cengage at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 with your order number ready. Once you provide them with that order number, they will be able to determine why the order was cancelled and why the book key was deactivated.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: What is the IXL Diagnostic? Teacher
body:
The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is designed to tell you exactly what students know and what to do next to help them improve by revealing your students’ working grade levels. It also helps you plan for small-group instruction by grouping students working at similar levels and displaying the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups.

To help your students get started, have them go to IXL.com to sign in and click Diagnostic. We recommend that students initially aim to answer 50-85 questions per subject to reveal complete Diagnostic data, which doesn’t have to be done in one sitting. Once complete data is revealed, students can answer 10-15 diagnostic questions per week to keep the IXL Continuous Diagnostic up to date.

You’ll know students have revealed completed Diagnostic data when their working grade levels narrow down to a single number, showing their level in each strand as well as their overall level. For example, a level of 500 indicates readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills.

To view your students’ Diagnostic data sign in, click Analytics and select Diagnostic. You will then be directed to the Diagnostic Overview where you can view and print your students’ detailed results. To view your students grouped by common skill recommendations, click on any of the strands listed on the top menu to view the Diagnostic Strand Analysis.

If you’d like, you can learn more about the IXL Continuous Diagnostic by viewing our QuickStart guide here.
closing: If you have questions, please let me know. I will be happy to help!

name: Extend book access
body:
To extend your book access, you will need to enter an iLrn book key. iLrn book keys are 19-character codes that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S." Once you have entered your book key, it will automatically be linked to your course and you will be able to continue completing and submitting assignments without losing any progress.

To purchase a book key, log in to your account and click on the "Extend" link for the book you need. This will take you to the Cengage website, where you can purchase the needed access for your book. For any questions about making your purchase or obtaining your book key from Cengage, please reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for assistance.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions, and I'll be happy to help.

name: Want to start a group of families
body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL!

IXL is not set up to be shared between different families. Instead, we recommend that families purchase their own membership for the best possible experience on IXL. This gives each family greater control over their account as well as helps to ensure the security of their billing information and the confidentiality of their children’s practice.

Each family membership is registered to a single e-mail address and includes one Parent profile only which allows the parent to make changes to the account. This profile will also receive all of the e-mail reports and updates on the account, allowing you to receive direct feedback each week on your child's progress. The parent profile also stores all of the billing information, settings, and detailed Analytics for each child on the membership.

With these factors in mind, we don't offer group rates for families. Our larger memberships are designed for teachers who are using it in their classrooms.
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you. You may also call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET, please feel free to ask for me by name!

name: Refund - Already spoke to bank
body:
I'm happy to help your family.

When speaking with your financial institution, did you formally dispute the charge? If you did, we will cooperate with them to ensure you are compensated. If you did not, we can process the refunds on our end.

Please let me know what steps have already been taken so we can properly reimburse your family.
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: What is Diagnostic (parent/child)
body:
The diagnostic is designed to pinpoint your child's working grade levels, providing insights on their ongoing growth and improvement in specific strands, as well as their level overall. In addition, it will tell you exactly what to do next to help them improve with individualized skill recommendations.

To start, your child can sign in to their account and click on "Diagnostic" at the top of the page. Once your child has initially completed the diagnostic by narrowing their working grade levels to a single number in every strand, we recommend that they answer about 10-15 diagnostic questions per week to keep their Diagnostic data and individualized skill recommendations up to date.

When the Diagnostic is up-to-date, you can think of the working grade levels as indicators of your child's current level of understanding, pinpointing what they are ready to learn next. For example, a Diagnostic level of 500 would indicate readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I'm always happy to help!

name: Science SmartScore vs Tokens
body: IXL's science skills don't always increase in complexity in a linear way. So instead of showing students their SmartScore throughout science practice, we show them where they are at in a particular stage or challenge, which gives them a better sense of their progress on that skill.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be glad to assist!

name: Refund - advocate for more
body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm happy to refund the charge.

Although we do our best to indicate that our memberships are set to renew automatically, it seems that this was not clear and I apologize for the confusion. It looks like we didn't receive a cancellation request, and as a result your membership remained active.

I have canceled your membership and there will be no further charges. I have also refunded the last 24 monthly charges of AMOUNT (total AMOUNT). Please allow 5-7 business days for these refunds to appear on your card statement.

While this is as far back as our system will allow for refunds, I am happy to advocate for your family and will request the additional refunds from our director.

In order to make this request, we need some additional contact information. If approved, the additional refunds may be sent as a check. Can you please tell me the full name that the check should be made out to and the mailing address the check should be sent to?

name: Renew through iTunes
body:
I'm happy to guide you renewing your IXL membership. I see that you subscribed through the IXL app, purchasing your membership from iTunes.

If you would like to resubscribe, you can go to https://apps.apple.com/account/subscriptions to manage your subscription.

You can also use the steps below.

On your iPad or iPhone:
  1. Tap Settings on your home screen.
  2. Tap iTunes & App Store.
  3. Tap on your Apple ID.
  4. Tap View Apple ID. (You may be prompted to sign in to the iTunes store. Enter your password or fingerprint ID.)
  5. Tap Subscriptions.
  6. Scroll down to the Expired section.
  7. Tap on IXL.
  8. Tap your desired subscription option.
  9. Enter your Apple ID password or fingerprint ID when prompted.
From iTunes on a computer:
  1. Sign in to your iTunes account.
  2. On the top menu bar, click Account.
  3. Select View My Account. (You may be prompted to sign in again. Enter your password, and click OK.)
  4. Scroll down to the Settings section.
  5. Next to Subscriptions, click Manage.
  6. In the Expired section, click edit to the right of IXL.
  7. Select your desired subscription option.
  8. Enter your Apple ID password when prompted.
  9. Click Done.
Once you have renewed the IXL membership, it will automatically renew monthly until you cancel it again.
closing: Please let me know if I can help any further.

name: Want more than 10 children/students
body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL! We have a few different types of memberships, so I'd like to learn more about your group so I can best advise.

How do your members plan to use IXL? Do you have a teacher/tutor working directly with the students? How do you find your members? Do you have a website or public social media? Do you expect your membership to grow during the year?
closing: I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Want more than 10 (reply OK-month)
body:
Thanks for the reply. A classroom membership might be better fit for you and your students if you are able to commit to a yearly membership instead of your current monthly membership. Classroom licenses start at 25 students and would only be AMOUNT for the year compared to AMOUNT that you are currently paying for NUMBER students for only one month.

If you are able to commit to the yearly membership and want to switch to a classroom license I can help you with the transition so your students will not lose their past practice or awards. There are also other features of a classroom membership that benefit teachers and if you are interested I can go into more detail.

If you need to stick with the monthly membership, I can add the NUMBER children to your family membership. The prorated cost to do so is AMOUNT for the remainder of your billing period. When your membership renews on DATE the new cost will be AMOUNT per month.
closing: Please let me know your thoughts and how I can best assist you and your students.

body:
While it’s possible to reset students’ scores back to 0, you do have a couple of options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! Our skills are designed to naturally adjust to students' current levels of understanding even if they’ve practiced before. If they mastered a skill previously, the SmartScore will reset to 0 automatically when they begin practicing again.

To allow students to demonstrate their understanding in previously practiced skills, we recommend having them practice 20 questions or until they reach mastery, whichever comes first. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options at the top of your reports to monitor their current progress.

2) Reset SmartScores. When skills are reset, students will see a score of 0 on that skill, but their awards, and certificates will remain unchanged.

If you'd like to proceed with resetting skills, please let me know which students and skills to reset.

Thank you for contacting us about clearing student scores. While it is possible to clear data, we have a new option to reset SmartScores which preserves student data so you have a couple of options to get the most out of IXL.:

1) Clear the practice data. We strongly advise against clearing practice data, as it erases essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”

2) Reset SmartScores. When skills are reset, students will see a score of 0 on that skill, but their awards, and certificates will remain unchanged. Initially, teachers may notice that counts of questions answered, time spent, and skills mastered/excellent will fall, as if the reset skills have never been practiced. The exception to this is when teachers set their date range to "All time". With an "All time" date range, teachers will continue to see question counts and other data that reflect all past student work.

If you’d like to proceed with either of these options, please let me know which students and subjects and I will begin the process of updating the accounts.

name: SmartScore for mastery
body: The SmartScore is an up-to-the-minute measure of a student’s progress toward mastery, so you can think of 0-70 as practicing or learning a skill, 71-90 as refining a skill with questions of mid- and high-level rigor, and 91-100 as working through difficult questions to cement mastery. As a result, the SmartScore will go up and down at different rates as students progress through a skill.<br clear="none" /><br clear="none" />Most skills are considered mastered when a student achieves a SmartScore of 100. However, some skills in Science and Social Studies have a maximum SmartScore of 97.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Change zoom on Chrome
body:
If words and images on the IXL website seem small, your browser's zoom setting may be set below 100%. I recommend setting your browser's zoom setting to 100% so all of the text on the IXL website is readable.

To change your zoom settings on Chrome, please follow these steps:

1) Open Google Chrome.
2) Click the three vertical dots in the upper right corner of your screen.
3) Click Settings.
4) Click the drop-down menu next to Page zoom and select 100%.

The font size and images on the IXL website should be back to normal.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Reduce/limit questions to mastery
body:
Since the number of questions it takes to master a skill varies with every child, there isn't a way to adjust the number of questions a child has to answer to achieve mastery in a skill.

A skill is considered mastered when the child's SmartScore reaches 100. When a child starts practicing a skill, the SmartScore starts at 0. As they answer questions correctly, the SmartScore increases. If a question is answered incorrectly, the score decreases.As a result, the SmartScore will go up and down at different rates as the child progresses through a skill.

However, the SmartScore is not just based on the percentage of questions correct. It is calculated using many factors, including the number of questions completed, question difficulty, and consistency, and offers superior accuracy in assessing a child's achievement.

When a child first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that the child has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge the child to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit. Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

I hope that you enjoyed using IXL, and I'm sorry to see you go. All of your practice and awards will be saved, so if you choose to renew at a later date, you can pick up where you left off.

name: No data in weekly reports
body:
The weekly reports you receive reflect the work of the students on your roster. Taking a look, I see you have not yet added students to your roster. Once you've added them, your weekly reports will show their progress.

You can add students to your roster by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.
3) Begin typing in a student's name in the space provided and a list of students will appear matching the name you've typed.
4) Click on a student's name to add them to your roster.
5) Repeat steps 3 and 4 until your roster is complete.

After you have added your students, you will also be able to see their progress at any time in the Analytics reports in your account.

name: SmartScore prevents progress
body:
How quickly a student progresses in a skill depends on several factors, including questions answered correctly and incorrectly, question difficulty, recent answers, and consistency.

Since students learn at different rates, their SmartScores will go up and down to reflect their progress. Questions gradually increase in difficulty as a student answers correctly and decrease in difficulty if a student answers incorrectly. This generates questions appropriate to the student's personal level of understanding.

When the SmartScore is between 0-70, we consider students to be learning and practicing a skill. As they build confidence in these early stages of a skill, there will be large SmartScore increases for correct answers and low penalties for incorrect answers.

Once they reach a SmartScore of 90, however, students will enter the Challenge Zone. Questions in this stage will be rigorous, and students must prove that they can consistently answer these questions correctly in order to achieve mastery (100). Throughout the Challenge Zone, SmartScore increases for correct answers will be small (1-2 points) and penalties for incorrect answers will be larger (3-8 points). Students may need to answer as many as 10 questions correctly in a row to achieve mastery.

If you would like to try using IXL to see how the SmartScore works, IXL allows guests to practice up to 10 free questions per subject each day.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it’s more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676 x3 from 5 AM to 5 PM PST, Monday through Friday. I am happy to help!

name: C/R confirm
body:
I see you have canceled your membership, so you will no longer be charged. You can continue to access your membership until it expires on DATE.

I hope that you enjoyed using IXL, and I'm sorry to see you go. All of your practice and awards will be saved, so if you choose to renew ﻿at a later date, you can pick up where you left off.

name: Waiting for Customer template
body: I haven't heard back from you for a little while, so I wanted to check in to see if I may still be of assistance. If so, please feel free to let me know and I'll be glad to help.

name: Translated - What is IXL?
body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL!

IXL is designed to fit the needs of students at all levels. Our flexible curriculum allows every child to have a customized experience, building their mastery in math.

IXL gives you access to all levels, so your students will have the option to review previously studied material or move ahead to new topics at any time. As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing explanations whenever they answer incorrectly.

We also offer 20 questions for free in each subject per day so you can see if IXL is a good fit for you.

Once you have created a membership, your students will have access to unlimited practice and you will have access to IXL Analytics, which allows you to monitor how much time your students spend on IXL, and their scores.

name: Professional Learning Request
body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL's professional learning. I see you have a family membership with us. There are a few of our live, 30-minute, complimentary webinars that families may find helpful. While these webinars are designed for teachers, they are applicable to a family membership as the content and features are similar.
  • IXL Curriculum and Guidance - Learn simple strategies for getting your students started in IXL’s comprehensive K-12 curriculum.
  • IXL Continuous Diagnostic - Discover how you can drive progress faster with the Continuous Diagnostic’s up-to-the-minute analysis of every student.
You can view the schedule and register for any of these webinars from the following link: https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/webinar-schedule

If you decide to attend a session, let me know and I'll let the presenter know a parent is attending.
closing: I'm happy to talk more about these sessions or answer any questions you have!

name: Star Feature
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
You can suggest skills to all students on your roster by highlighting them from the practice pages. To do so, please follow the steps below:

Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin ﻿and sign in.
Click on Learning at the top of the page and then select a subject (e.g. Math or Science).
Click to select the appropriate grade from the tabs on the left. This opens the list of all skills available in that grade.
Move your mouse to the left of the graph icon of a skill you wish to assign. An outline of a star will become visible.
Click the star to color it gold and highlight that skill for students to practice.

When your students sign in to ixl.com and view their skills, they will see stars next to the skills you have selected.

While we host your online book and course, your book key was provided directly from the publisher, Cengage, so you will need to reach out to them at http://support.cengage.com or (800) 354-9706 for any assistance with the book key you bought from them.

name: Website shutting down IXL
body: Since IXL only operates in the browser, there is not a way for our website to shutdown a computer's operating system. If you are experiencing an issue with the computer shutting down, I recommend contacting a computer technician to see if there is an issue with the computer's software or hardware systems. A computer technician will be able to properly diagnose any problems and offer solutions to help remedy the issue you are experiencing.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: One student, two classes
body: Students can only be assigned to a single class on a teacher's roster. If you have a teacher who wants to assign students to more than one class, you can add a free additional teacher account for them with a new roster. While students can't be in multiple classes on the same roster, they can be on multiple rosters. This would allow the teacher to assign students to multiple classes and view their progress in those classes.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

name: Purchase Order Requisition Form
body: We received documents today sent from your school involving an IXL account. IXL requires a copy of the Purchase Order to begin the payment process. We cannot accept the request for the Purchase Order. Once you have the PO finalized, the quickest way to get it into our system is to scan the document and e-mail it to orders@ixl.com. Please be sure to include your account number or quote number on the PO so that we can process it quickly.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions.

name: Example questions
body:
IXL offers an example question and explanation at the beginning of each skill. To view an example, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2. Click Learning at the top of the page, then choose a subject (e.g. Math or Language arts).
3. Click to select an appropriate grade from the tabs on the left. This opens the list of all skills available in that grade.
4. Click on the name of the skill you'd like your child to practice.
5. Above the question that's displayed, click the "Learn with an example" link.

Once your child is finished reviewing the example, they can click the "Back to practice" link at the top.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help.

name: No English awards in app - update
body:
You should be able to fix the issue with your iPad app not showing your language arts awards by reinstalling the latest version of the app. To do so, please follow these steps to uninstall the app, restart your iPad, and reinstall the app:

1) On the home screen of your iPad, tap and hold the IXL icon.
2) Tap the X in the top-left corner of the icon once it appears.
3) Turn off your iPad by holding the power button and then sliding the prompt to turn off your iPad when it appears.
4) Turn on your iPad by pressing the power button.
5) Reinstall the app by going to www.ixl.com or by searching for IXL in the App store.

When you open the app and sign in again, you will be able to view all of your language arts awards.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions. I will be happy to help!

name: SAT alignments
greeting: Thank you for you interest in IXL’s new test preparation alignments!
body:
Currently, we provide alignments for the ACT and NWEA MAP Growth. While we may add SAT alignments in the future, we do not have a release timeline.

We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our site and we rely on insights from our customers to guide our planning as IXL grows.
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help!

name: ACT Alignments
body:
IXL now provides test preparation alignments for the ACT. These alignments guide students to the IXL skills that will help them achieve their target ACT score.

You can view IXL’s ACT alignments for Math, English, and Reading by clicking the following link: https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/curriculum-alignments#test-preparation-alignments﻿
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help.

name: NWEA MAP Growth Alignments
greeting: Thank you for you interest in IXL’s new test preparation alignments!
body:
IXL now provides test preparation alignments for the NWEA MAP Growth. These alignments guide students to the IXL skills that will help them achieve their target RIT score.

You can view IXL’s alignments for math K-2, 2-5, and 6+ by clicking the following link:https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/curriculum-alignments#test-preparation-alignments
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions. I am happy to help!

name: Self Harm
body:
I'm reaching out to you today to let you know that we received the below message from a person signed in to the IXL account USERNAME provided to CHILD’S NAME. We are concerned about the content of the message for the student's sake and want to bring it to your attention.

Please confirm that you received this message. We trust that you will look into this matter and handle it in a way you feel is appropriate.
closing: If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know and I'll be happy to help.

name: Is IXL aligned with NWEA?
body:
IXL math skills are aligned with NWEA Map growth assessment. To view this alignment in greater detail, please click on the following link:

https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/curriculum-alignments#test-preparation-alignments
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions!

name: Jump a Level
body: Jump a Level allows teachers to quickly preview the full contents of a skill. This feature will serve as a useful lesson planning tool so you can better understand how IXL skills are scaffolded. As you jump to harder questions, the displayed SmartScore will increase accordingly. You can still answer questions at any time, and will still receive immediate feedback including explanations. When you answer incorrectly, the SmartScore will still decrease as usual.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions!

name: Partnerships
body: IXL is not researching any external partnerships at this time.
closing: Thank you for your interest in IXL.

name: Progress and Growth
body:
If your students have pinpointed their Diagnostic levels at least twice this year, your "Progress and growth" report will show their growth over the course of the year. To view this report, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Hover your cursor over Progress, and then click Progress and growth.

You can then scroll down to see a list of your students and their Diagnostic growth in each subject will be listed to the far right of their names.
closing: Please let me know if you have questions. I will be happy to help!

name: Referral Program
body: I'm glad to hear you would like to be an advocate of IXL! We have a new affiliate program where you can provide discounts to your followers and earn referral bonuses. For more information and to register, visit the following link: https://ixl.pointclicktrack.com.
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you.

name: Adding a Co-Teacher
body:
If your co-teacher adds your shared students to their teacher roster, both of you will be able to see your students' Analytics. If your co-teacher already has an IXL account, they can add your students to their roster by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to her name in the top-right corner to open the account menu, then select Roster.
3) Begin typing in a student's name in the space provided and a list of students will appear matching the name she's typed.
4) Click on a student's name to add them to the roster.
5) Repeat steps 3 and 4 until the roster is complete.

When your co-teacher views their Analytics, they will then see your shared students' work.
closing: If your co-teacher does not have an IXL account or you have questions, please let me know. I'll be happy to help!

name: Clever Messaging: Initial Inquiry
body:
At this time, IXL is working with Clever on a limited basis only. However, we offer a number of options to effectively support auto-rostering and SSO for your schools.

Single sign-on: IXL supports SSO through Google and Classlink.

Auto-rostering: IXL also provides secure sync for automatic roster management. We can also provide auto-rostering through Classlink and OneRoster protocols.

IXL’s SSO and secure sync setup is complementary, and our team will partner directly with you to get your integration up and running. Please let me know if you would like us to put you in touch with our account services team to discuss these options in greater detail.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions!

name: Clever: Insistent
body: We have limited space in our Clever trial, so I’ll have to check with my manager to see if there is any possibility of us accommodating your district. I will get back to you as soon as possible.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions!
